Text: Packback’s cofounder and Chief Product Officer is seeking a Content Coordinator / Executive Assistant to help scale efforts related to our product research and strategic communication.This role is intended to provide a substantial 1.) acceleration and 2.) process orientation to the production of Packback’s content strategy, as well as enabling Packback's Chief Product Officer to increase the depth and research of our customer research and communication. In this role, you will be working to build the future of Packback's brand and establish Packback as a leader not just in education technology, but in student-centered pedagogy as well.A perfect fit for this role is someone who is a balance of a creative and strategic written communicator, and an exceptionally organized and efficient project planner. You will enjoy this role if you enjoy taking responsibility and looking for new ways to push projects further, coordinating multiple people on a project to get to the desired outcome, thinking creatively and strategically about how to get a message across in writing (whether on social, in a blog, or in an email). NOTE: This role is being offered as a 6-month contract-to-hire position, with a strong intention convert to a permanent pending a good fit in the role. The role may be moved to full-time shorter than the 6-month contract window, based on performance.Duties of the role include:Acting as an assistant to Packback’s CPO on product and brand projects:Coordinate successful completion of brand projects Email or phone outreach to secure coauthors, panelists, quotes, etc. required for the content strategy from our professor userbase. Manage accountability to “To do’s” in PR and Strategic Communications queue, by checking in with appropriate parties on a set schedule. Assist in research and literature review for OpEds, Manuscripts and research Assist in the coordination of assets required for progressing research and larger-scale brand projects (research whitepapers, ebooks) Webinar operations support Facilitate wider reach for product research and feedback Coordinate user interviews with professors and students Send follow-ups/thank yous after interviews are completed, including payment Flexible assistance with schedule management, feedback facilitation, and follow-ups as the need arises. Look for ways actively to protect the CPO’s time and focus on product research, brand, and strategic communication Look for cases where CPO is being pulled into granular duties that detract from the highest impact actions (E.g. Being tagged in questions that could be answered with a more systematic approach; coordinate to get the answer from CPO and own publishing the answer in the help center or intranet.) Planned Social Media Content: Manage and maintain a cohesive, multi-platform (Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin) social posting calendar of planned content in line with brand voice guidelines planned and approved in advance by no less than 2 weeks. Monitor and iterate social content based on engagement statistics. Monitor educational news and national/world news to propose unplanned/reactive content for our social platforms, in line with brand voice. Iterate on social media strategy to incorporate new tools and approaches to improve engagement metrics. Social media community management and engagement: Monitor social and traditional media using automated alerts for people mentioning Packback directly, mentioning the need for online discussion, and other brand-relevant topics. Reply/Engage directly when appropriate. Identify potential leads from social media and track in a lead list shared with Sales/EM management. Manage posting owned and earned content to the Packback blog Timely sharing of earned media and contributed content opportunities as features on our blog, following the established paradigm Execute the posting/scheduling of blog content provided to you (post, image, tags) Participate in the creation and coordination of blog content, ranging from research assistance to outline creation to drafting, depending on project Requirements: 2 years minimum professional work experience in a transferable field (journalism, social media marketing, content coordination, project coordination, or acting as an executive assistant) or demonstrated equivalent experience Extreme accountability, ownership, and results-orientation demonstrated in past work experiences, with references available to verify Effective written business communication skills to coordinate stakeholders on projects and inspire action Social media, journalism, or content creation experience that demonstrates a clear understanding of using written communication to articulate ideas clearly, offer value to readers, and inspire action around a “call to action” A passion for project management and organization, and comfort holding senior team members and external clients accountable to delivery dates and project timelines Experience with journalistic or academic research is a plus as this individual will likely support large-scale content projects as a research assistant What is Packback?Packback exists to awaken and fuel lifelong curiosity in every student. We are a social learning platform powered by a proprietary A.I. that college professors use to help their students fall in love with the subject matter, drive personalized learning, and most importantly, quantify and improve student critical thinking skills. Packback has served over a quarter million students since the launch of our flagship product, Packback Questions, in late 2016.Named as a 2014 Chicago Innovation Award winner, Packback has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, Forbes, the New York Times, Chicago Tribune, and the Washington Post, while its founders have been named as Crain’s Chicago 20 in their 20’s, the Techweek 100, and Chicago Inno’s 50 on Fire.Job Details & BenefitsStart Date: September 1, 2020 Employment Type: 6-month contract-to-hire, with potential to move to full-time hire sooner than 6-months based on performance.Competitive Salary: Our salary ranges are competitive, and have clear expectations for professional growth.Remote Flexible work environment: Our office is located in downtown Chicago, but we are happy to consider partially or fully remote team members for this role.A culture that you can be proud to build: We work hard at building a culture of curiosity and continuous learning at Packback, where every voice matters and can make an enormous impact on the business.A company that invests in you and your family: Packback offers 6 weeks fully paid, gender non-specific extended leave policy (for either parent welcoming a new child through birth or adoption, to care for a family member in need, or for bereavement).Benefits for your health and well-being: Health insurance, Short-term disability insurance; option for dental, vision, and life, Health Savings Account, and Commuter Benefits Account.Flexible "Unlimited" Vacation Policy: Packback offers a flexible vacation policy, with a minimum of 10 vacation days recommended. We really want our employees to take time for travel, discovery, and self-care.Cultural programming: Access to creative and educational events hosted both virtually and (when possible again) at the Packback office, like Makespace and "A more curious Chicago"And of course, our office pup, Pepper!Our commitment to diversity:Working in the Education Technology space, Packback believes it is an ethical necessity for us to work to build a diverse and inclusive team, to help us better consider the needs of our diverse audience of students with a wide range of educational backgrounds and educational needs.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  Powered by JazzHR 6Ma3zQJUtt

Text: Important Note: During the application process, ensure your contact information (email and phone number) is up to date and upload your current resume when submitting your application for consideration. To participate in some selection activities you will need to respond to an invitation. The invitation can be sent by both email and text message. In order to receive text message invitations, your profile must include a mobile phone number designated as “Personal Cell” or “Cellular” in the contact information of your application. At Wells Fargo, we want to satisfy our customers’ financial needs and help them succeed financially. We’re looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. Join our diverse and inclusive team where you’ll feel valued and inspired to contribute your unique skills and experience. Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you. Consumer Banking is an industry leader in supporting homeowners and consumers, in addition to operating one of the most extensive banking franchises in the country. We serve mass market, affluent, and small business customers; as well as provide home and personal lending. Our focus is on delivering an exceptional experience for our customers through financial advice and guidance coupled with providing the products and services that will help them realize their financial hopes and dreams. We’ve built our team of top professionals by rewarding their accomplishments and ensuring they have what's needed to succeed. Our Customer Account Management (CAM) Team focuses on the customer and strives for operational excellence in servicing mortgage loans and home equity products for our customers. The Business Support Consultant 3 role will be a subject matter expert for the Statements & Year-End Management Team within CAM specific to Wells Fargo Home Mortgage and Home Equity customer communication (ex: billing, escrow, and year-end tax statements, and IRS/state tax reporting). This individual will drive tax year-end regulatory, compliance, and enhancement changes and challenge the team and business partners to find more efficient and improved solutions and processes. Excellent communication skills and the ability to manage/prioritize multiple tasks at the same time are critical. This individual will report to Heather Russell. The position will include, but not be limited to, the below functions: Leads diverse functions and operations/production oversight for WFHM and WFHE Collaborates with management, senior leaders, business partners, Consumer Control, Legal, and Corporate Tax on strategic, cost effective solutions and business performance improvement opportunities Utilizes thorough knowledge of the business's functional areas and products to implement key initiatives for the business Additional Responsibilities include: Develops and manages line of business and partner relationships Writes business requirements and test scripts, executes test scripts, resolves issues, and communicates with stakeholders Acts as a liaison between line of business and technical organization by planning, conducting, and directing the analysis of complex problems to be solved with automated systems Defines, analyzes, and audits business process flows, practices, data, and loan level detail, and suggests alternative solutions for process and data integrity improvement Provides technical expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective, meet business requirements, and mitigate risk Provides direction and/or guidance to peers Please Note: Based on the volume of applications received, this job posting may be removed prior to the indicated close date. Text: NOTE: If you are a current NC State Government employee, you will not be considered for a temporary assignment. Temporary Solutions cannot accommodate dual employment.This temporary position is located in Raleigh – Wake County. There are no leave or retirement benefits offered. This position is currently remote but will be expected to work on Dix Campus when normal business operations resume. This position will work an average of 25 hours per week.Hourly Rate: $22.21 (Pay rates are based on education, experience, equity, and budget)The Office of Compliance and Program Integrity (OCPI), Division of Health Benefits, ensures Medicaid funds are utilized appropriately by reducing or eliminating fraud, waste, and abuse through the NC Medicaid Program. The Quality Assurance Section, in OCPI, is responsible for conducting reviews of recipient eligibility determinations conducted in the local Department of Social Services (DSS). The Quality Assurance Section prepares data reports on eligibility errors identified during the reviews. The collection of data is used to identify error trends and activities and focus on the areas identified. Statistical data is used to present training to counties on quality control findings, trends, and activities. The goal is to capture the accuracy and quality rate of each of the county DSS offices.The primary purpose of this position is to serve as the data analyst liaison for OCPI/QA area and to understand and anticipate technology for section needs, and translate those needs into requirements that will develop a data visualization tool to effectively track issues, trends, patterns, accuracy rate, audit counts, internal control risks, inconsistencies, problems, and opportunities. The incumbent will be proactive in understanding business processes and policies and will partner with business areas to plan, coordinate, and assist in the implementation of required technology and information changes. This position will be responsible for gathering and collecting the audit data for input into Legislative requirements, planning sessions on revised tools, handling change requests, and troubleshooting issues with software tracking systems. To receive credit for all of your work history and credentials, you must list the information on the application form. Any information listed under the text resume section or on an attachment will not be considered for qualifying credit. Qualified applicants must document on the application that they possess all of the following: Strong proficiency with Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access Strong proficiency with Tableau, Python, and SAS Strong understanding of healthcare strategy, operations, technology and regulatory requirements Strong knowledge of information technology applications, processes, software, and equipment Excellent communication, negotiation, conflict resolution, and persuasion abilities Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external partners Ability to work independently and assess project and assignment requirements Demonstrated project management experience  Bachelor's degree from appropriately accredited institution in a discipline related to the area of assignment with two years of programmatic experience related to the area of assignment; or an equivalent combination of training and experience.

Text: About Us On the off chance you've thought about insurance, it's likely because you've insured something you love, not because you loved your insurance company. Metromile is out to change that. As an insurtech powered by data science and customer centric-design, we're building a community of drivers who come for the savings and stay for the experience. With technology at its core, Metromile is reimagining insurance to make it fairer and actually delightful. We're obsessed with savings, service, and features - street sweeping alerts, monthly mileage summaries, fuel trackers and more - that engage a customer all along their journey. We're on the forefront of disrupting a $250 billion auto insurance category that has gone unchanged for over 80 years. Metromile's diverse team combines the best of Silicon Valley technologists with veterans from Fortune 500 insurers and financial services giants. This management structure ensures that the business is focused on growth, customer experience and technology innovation while also balancing unit economics and profitability. The team is growing quickly across its San Francisco, Tempe, and Boston offices. Our customer service, claims, and sales teams are all based in-house in the US. Named a Glassdoor Best Place to Work two years in a row, our CEO consistently has a 95+ percent approval rating; nearly 90% say they'd recommend Metromile to a friend. About the Claims Specialist Trainee role We're looking for someone who's passionate about creating fiercely loyal customers when it matters most. You'll be the primary point of contact for our claims customers from the moment the claim is reported until the claim is fully resolved. If you're tired of the status quo and want to be part of a forward-thinking claims organization on the cutting edge of technology, we want to speak with you! You will Investigate, evaluate, and negotiate auto accident claims to reach a fair and equitable settlement for involved parties Interpret policy contacts and identify how coverage applies to a particular loss Accurately document files to include all key claims activities Resolve internal and external customer inquiries Work with external partners to ensure our customers receive a high level of efficient and effective service Participate in Friday afternoon nerf gun wars About you Demonstrated ability to manage relationships with both internal and external customers Excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-managed, highly motivated, and confident Able to work well under deadlines in a high-paced, changing environment Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Effective team player Detail oriented Proficient in basic computer skills Bachelor's degree or equivalent education highly preferred but not required What's in it for you Highly competitive salary plus equity Excellent benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k) Generous PTO package Monthly gym membership stipend Company-sponsored team outings Rare opportunity to be part of a San Francisco-based tech company growing in Arizona Metromile is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Text: Office Manager/Project Manager/PA/Chief of Staff EMPR.co - Join the Technology revolution! We are looking for smart self-starters who are looking to be part of something new and exciting. You must be willing to take the plunge and sacrifice with this high risk role. if making a difference for people and for yourself is important than continue reading our job description. Perhaps you can join us and make the best of this crazy year that is 2020. If this does not describe you, this is not the role for you, nothing to see here. This role could also be considered a Chief of Staff and perhaps even grow into a COO role, in the future. Important details regarding the role We are a group of serial entrepreneurs looking for other adventurers to join us to move the needle on a realizable technology product that helps small business owners achieve greater profits and success We want to be very clear this is high risk/high reward opportunity – Be part of the 1st ten people on the critical path of a start-up with an actual chance to succeed We are receiving positive responses from investor and customer communities We have an aggressive delivery schedule (6-month time horizon) working together with existing customers (who have also invested) to build the Alpha version of our mobile platform These positions are over market equity compensation and well below market salary to start. We have a great fully paid benefits package and will even include housing in the same building where we have the office – creating a Covid-19 safe zone Compensation packages are all back loaded with performance criteria so it is possible that within the year total compensation levels could reach or eclipse market rates Looking for detail-oriented team players who are self-disciplined to take this journey with us · We measure what matters and prioritize RESULTS over all else trying to build something new and innovative · Do better every day is our mantra as we constantly optimize and improve results · There is no bureaucracy or red tape. We are insanely biased toward action, led by data and problem solving · We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we love playing the game and being on this amazing journey · Only looking for people who want to become a part of our team to make a difference, no sponsorships, no consultants, and no agencies please · Local Candidates Only ---- Get yourself to Dallas and we will consider you local · We all have recently moved to Dallas to a central location – Yes, we are all experienced and some of us are serial entrepreneurs—we have 15 exits, 100+ investment placements and have reached billion-dollar market valuations. We have vetted the business with customers, investors, and passing technical due diligence all that is left to do is build our MVP platform. Primary Skills and Requirements 1. Min. 5 years of experience as a Project Manager related to software development – Will work directly with Sr Tech Staff 2. Min. 5 years of experience as an Office Manager – Will work directly with Executives 3. Experience working at a Startup, experience working in HR administration and personnel development 4. PMP Certified or Not 5. Strong experience managing tasks related to SDLC 6. Experience overseeing the work of junior technical resources to ensure they work productively and meet deadlines in line with company standard 7. Interviewing and training new office employees and organizing their employment paperwork 8. Reporting office progress to senior management and working with them to improve office operations and procedures 9. Monitoring office supplies and ordering new stationery, furniture, appliances, and electronics as required 10. Organizing maintenance companies to keep the office clean and safe and ensure its appliances are in good working order 11. Excellent communication and customer facing skills Our Development Stack Only for awareness to understand the types of projects you may be managing Mobile Application Development C#, Xamarin, Appium.io testing, React Native, IOS, Android, UWP Back-End Development Python, NodeJS, PHP, GO, Django, Express JS, JAVA Spring Framework Front-End Development CSS, JS, SPA, LESS, SAAS, GULP, Angular 2, React, TypeScript DevOps CI, CD, GIT, Containers (Docker) Database MySQL, SQLite, PostGres, MongoDB, MSSQL, Hadoop Cultural Fit at EMPR: · You love learning, you love teaching · You are constantly growing your own knowledge, and helping to grow the knowledge of others. · You enjoy wearing multiple hats and roles, and titles are not important to you. · You enjoy doing it right first time and utilize tools & techniques to constantly excel in what you work to deliver it on time. · You do top-quality work, manage quality, and make everything you touch better. · You are comfortable working under strict confidentiality agreements and often behind the-scenes. · You are self-organized and manage time and resources well. · You are able to not only work alone, but also communicate within a team by sending updates, tracking time, and other forms of communication while you work. NOTE: “Candidates that are offered a position are required to pass pre-employment drug and background screening” Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental Insurance Health Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations:Office and living locations have been placed in the same facility to make all efforts to significantly reduce the risk of COVID-19. We are focusing on mobile solutions to help those affected by COVID-19. Come join the revolution!! Text: Lead fermentation efforts to scale up or down growth as needed. Find creative solutions to problems that minimize cost and maximize efficiency and time. Helping oversee and provide invaluable input to the scientific teams. Assist in developing high level scientific goals and communicating them team-wide. Help lead and grow a fermentation process team and also be able to conduct experiments and benchwork. Design experiments and execute them in a timely and cost effective manner. Manage projects from end to end and in many cases also assisting or perming experiments directly. Work together with internal and external teams in scaling up and scaling down. Managing all aspects of fermentation from preparation, growth, downstream processing. Researching and purchasing equipment. Capture and analyze complete data from experiments and present finding. PhD in Chemical Engineering or another job-related discipline. 7+ years industry experience. Must have experience with growing fungi, preferably filamentous fungi. 4+ years experience leading teams. Experience in working in an fast paced dynamic environment. Excellent written and spoken communication skills and experience working with internal and external parties at a company. Experience in scaling up fermentation processes beyond pilot scale. Experience creating and managing budgets and scale up projects from end to end. Experience in aerobic fermentation. Experience in reactor and process design, notably in batch and continuous process fermentation. Strong data analysis skills and strong command of using technology both hardware and software. Medical, dental, vision among other great benefits. Excellent growth and advancement opportunities. Competitive salary and equity. Collaborative working environment. Food, of course! Prime Roots (formerly Terramino Foods) is a venture backed San Francisco Bay Area based food company that is mission and community driven. Prime Roots grows and uses a fungi superprotein to make delicious and ultra-sustainable food products. The work of the Prime Roots team has been featured in publications such as the Wall Street Journal, Fast Company, Forbes, Food and Wine, and more.
Title: Lead Fermentation Scientist

Text: Provides support for the creation, coordination and execution of the program. Assists in budgetary management for the program(s). The responsibilities listed are a general overview of the position and additional duties may be assigned. Organizational Impact: Delivers job responsibilities that impact own job area/team with some guidance. Problem Solving/ Complexity of work: Uses existing procedures, research and analysis to solve standard job related problems that may require some judgement. Breadth of Knowledge: Requires subject matter knowledge within a professional area to meet job requirements. Team Interaction: Individually contributes to project/ work teams. Develops Self and Others: Continuously improves own skills by identifying development opportunities. Builds and Maintains Relationships: Seeks to understand colleagues' priorities, working styles and develops relationships across areas. Communicates Effectively: Openly shares information with others and communicates in a clear and courteous manner. Serves Others with Compassion: Invests time to understand the problems, needs of others and how to provide excellent service. Solves Complex Problems: Seeks to understand issues, solves routine problems, and raises proper concerns to supervisors in a timely manner. Offers Meaningful Advice and Support: Listens carefully to understand the issues and provides accurate information and support. Performs Excellent Work: Checks work quality before delivery and asks relevant questions to meet quality standards. Ensures Continuous Improvement: Shows eagerness to learn new knowledge, technologies, tools or systems and displays willingness to go above and beyond. Fulfills Safety and Regulatory Requirements: Demonstrates basic knowledge of conditions that affect safety and reports unsafe conditions to the appropriate person or department. Demonstrates Accountability: Takes responsibility for completing assigned activities and thinks beyond standard approaches to provide high-quality work/service. Stewards Organizational Resources: Displays understanding of how personal actions will impact departmental resources. Makes Data Driven Decisions: Uses accurate information and good decision making to consistently achieve results on time and without error. Generates New Ideas: Willingly proposes/accepts ideas or initiatives that will impact day-to-day operations by offering suggestions to enhance them. Applies Technology: Absorbs new technology quickly; understands when to utilize the appropriate tools and procedures to ensure proper course of action. Adapts to Change: Embraces change by keeping an open mind to changing plans and incorporates change instructions into own area of work. Department/Unit Summary Vanderbilt’s Department of Emergency Medicine is a leader in clinical care, education, and research. Our combined emergency departments see over 130,000 patients annually. We are the only adult and pediatric Level 1 trauma center in middle Tennessee. Our Chairman and Residency Director make education their number one priority by teaching a morning conference 5 days a week, 52 weeks per year in addition to directing the residency’s five required hours of didactics each week. Every faculty member and upper level resident views excellent teaching as part of his or her responsibilities. For more information, please visit https://vanderbiltem.com/.   Discover Vanderbilt University Medical Center: Located in Nashville, Tennessee, and operating at a global crossroads of teaching, discovery and patient care, VUMC is a community of individuals who come to work each day with the simple aim of changing the world. It is a place where your expertise will be valued, your knowledge expanded and your abilities challenged. It is a place where your diversity — of culture, thinking, learning and leading — is sought and celebrated. It is a place where employees know they are part of something that is bigger than themselves, take exceptional pride in their work and never settle for what was good enough yesterday. Vanderbilt’s mission is to advance health and wellness through preeminent programs in patient care, education, and research.  VUMC Recent Accomplishments Because we are committed to providing the best in patient care, education and research, we are proud of our recent accomplishments:   US News & World Report: #1 Adult Hospital in Tennessee and metropolitan Nashville, named to the Best Hospitals Honor Roll of the top 20 adult hospitals, 10 nationally ranked adult specialty programs, with 3 specialties rated in the top 10 nationally, Monroe Carell Jr. Children’s Hospital at Vanderbilt named as one of the Best Children’s Hospital in the nation, with 10 out of 10 pediatric specialties nationally ranked.  Healthcare’s Most Wired: Among the nation’s 100 “most-wired” hospitals and health systems for its efforts in innovative medical technology.  Becker’s Hospital Review: named as one of the “100 Great Hospitals in America”, in the roster of 100 Hospitals and Health Systems with Great Oncology Programs and to its list of the 100 Hospitals with Great Heart Programs.  The Leapfrog Group: One of only 10 children’s hospitals in the to be named at Leapfrog Top Hospital.  American Association for the Advancement of Science: The School of Medicine has 112 elected fellows  Magnet Recognition Program: Received our third consecutive Magnet designations.  National Academy of Medicine: 22 members, elected by their peers in recognition of outstanding achievement   Human Rights Campaign Healthcare Equality Index: 6th year in a row that Vanderbilt University Medical Center was a Leader in LGBTQ Healthcare Equality. Occasional: Lifting under 35 lbs: Raising and lowering objects under 35 lbs from one level to another Occasional: Carrying under 35 lbs: Transporting an object holding in hands, arms or shoulders, with help of coworkers or assistive device. Title: Sr Administrative Assistant

Text: As a Senior Technical Project Manager, you will have a broad array of responsibilities on the enterprise application team. This role will drive program management for all aspects of tech programs and deliverables for the People tech team. Acting as a ‘Scrum Master’ utilizing Agile methodologies. This role will be responsible for hands on Workday configuration and will interface cross functionally with the Enterprise Apps teams to drive larger initiatives.  The ideal candidate is someone with a passion for Technical program management, to own and drive People Programs and at the same time be able to dive into configurations and integrations when needed! Schedule and lead events such as Sprint Planning/Reviews, Daily Standups, Quarterly planning and various other team meetings. Partners closely with Product teams to own the initiating, resource planning, and driving the delivery of tech programs ( full life-cycle). Works with Product and Tech teams to finalize the intake, estimation and prioritization of work. Uses Workday configuration depth to understand dependencies between various domains, integrations and tools Configure and troubleshoot setup and integrations for HCM, Benefits, Payroll, Absence/Time tracking. Coach and mentor other team members (Analysts, TPMs) to ensure high standards of delivery, documentation and enforcement of standard methodologies. Works closely with the leadership teams to identify and mitigate risks, issues and roadblocks.  5+ years of experience in a program management role, with experience shipping great people products and tools Experienced in configuring the Workday system for HR/Benefits/Payroll domains Gravitate toward the detail but can keep the big picture in focus. Experience working with various enterprise Product and Shared services teams like HR, Finance, Communications, Marketing etc. Love pushing the limits of technology can offer and promote out of the box thinking and be an advocate for operational excellence! Experience leading sophisticated projects in a PM tool like Wrike or JIRA. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Operations Management, or similar field. Text: Heart Station Tech PRN (Pediatric Heart Institute)  Job Summary: Provides technical support for the acquisition of a cardiac tracing needed to diagnose or rule-out cardiac disease in the form or, ECG 12 and 15 leads, Event Monitor, Holter Monitor, telemetry, or autonomic function testing. Additionally, provides direct patient care in an ambulatory setting through vital sign measurement and coordination of patient flow.KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Acquires interpretable electrocardiogram waveform as requested by physician or registered nurse in the following diagnostic events: EKG 12 & 15 Lead, Holter Monitor, Event Monitor, autonomic function testing. Able to assist in preliminary report findings accurately. Coordinate patient flow (room utilization). Participates in the teaching of patients and families, under the guidance of MD/RN: assess readiness to learn and barriers to learning; provide information and record teaching. The responsibilities listed are a general overview of the position and additional duties may be assigned. Text: This is a high visibility role that will directly impact both the ZPA business and the overall development of the Zillow brand. You will be responsible for the following:  Building and leading a world-class team of Product Marketers is the number one priority. As a leader, you will set a high bar for the team, fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. You will create clarity from ambiguity, and act both strategically and decisively in setting the team vision and goals. You will do so by building relationships that are transparent and engender trust and shared success.  Identifying what is most needed and most compelling to customers – and sharing that insight back into the organization to influence product strategy, prioritization, marketing investment, and related messaging.  Leading the cross-functional development and execution of go-to-market strategies and plans designed to drive desired business-critical metrics (e.g., awareness, consideration, trial, and adoption).  Monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on product marketing program performance and making recommendations to improve both the product offering itself and related marketing and messaging.  Identifying and delivering new business opportunities to drive growth for ZPA through cross-selling, promotions, partnerships, or other programs, with the potential to deliver customer and partner value at scale.  In addition, as a senior leader in the marketing organization, you will help build a world-class marketing team, best-in-class brands, scalable business processes, and strong cross-company relationships.  Partner with PA Leadership to deeply understand the business including vision, near term, and long term goals, operations, technology, sales, gaps & opportunities, and the P&L Partner with PA Product to map innovation to the greatest customer need and market opportunity. Influence product innovation to maximize customer success, often requiring a cross-business lens. Identify the sales & partner priorities and sales plays, supported by comprehensive sales enablement resources including content, resources, tools, and insights to crush their revenue and engagement targets. Lead the annual marketing planning process for ZPA and continue to optimize and iterate on that plan throughout the year. Identify and socialize key customers' needs and unmet growth opportunities through partnerships with Consumer Insights, UX research, or 1st and 3rd party research. Recruit, nurture and retain a best-in-class team of product marketers. Partner with Brand Strategy to extend the Zillow narrative through ZPA, defining the products, features and RTBs needed to support. Define the value proposition and messaging framework for prioritized ZPA products. Own “the brief.” Lead cross-functional teams in the development of go-to-market strategies and plans designed to drive desired business outcomes. Work with media, lifecycle, social, and other communication channels to support appropriate people and budgetary investment levels, and develop tactical plans. Together with the product team, educate both internal and external teams about our product features and their benefits.  You are a strong leader and a great people manager. You motivate and inspire even as you ask tough questions and challenge the status quo. You love working in a fast-paced environment and collaborating across teams. You can drive both strategy with creative solutions, and execution in a cross-functional organization. You come with a successful track record of cultivating both trust and influence with key partners, driving quantifiable business and customer outcomes, and building a brand for the long haul. If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you! Experience (10+ years) in product or brand management – preferably with a technology company/brand Experience (3-5 years) in hiring and leading high-performing teams in a cross-matrixed environment. Success launching and scaling both mass-market consumer and B2B products or services that both drive the business and strengthen the brand. Strong analytic skills and the ability to drive recommendations and decision making with data. Experience creating integrated marketing plans to support product launch and expansion efforts. Experience working with marketing channel leaders to shape marketing strategy and drive tactical execution. Expertise in one or more communication channels is a plus. Executive-level communication skills and excellent written communication skills. Ability to confidently analyze business results and report performance to executive leadership and cross-functional teams. Ability to influence others without authority to get things done in a timely fashion; balance multiple priorities adapt to changing business needs and meet deadlines. MBA preferred. Must love this stuff.   At Zillow Group, we're powered by our inclusive work culture, where everyone has the support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction is supported by our passion to empower people and enrich lives around everything home, a deep-rooted culture of innovation, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. But, don't just take our word for it. Text: Fred Smith Company is currently searching for an experienced Survey Project Manager. We are a self-perform heavy civil contractor working in the greater Raleigh and Triangle area. Pay will commensurate with experience; all employees are eligible after 90 days for benefits such as health, dental and vision insurance and paid time off. Responsibilities and duties: Plan daily activities of multiple projects to meet productivity goals for field crews Review and monitor field crews in Construction Staking, As-Built Surveys, and Topographic Surveys Computations for construction stakeout including site work, residential subdivisions and roadway projects Prepare Topographic surveys and As-Built surveys of completed work Draw 3D models for site and roadway projects Review plans and CAD for errors Monitor job cost and communicate job changes with survey department manager Assist in training field crews and junior office staff Other duties as assigned Qualifications: 5+ years of surveying experience Excellent verbal and written communication skills Able to work independently and as a team member Proficient with AutoCAD and Carlson Civil Suite Working knowledge of Carlson SurveCE, Robotic Total Stations and Topcon GPS Technology. Local candidates preferred. We provide competitive pay, comprehensive benefits including affordable health insurance, paid time off, holiday pay and a 401k plan with a generous match. Text: As a Principal Program Manager, you will be responsible for driving strategy and engaging with product teams to deliver a large software project end-to-end. You will be a key player in strategy, technical design, project execution, and launch. Responsibilities include: collecting of business and systems requirements from internal customers, diving deep into our infrastructure stack, collaborating with other key partners and engineering leadership to alter their software stacks, and driving the teams to launch.  An ability to take large, complex projects and break them down into milestones, develop functional specifications, then deliver them in a successful and timely manner is expected. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, analytical talent, ability to influence, and leadership are essential to be successful in this role. 6+ years Program Management/Project Management experience leading cross-functional projects from design to launch, with a well-rounded technical background in current web technologies. Experience with AWS and containers is a big plus. A bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science or equivalent preferred. Experience managing efforts in multi-tiered distributed systems and/or developing large scale web applications. Experience managing and driving large scale software development in a data driven Agile environment. Strong, demonstrated technical problem solving, communication skills and strong cross-team management skills Ability to deal with ambiguity and a changing environment, as well as a rapid work pace. A consistent track record of being detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow through on large scale/multi-year projects   At Zillow Group, we're powered by our inclusive work culture, where everyone has the support and resources to do the best work of their careers. Text: ONLINE APPLICATION AVAILABLE AT:  https://www.gapinc.com/en-us/jobs/32/61/brand-associate-st-david-s-square-new-store about old navy Forget what you know about old-school industry rules. When you work at Old Navy, you’re choosing a different path. From day one, we’ve been on a mission to democratize fashion and make shopping fun again. Our teams make style accessible to everyone, creating high-quality, must-have fashion essentials for the whole family, with love, season after season. We opened our first store in 1994 in San Francisco and have been on a roll ever since. We cultivate a community of playful personalities that thrive in a fast-paced environment where our employees can be their most authentic selves. Here, we’re family. about the role We’re searching for Brand Associates to join our team – no experience needed – friendly and eager to learn is what we are looking for! As a Brand Associate, you’re an important part of our team and take pride in the brand to deliver a great shopping experience for our customers. You will support your team to drive results, deliver best-in-class service and educate customers on our loyalty programs. You enjoy a fast-paced environment and have a customer-first mindset. More than the clothes we create, we are defined by our people. As we re-open stores, our priority is to welcome back furloughed employees and offer them shifts first. However, during this time of uncertainty, personal situations often change, so in the event our furloughed employees aren’t able to return to work, we are opening hiring to the public. If you’re a furloughed employee and haven’t heard from us, are in the market for this job and would like the opportunity to be placed back on the schedule, please contact your manager. * what you'll do* Consistently treat all customers and employees with respect and contribute to a positive work environment. Support sales floor, fitting room, cash wrap, back of house, as required. Handle all customer interactions and potential issueseturns courteously and professionally. * who you are* You’re able towork shifts that meet the needs of the business; flexible and/or consistentscheduling may be available. You act in linewith our values and guiding principles. You are open tofeedback, communicate well and take action as required. You’re able to learnand utilize technology. You’re able tomaneuver around sales floor, stockroom, office and lift up to 30 lbs., with orwithout a reasonable accommodation. You are eligible for hire pending successful completion of a background check benefits at old navy Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta for all employees. One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.* Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.* Employee stock purchase plan.* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.* see more of the benefits we offer. *For eligible employees Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. This year, we’ve been named as one of the best places to work by the humans rights campaign for the fourteenth consecutive year and have been included in the 2019 bloomberg gender-equality index for the second year in a row. Job Type: Part-time Pay: $10.00 per hour Benefits: Employee Discount Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location Hours per week: 10-19 20-29 Paid Training: Yes Shifts announced: Weekly Pay Frequency: Bi weekly or Twice monthly Company's website: https://www.gapinc.com/en-us/jobs/32/61/brand-associate-st-david-s-square-new-store Work Remotely: No

Text: King School (King) is an independent, college preparatory day school serving students from Pre-kindergarten through Grade 12. We are a diverse, vibrant learning community dedicated to educational excellence and the fullest academic and personal achievement of our students.  Job Titles: Middle School / Upper School Student Learning Supervisors Division: Middle School / Upper School Reports to: Head of Middle School / Head of Upper School Summary: King School seeks full-time Student Learning Supervisors to support students, student activities, and athletic programming in the Middle School and Upper School. This position will report to the Head of the Middle / Upper School. Student Learning Supervisor Program: The Student Learning Supervisor Program at King School provides individuals the chance to gain valuable school-based supervisory role experience. The program offers opportunities to support the daily functions and operations of Middle School or Upper School life, supervising and monitoring student activities and learning, overseeing lunch, recess, passing and free times, and also serving in a coaching capacity within our diverse set of middle and upper level athletics offerings. Working closely with administrators, deans, and teachers, the Student Learning Supervisors are essential members of the community, working to help cultivate an environment built upon King's core virtues: kindness, respect, integrity, and perseverance. Student Learning Supervisors will also attend division meetings and engage in professional growth and development around a variety of topics, such as supporting the social-emotional health of adolescents, culture building, effective use of technology, and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion. Other responsibilities include engaging with students in a positive and productive manner, conferring with colleagues regarding student supervision and support strategies, helping to cover classes and club responsibilities when the need arises, and being a part of each "duty" roster that applies to their area (lunch, recess, dismissal, etc.). These one to two year placements allow for school-based experience and offer an immersive introduction to King School student-life and the King School community. Participation in the King Student Learning Supervisor Program does not guarantee future employment. Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Monitor and supervise students in a multitude of learning environments throughout each school day. Provide academic and emotional support for students as well as lead movement and wellness activities. Help manage and oversee our Middle School athletics program with the opportunity to also coach in the Upper School program after school (US coaching positions will be paid at approved stipend rates). Model fairness and proper behavior. Plan programmatic and grade level activities for students in collaboration with administrators, deans, teachers, and coaches. Demonstrate a commitment to professional growth and development. Perform duties as assigned by the Head of Middle School/Upper School and the Dean of Athletics, including recess, lunch, and dismissal. Attend Middle/Upper School and all-school faculty meetings, as well as workshops on staff development days held after 3:00 p.m. Availability to work in the After School Program when meetings are not required and not serving in role as Upper School coach after school. Provide coverage for other Middle School and Upper School teachers, when necessary. Participate in King's orientation and mentor programs. Skills and Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in the field of education preferred. Previous experience working with middle and upper school aged children. Prior athletic coaching experience in a wide range of sports preferred. A strong affinity for children, flexibility, and a sense of humor are required. Knowledge of academic and social developmental benchmarks. Ability to collaborate in the management of small and large groups of students during varied activities, both indoors and outside. Strong communication skills and ability to constructively collaborate with students and colleagues. Must embrace use of technology to enhance communication and instruction support. Strong demonstration of cultural competence, capacity to work, teach coach and learn across cultural differences. A willingness to embrace King's Mission, Virtues, and Diversity Policy Statement. CPR and First Aid Certification (King will provide training). This is a full time, exempt, benefits-eligible position. King is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is King's policy to provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. King does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender (including an employee's gender identity, appearance, or behavior, even if different from that traditionally associated with the employee's sex at birth), sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other basis prohibited under federal, state, or local law. King will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified individuals with disabilities unless doing so would impose an undue hardship on the School. Any person who believes he/she may require such accommodation should contact his/her Division Head or the Head of School. This policy applies to all areas of employment, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, benefits, transfer, and social and recreational programs. It is the responsibility of every employee to follow this policy conscientiously and to immediately report any violations. Any employee who believes that there has been a violation of this policy — with regard to themselves or others — must report the violation to his/her Division Head, Head of School, or any member of the leadership team. King absolutely prohibits retaliation against any employee who, in good faith, makes a report under this policy. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: Employee Assistance Program Schedule: Monday to Friday Location: Stamford, CT 06905 (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: https://www.kingschoolct.org/ Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/kingschoolct/ Work Remotely: No

Text: THE CO eStreet.co believes that the best brands are authentic and create a custom experience for their audience. We help brands harness that authenticity through award winning creative collateral driven by a full-service team of data experts, digital buyers, designers, videographers, photographers, copywriters, coders, developers and social media experts.  *THE TEAM Our staff has decades of experience across numerous verticals, from politics to non-profits and Fortune 500s and we are united behind one goal – driving results for brands. You will be the first eCommerce staff on our team but we anticipate this team growing. So to start with you will be a one stop shop that will rely heavily on partnerships internally with our art, ads, accounts, business development and experience teams.**THE JOB We are seeking an innovative, results-oriented, professional to join our team as an eCommerce Specialist. To be successful you will combine an understanding of visual merchandising and what drives eCommerce sales, as well as a passion for user experience to improve the onsite merchandising strategy. You will build unparalleled shopping experiences across platforms for our clients by collaborating with UX/UI, marketing, creative and accounts teams to tell key merchandising stories end to end.**Our eCommerce Specialist should be able to take responsibility for the presentation, creation, content, SEO, maintenance, catalog, shipping, APIs, site integrations and overall business health of key products and services being sold. You are passionate about driving revenue, reporting on results, new digital tools and technology and clean, descriptive and error free writing.**The daily workstream will include helping us to build industry leading experiences that strengthen brand loyalty, improve customer retention, and increase sales. PLATFORMS OUR CLIENTS USE You must have a demonstrated working knowledge of at least two or more. Woo Commerce Square VineSpring Shopify Wine Direct VinoShipper Commerce7 THE RESPONSIBILITIES Build, catalog, maintain and support online stores both internally and externally. Collaborate and lead partnerships both internally and externally to ensure flawless execution of online content and enhancements, and help drive revenue positive results for clients. Develop innovative processes to efficiently create B2C targeted content from a variety of internal and external sources. Handle daily operational activities and requests from multiple business and marketing units that impact sales on multiple platforms. Maintain intelligence between eCommerce and distribution as well as manage sales strategy such as promotion and advertising. Develop customer insights to use to improve the e-commerce business. Find customer insights in e-commerce data to share with product marketing to improve products and/or sales in all channels. Provide detailed reporting on product trends, competitor trends with actionable data to support business development decision making processes. Audit item listings to identify inaccurate, unclear, or missing information. Create listings and continually monitor and optimize with enhanced SEO, SEO prioritization and and selling points. Monitor and encourage brand management and pricing compliance. Perform other duties as assigned Point person for continuity/consistency for product brand representations. Participate in user experience testing and develop improvements to drive revenue. Inspecting landing pages, product information, checkout options, and all other pertinent website-related systems to ensure their visual appeal, accuracy, and ease of use. Assisting with decisions about promotions such as discounted offers and affordable bulk packages. Ensure payment options, shipping and promotional tabs are configured correctly. Inspecting and uploading customers' product reviews. Utilize reporting (conversion, funnel, etc.) data & analytics to improve business performance and inform merchandising strategies to drive growth Cultivating standards, systems and best practices for content creation, distribution, maintenance, and new product listings. DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE Error free writing and exceptional oral communications skills Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, communications, IT, or related field required 3-5 years of experience in marketing, communications, or channel management, with progressively more responsibility and a track record of results 3+ years of experience SEM and SEO Ability to juggle multiple client projects, tasks and deadlines with little oversight Possessing a comprehensive understanding of account-specific SEO best practices, pricing policies, media assets, inventory and/or pre-orders Possessing a strong knowledge of the eCommerce space including competitive strategies, marketing strategies, product development, consumer research, usability best practices and industry trends Driver of results based on data while maintaining a positive, can-do, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude Can conceptualize, develop and produce client plans and client recommendations that will be shared with the client, executives, and partners Is an avid consumer of news for the industry Desire to constantly test, innovate and look at data Proven ability to link knowledge of branding and target customers to key eCommerce elements in order to drive the business Ability to empathize with customers to understand their core needs, gather insights and create solutions that build the business with a customer-centric approach in the short and long term Adaptable to change Must be physically able to work in a jobsite environment for extensive periods to which includes bending, squatting, crouching, reaching, and lifting up to 20lbs Must be willing to periodically work in a warehouse that is not climate controlled MUST HAVE TECHNICAL SKILLS Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint). Advanced skills in GoogleSuite (Docs, Sheets, Presentations, Forms). Experience with SEO, keyword research and Google Analytics, AdWords Knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript a plus Experience with Wordpress or similar CMS Demonstrated knowledge of Sheets or Excel (pivot tables, vlookups etc) THE BENEFITS Salary commensurate with experience 100% employer paid health care 90% employer paid dental insurance 15 days of PTO a year 12 days of Sick leave a year 12 paid holidays Cell phone stipend Public transportation allowance Open leave policy for illness or childcare needs 401K after 90 days with 5% employer contribution (regardless of your contribution) No cost Short-term, long-term disability insurance and $50k life insurance policy **DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION STATEMENT eStreet.co is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. eStreet.co is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. eStreet.co will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.* Job Type: Full-time Pay: $55,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Flexible Schedule Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Retirement Plan Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday On Call Weekends Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay Commission Pay Experience: eCommerce: 3 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Sacramento, CA 95814 (Required) This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity Company's website: estreet.co Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

Text: Actively commit to and participate in our lab and corporate safety programs: including following all safety protocols and procedures. Learning to recognize and report hazards and take appropriate action to keep yourself and others safe. Participate in safety programs, activities, including delivering safety trainings on a variety of topics Effectively communicate and collaborate with colleagues, within the team, the facility and across all functional areas the lab interacts with. Share information, participate in meetings etc. Perform routine analysis at all stages of the winemaking process from grape samples to consumer complaints utilizing appropriate methods per SOPs. Operate and assist in maintaining the varied laboratory instruments and equipment utilized, such as auto-titrators, spectrophotometers, densitometers, gas chromatographs, infrared analyzers, balances, pH meters, etc. Capture complete, accurate and thorough results. Play a key role in bottling/export tank approval process Perform package quality assessments, process audits and compliance verification. Assist in identifying and resolving issues and/or taking appropriate action on non-conforming product or materials as directed. Timing is critical and must be managed to ensure responsibilities are performed at appropriate times. Capture clear, concise, accurate data and information. Seek input as appropriate. (Varies by facility) Perform sanitation validation and troubleshooting through swabbing, record and data review etc. Utilize proper aseptic techniques and skills; perform the multiple duties involved in micro plating. This includes proper preparation, plating technique, media preparation, and record keeping. (varies by facility) Participate in and support our Food Safety Management Programs as a part of your routine duties Make quality and process improvement suggestions and follow through to implement as appropriate Data management: Input and evaluate data, perform calculations to determine basic statistical parameters. Utilize technology; computers, and specific software for managing processes including AS400, WMS, VA, and Microsoft Office Suite Recognize common issues, collect data/information for common or less complex issues, seek direction on resolution Help maintain a clean, safe laboratory facility. Follow good laboratory practices and lead by example Monitor, maintain, calibrate and troubleshoot routine common issues with lab equipment and instrumentation  Demonstrates ownership of core processes and ensures team goals are met on their shift Provides the necessary technical support to facilitate timely and successful completion of projects as assigned Performs work that is varied and somewhat difficult/challenging, but usually involves limited responsibility Provides guidance/training to lower level or less experience lab technicians and as directed, persons from cellar or operations on appropriate quality related functions/instruments Recognize and investigate root cause on more complex issues, suggest further steps, present options for resolution. As needed, stays up to date on best practices, current technology and techniques through literature review, attending seminars/conferences, etc. Where appropriate: maintains a TTB certified chemist status and signs COAs Where appropriate: Interprets microbiological data. This includes proper microbe ID, microscope work, preparing streak plates, evaluating results, taking appropriate follow up action such as placing product on hold. May involve running PCR. Know when to report concerning results to management. Good follow through. (facility specific) Where appropriate: act as a packaging material champion on issue investigations and resolution Where appropriate: act as a key member of a Food Safety Team Where appropriate: manage lab supplies inventory  Experienced individual contributor and team member, cross-trained in all areas. Role model for others Works with minimum supervision, takes initiative and provides direction/leadership to team on problem solving, work prioritization, process improvements, etc. Assignments are broad in nature and include special projects (interdepartmental and inter-winery) Has appreciable latitude for un-reviewed action, decision, creativity As needed, work with other facilities, outside vendors and customers in problem resolution and continuous improvement in meeting our safety, quality, cost and production goals Superior analytical skills and as appropriate, quality assurance experience, packaging and or microbiological skills Duties include assisting in establishing specifications, and in the validation of assays, developing and writing SOPs Assist with troubleshooting and root-cause analysis for analytical, quality and food safety related concerns. Develop quality response plans and corrective actions as appropriate with supervision Manage tests/project plans and assist with analyzing the data, and making recommendations Support and model all company procedures and policies Must embrace and demonstrate The Wine Group Core Values - Performance, Empowered and Cost-mindful, and keep them in mind when making all decisions This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for their job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Must be 21 or older at the time of hire High school diploma or equivalent Demonstrated reliability and punctuality, work effectively in team/crew environment, adherence to all safety and food safety regulations and operating procedures Must be able to work rotating shifts and overtime Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions and procedures/protocols Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively Knowledge of good laboratory practices, including sample and reagent preparation techniques, sample handling and good record keeping Ability to apply concepts such as percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Ability to prioritize while able to adapt to changing priorities Ability to write reports and correspondence Computer skill requirements include basic MS Outlook, Word, and Excel  Biotech Certificate or AS degree in chemistry, food science, biology, process technology, quality assurance, or related field or 2 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Positive attitude, does not get caught up in negativity  BS degree in chemistry, food science, biology, process technology, quality assurance, enology, or related field or 5 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Computer skills: Excel pivot tables, charts, JDE, WMS (site specific) Instrument software, Intelex, MS Word, MS Power Point  BS degree in chemistry, food science, biology, process technology, quality assurance, enology, or related field and 2 years relevant experience, or 7 years relevant experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Computer skills: Excel pivot tables, charts, JDE, WMS (site specific) Instrument software, Intelex, MS Word, MS Power Point Support and model all company procedures and policies Demonstrated reliability and punctuality, work effectively in team/crew environment, adherence to all safety regulations and operating procedures.  Must be able to frequently lift and carry weights of up to 50 pounds at varying frequencies Possess the ability to work in a fast-paced production environment Working environment is both indoors and outdoors, with exposure to related equipment and noise levels Ability to perform tasks requiring bending, stooping, standing, and twisting in the laboratory and/or production environment Must be able to repeatedly climb 20 ft tank stairs/vertical tank ladders
Title: Lab Technician 1

Text: Accelerate Your Career Drive global technology  With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.  We’re large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.  From data scientists to sales and client service experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.  The Director of Global Talent Acquisition will play a critical leadership role in executing CDK’s talent strategies as we continue to drive current and next generation growth and technology. This leader will develop and execute a strategic approach to talent attraction and hiring across the globe in support of the organization’s mission. This role will be responsible for enhancing global talent acquisition processes and integrating with broader talent strategies to lead a data driven and future focused talent acquisition function.  This role will oversee both the North America and International Talent Acquisition functions (international team is based out of the UK) and reporting directly to the VP Global Talent. In partnership with key business leaders and HR COEs (business partners, compensation/benefits, HR ops), she/he will develop short-term and long-term talent acquisition strategies to meet the needs of the business while evolving the function and capabilities for future business needs. She/he will be accountable for delivering against shared goals such as tech modernization, data & analytics, inclusion & diversity, and values integration.  This individual must be passionate about doing more than the status quo, with a passion for understanding business needs and addressing those needs in thoughtful and meaningful talent acquisition strategies. This position is ideal for someone who excels in people leadership, operational excellence, and ‘outside of the box thinking’, who has the desire for global impact.  Key Duties & Responsibilities Lead a global talent acquisition function equipped to deliver against organizational talent strategies today and in the future aligned with business growth expectations. a. Globalize talent acquisition to create and maintain consistencies and efficiencies across the globe in talent attraction and hiring practices. b. Strategically partner with internal and/or external resources to enhance or deploy employer brand strategies to attract diverse talent and reinforce CDK brand awareness for both technical and non-technical roles and candidates. c. Partner with key stakeholders internally and/or externally to build and deploy the formalization of a CDK EVP. d. Oversee the progression of the campus intern program to enrich the impact of early career talent pipelines into critical organizational roles. e. Lead with a future focused, data driven, innovative mindset to position talent acquisition for success and Create Possibilities for the evolution of TA at CDK. f. Coach, develop and strengthen the capabilities of our recruiters and hiring managers to attract, source, and hire talent in ways that support our anticipated talent needs. Partner closely with HR, Business Leaders, and Business Partners to foster strong relationships with HRBPs/COEs and key business leaders. a. Develop and maintain strong partnerships with HR COEs, HR leadership, and business leaders; seek to understand how the business functions and how this function can better enable success. b. Be Open to feedback and new ways of working that meaningfully integrate TA with the business. c. Stay Curious and seek to understand the employee experience and business operations to assess and execute strategies to strengthen the relationship with TA in effort to improve the candidate and hiring manager experience. d. Own It and demonstrate accountability to colleagues, customers, and partners regularly to address concerns or needs. Optimize processes, tools and resources to leverage data and technology in ways that accelerate key talent strategies. a. Enhance tools and processes to maniacally focus on delivering a superb candidate experience. b. Optimize ATS process design and implementation to streamline recruiting operationalization and improve candidate, recruiter, and hiring manager experiences. c. Leverage data and insights to deliver effectively against key TA metrics, strengthen HR and business relationships, and fortify the talent acquisition brand at CDK. d. Complete RFP for recruitment marketing strategy partners and elevate our ability to attract top talent.  Qualifications required BA/BS required. Master’s degree preferred. 10+ years experience in full lifecycle and global Talent Acquisition position(s). Experience leading Talent Acquisition teams in technology and/or growth organizations with demonstration of success. Strong business acumen, HR acumen. Strong business partnering and influencing skills. Strong people leadership capabilities and talent development mindset. Strong operational execution skills; ability to lead multiple initiatives simultaneously and execute on time and with quality. Must demonstrate our organizational values in your leadership style: Stay Curious, Own It, Be Open, Create Possibilities Possesses a data centric mindset with the ability to leverage insights to make decisions and manage metrics, with strong presentation and communication skills as well as executive presence. Experience successfully partnering with external agencies, providers, suppliers, and firms. P&L experience. Strong project management and process management skills.  Desirable: Experience leveraging various ATS platforms including SuccessFactors and cloud based ATS platforms; experience with ATS implementations a plus. Experience implementing intentional D&I strategies within Talent Acquisition Ability to successfully manage contingent workforce partners and various recruiting model partners.  CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few. At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide.
