Text: Company Overview:  BlueWave Solar is a B Corporation on a mission to revolutionize energy with simple, powerful solar solutions. Our team of experts is intensely focused on developing, constructing and managing community solar projects, and forging efficient client relationships that enable customers to participate in these projects. We are constantly innovating to keep pace with the evolving energy industry, and that spirit of innovation drives our company's dynamic culture.  Inclusion at BlueWave:  As a mission-driven B Corp, as environmentalists, and as humans, we hold ourselves accountable to creating a workforce that celebrates diversity on our team and within our communities. Our inclusive culture and core values inspire us to develop more innovative, bolder solutions to support our customers and partners in the solar industry. When you join BlueWave, you join a collaborative team doing all that we can to be transparent, sustainable, and inclusive as we fight for our shared vision of protecting the planet.  Position Description:  The BlueWave Solar Technology team is seeking an Associate Salesforce Administrator to join the team and be part of our mission to build an industry-leading platform that allows customers to switch to clean, local energy sources. They should have basic knowledge of software development and design, be a quick learner, and have passion to improve themselves by adopting new development skills. They should be flexible and willing to learn new programming skills and methodologies.  Design and implementation of advanced configuration such as workflow rules, validation rules, complex assignment rules, process builders Troubleshoot and investigate system issues and support day-to-day operational requests Participates in developing specifications for epics and user stories Contributes to solutions for issues and problems as they arise Collaborates within the Agile framework, fosters a team approach to software development and delivery Engages in improving software delivery through DevOps and other Agile practices Stays current in new Salesforce and related technologies to continually improve their level of subject matter expertise. Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Information Systems (or related field) or equivalent work experience in technology, sales or operational roles Proficient in Microsoft Excel BlueWave is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace and will do so by actively seeking to hire and promote diverse individuals throughout the company. Providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment is critical to our identity and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, age, handicap (disability), sexual orientation, gender identity/ or expression, genetics, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, military status or obligation, or other protected status, in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws." Text: MYP/DP Language & Literature Teacher /  Extended Essay / Lang & Lit School Coordinator *Job Description**Reports to: Academic Director**I. Job Title: MYP/DP Language & Literature Teacher / Extended Essay / L& Lit Coordinator**II. Qualifications: a. International background and cultural understanding b. Texas Teaching Certification preferred; c. Three (3) years of successful classroom experience in the appropriate subject area and IB MYP/DP Certifications preferred; d. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills; e. Possess knowledge curriculum in the appropriate subject area; f. Be able to adapt, design and implement curriculum to meet the needs of the individual students (differentiation); g. Be able to suggest educational and classroom management strategies, materials and techniques to parents and other support personnel working with students; h. Be able to use observation techniques for identification, ongoing re-evaluation and planning for students; i. Alternatives to the above qualifications as the Board may find appropriate and acceptable; and j. Required criminal history background check and proof of U.S. citizenship or legal resident alien status.**III. Job Goals: To create and maintain a classroom atmosphere that generates high expectations and enthusiasm for learning by infusing critical thinking skills, application skills, interpersonal skills, and technology into an aligned curriculum and assessment process, resulting in measurable student achievement gains for all students. Support DP students in the development of the Extended Essay. Develop and coordinate the implementation of the Language and Literature curriculum at WP **IV. Scope of Responsibility: Provide support and instruction to students while challenging them and promoting IB curriculum. To plan lessons according to the IB curriculum and assess students, tailoring lessons according to the different abilities of children in the classroom. Company Internal**V. Performance Responsibilities:**1.0 PROFICIENCIES 1.1 Demonstrate mastery of all IB competencies. 1.2 Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the subject matter. 1.3 Foster students’ achievement gains from baseline assessment levels to be evident in pre/posttest comparison results, test scores, and portfolios. 1.4 Assist the administration and staff to develop and implement a school-wide behavior management system aligned to the TWPS policies and procedures. 1.5 Provide supportive classroom management and academic strategies to teachers, students, and parents.**2.0 INITIATIVE 2.1 Demonstrate efficiency. 2.2 Demonstrate punctuality. 2.3 Demonstrate consistent attendance. 2.4 Review current developments, literature and technical sources of information related to job responsibility. 2.5 Initiate and present innovative ideas for special projects, school functions, field trips, extracurricular activities, and clubs. 2.6 Initiate opportunities for professional development. 2.7 Provide supplemental instruction.**3.0 SAFETY AND EDUCATION 3.1 Supervise student recreation (having at least one person in the classroom at all times). 3.2 Complete and maintain accident reports (keeping one in a permanent file and sending one copy to parents). 3.3 Keep emergency numbers at hand and a stocked first aid kit accessible in the classroom. 3.4 Maintain up-to-date lesson plans within the guidelines of TWPS curriculum. 3.5 Complete, distribute, and maintain files of all behavior and homework referrals as required (one in permanent folder, one sent home). 3.6 Complete and maintain files of all report cards and progress reports. 3.7 Follow safety requirements regarding aisles, doorways, fire alarms, and fire extinguishers at all times. Company Internal 3.8 Participate in monthly fire and other safety drills. 3.9 Keep dangerous objects (knives, rocks, etc.) and toxic substances (ammonias, medicines, etc.) out of the reach of children at all times.**4.0 PROFESSIONALISM 4.1 Interact with maturity and professionalism among administration, staff and students at all times. 4.2 Take initiative to implement projects, programs, and/or compensate for shortcomings within your classroom and/or the school environment. 4.3 Exhibit congeniality among co-workers, students, and parents. 4.4 Show assertiveness - delegate when necessary to help others help you. 4.5 Be a team player while respecting others' differences. 4.6 Separate professional and personal spheres. 4.7 Be flexible - always have a back-up plan. 4.8 Be willing to help where help is needed.**5.0 STUDENT AND PARENT INTERACTION 5.1 Continually assess students' development (psychological and academic) through clearly defined rubrics. 5.2 Identify those students who exhibit exceptional thinking styles and behaviors and implement and/or accommodate those exceptional needs. 5.3 Assist in data collection and preparation for student instruction. 5.4 Promote problem-solving skills and character education. 5.5 Promote and enforce school rules. 5.6 Keep parents updated through interim reports, report cards, phone calls, and notes home. 5.7 Encourage and facilitate parental and community involvement promoting student achievement. 5.8 Document parent phone calls, conversations, and conferences. 5.9 Maintain flexibility and frequent contact with parents about student progress and school events. Company Internal**6.0 PROFESSIONAL GROWTH 6.1 Uses evaluation for self-improvement; carries out individual improvement plan. 6.2 Maintains a high level of competence in the field of education, remaining current in issues related to areas of responsibility. 6.3 Maintains a high level of personal integrity and a strong work ethic.**VI. Terms of Employment: 11-month salaried – 12-month contract. Serves in accordance with the terms of the agreement with the Board of Managers. VII. Salary: As determined by the Board of Managers within the range established by WPS. VIII. Evaluation: Performance will be evaluated in accordance with state law and School policy* Job Type: Full-time Pay: $22.00 - $27.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental Insurance Health Insurance Paid Time Off Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Signing Bonus COVID-19 considerations:To develop a strong Online Program in case of contingence. Experience: Teaching: 3 years (Required) child care: 1 year (Preferred) Education: Master's (Preferred) License: Teaching Certificate (Required) Language: English High Level (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment This Company Describes Its Culture as: Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative This Job Is: A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply Company's website: woodlandsprep.org Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

Text: COMPANY: Alliance Finishing & Manufacturing (www.alliance-finishing.com) is Ventura County's leader in providing anodizing, electroplating and engineering services that help military, aerospace, healthcare and commercial manufacturers all over the world measurably improve equipment strength, reduce corrosion, and improve metal and plastic product aesthetics. We are Nadcap certified for chemical processing and our company has been in business for over 25 years. Our robust plating technology called “GreenPOP” resets the standard for what yields, adhesion and quality can be expected from plating on plastics and structural composites (www.alliance-finishing.com/plating-on-plastics). *THE ROLE: The AR/AP Office Administrator supports the Office Manager to ensure that Alliance’s incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. You’ll partner with the Office Manager to execute plans to organize key business activities for the company. The ideal AR/AP Office Office Admin is a hands on, versatile, independent, and proactive team member who is able to adapt to quickly changing priorities. You will be an important partner to the front office staff. This position reports directly to the Office Manager.**RESPONSIBILITIES: Support all tasks related to Accounts Receivable/Accounts Payable. Work with the Office Manager and also independently identify opportunities for profit growth and cash flow improvement across all vendor and customer accounts. Enter bills into QuickBooks and track all paperwork Generate vendor payments and process payments from customers Update reporting systems and support analysis of our business to drive effective process improvement, eliminate operations mistakes and design long term fixes to business gaps. Take initiative to complete unanticipated or ad hoc tasks, and verifying the completeness of one's own work. Meticulously balance and track daily bank reconciliation for all corporate accounts, including 401k Support HR and Payroll including printing timesheets, obtaining EE approval and ensuring employees’ paychecks are disbursed appropriately Support Benefits by tracking all employees’ sick, vacation, holiday and 401k balances * *MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: BA/BS degree in Business, Accounting or Operations or equivalent practical experience. 3 years of relevant AR/AP experience including payroll, purchasing and bank reconciliation for corporate accounts Must be proficient in Quickbooks, Outlook and MS Office Tools (PowerPoint, Word, and Excel) Strong project management skills Proven track record of meeting deadlines and successfully managing administrative processes and projects. Expert level written and verbal skills Proven organizational skills that reflect your ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail Confidence and a desire to learn new technologies Very strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with various internal and external stakeholders, including customers and employees Sharp business judgment, and a keen ability to see the "big picture" and to prioritize, while working independently, yet asking for help when necessary Self-starter who enjoys finding ways to improve things without direction High energy, strong work ethic, disciplined execution skills, willingness to do whatever it takes to deliver results **BENEFITS: Competitive Salary (hourly) Vacation Pay Sick Pay (3 days) Holiday Pay Medical/Dental Benefits 401k Plan **EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER -- Stainless Process Systems does not discriminate on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, marital status or disability status in its employment actions, decisions, policies and practices.* Job Type: Full-time Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per hour Experience: high quality customer service: 3 years (Required) AR/AP: 3 years (Required) fast-paced project management : 3 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)
Title: AR/AP Office Administrator

Text: ABOUT LOANPAL We provide friendly financing options for those who dream of living a more sustainable lifestyle and want to save money using modern technology. We are creating a financial ecosystem that connects billions of dollars of capital to millions of homeowners that want to convert their outdated houses into modern, smart, energy-efficient homes. By unlocking access to numerous products that help people achieve better sustainability, we are revolutionizing the $350B+ home improvement industry and protecting our only planet. As part of our world-positive initiative, we are also the official sponsor of GivePower – a foundation that uses solar-based solutions to power life’s basic needs for people in developing regions of the world. Complete other tasks as deemed appropriate by manager. Embraces change and is flexible to the needs of the business and team. Ability to accept and apply coaching and feedback from leadership. Proven track record of reliability and a strong work ethic is a must. Text: inLumon (www.inlumon.com) provides software solution for State Licensing Boards, Commissions and Government Regulatory Agencies. At inLumon, we do what we say we are going to do and thrive on open communication with our clients. inLumon provides certainty and reliability to its clients as their IT business solutions partner. We offer an effective blend of revolutionary spirit, technical expertise; incisive business perspectives and creative skill sets that help ascertain the value of Information Technology. We aim to nurture synergistic, long-lasting relationships with a business model designed around the success of our clients rather than our bottom line. All of our software solutions designs are fueled by our passion for solving complex, hi-tech problems in a creative way. Responsibilities:  Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, task and workflow analysis. Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users. Develops training curriculum and conducts formal training sessions covering assigned systems module. Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes. Work as a bridge between the user and developer for requirements and clarifications. Lead the scrum team in using Agile methodology and scrum practices. Helping the product owner and development team to achieve customer satisfaction. Lead the scrum and development teams in self-organization. Remove impediments and coach the scrum team on removing impediments. Help the scrum and development teams to identify and fill in blanks in the Agile framework. Resolve conflicts and issues that occur. Help the scrum team achieve higher levels of scrum maturity. Support the product owner and provide education where needed. Education and/or Experience:  Bachelor's degree is preferred. Proficient with Microsoft Office. Experience as a Business Analyst is required. Experience with JIRA required. Results oriented with demonstrated skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities. Demonstrated ability to resolve problems and present results neatly, with clarity and precision in oral and written form. Ability to work semi-autonomously in a fast paced environment with strong work ethic. A positive attitude with good communication skills and strong reasoning skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Prior experience on a scrum team. Ability to analyze and think quickly and to resolve conflict. Knowledgeable in techniques to fill in gaps in the scrum. Ability to determine what is scrum and what is not. Experience with successful Agile techniques. Benefits: Competitive compensation package to commensurate with experience including (but not limited to) PTO, medical and dental insurance. Text: Description: Create Strategies, Lead Clients, Manage Talent, Drive Profitability Join Our CompanyThrive (www.thriveagency.com) is one of the fastest-growing and top digital marketing agencies in the world. We are a full-service agency that handles everything in-house and delivers massive and sustainable growth to our business partners and clients. We think about our work in two words: Relationships and Results. President Matt Bowman founded Thrive in 2005 and has grown the company to more than 140 employees in 35 states and eight different countries. We have a deeply-rooted, talented team (respectfully referred to as Thrivers) of project managers, web designers, content writers, social media specialists and search engine optimization specialists. We are a close-knit team that is motivated, smart, disciplined and committed to turning ideas into actions. We now have new headquarters located in Arlington, Texas, and have an exciting opportunity for a Director of Operations to join our Leadership Team (and you can live anywhere in the country!).  Qualifications: 10 years of experience (preferably with a digital marketing agency). Can easily demonstrate a strong depth of knowledge in digital marketing, media and technology. Gets excited about process improvement and managing large teams. Passionate about delivering value to our clients. Lives and breathes process improvement to improve our solution offerings. Ensures quality of everything we do. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience working in and managing a remote workforce. Deep technical knowledge is a plus. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Digital Technologies or similar, relevant field  Responsibilities: Operations Assist the President in formulating effective growth strategies, plans and procedures. Possess P&L responsibilities to ensure financial growth and profitability. Plan, coordinate and execute the annual budget process. Regularly evaluate the efficiency of the company’s business procedures according to the planned objectives and make appropriate improvements in deliverability. Provide leadership to department managers, and communicate team goals, set expectations and manage accountability. Identify and evaluate tool sets for internal processes and efficiencies. Manage procurement process and coordinate internal resource allocation. Establish and maintain quality controls across teams. Manage employee capacity across the delivery team and support hiring recommendations to meet capacity requirements. Share responsibility as a “Client-Care Officer” through direct contact with clients. Team Development/Leadership Promote a culture of high performance that emphasizes learning, team relationships and a commitment to quality. Plan, organize and lead teams for internal initiatives and ensure accountability. Be involved in the hiring and onboarding processes for new team members. Conduct quarterly and yearly reviews.  Desired Skills: We are looking for an experienced and results-driven Director of Operations who will execute our company’s strategy across multiple teams. This leader will incorporate the company’s business principles and culture throughout the organization and our customer base. The Director of Operations will have a proven track record of driving projects from inception to execution and be a natural problem-solver and big-picture thinker Thrive recognizes employees in many ways for their contributions and their commitment to the organization. One such way is by offering a very comprehensive benefits package. This includes a competitive salary, a bonus structure and a strong benefit program that includes health, dental, disability, vision and life insurance benefits. At Thrive, we want to ensure all of our employees stay healthy, feel secure and maintain a strong work/life balance. To learn more about Thrive’s culture, visit these links: Why Choose Thrive? Meet the Team Code of Ethics Client Testimonials Thrive Camp 2020 Video Thrive Gives Back  Hiring organization: Thrive Internet Marketing Agency Location: Arlington, Texas Industry: Marketing Educational requirements: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Digital Technologies or similar, relevant field Experience requirements: 10+ years Employment Type: Full-Time Compensation: Compensation based on experience. Benefits: Remote workHealth and dental 90% paid by companyVision insuranceLTD 100% paid by company401k with up to 2% company matchHealth stipendCompany paid holidaysUnlimited PTODebt Free GrantsCompany funded Health Savings Account (HSA)Annual company paid retreatBonusesCharity Matching Remote Work: We offer remote work, so you can live anywhere in the United States! Text: Out Client is a family first membership service that helps protect and connect families by offering intelligent location sharing, coordination, and driving safety features. Out Client’s members include over 18 million monthly active users located all around the world with millions more in active installs of the app. The Customer Service Agent interacts with Out Client’s users/customers to respond to product and service inquiries; provide information; technical assistance; and resolve complaints. In addition, the Customer Care Representative will provide relevant information to internal partners to enhance the user experience. Responsibilities: Respond to customer support ticket requests; provide exceptional customer service via phone, email, live chat or social media Perform advanced troubleshooting; solve problems and recommend solutions to customer issues Maintain a positive attitude when dealing with all customers, co-workers, and outside contacts Demonstrate appropriate sense of urgency for response times and service levels and achieve specific department service and quality goals on a regular basis Perform other duties as requested/assigned Requirements:  Six months experience in a position with direct Android or iOS troubleshooting experience or working with the various devices (customer service, call center, retail or sales) required. One year or more is a plus. Technical aptitude and the ability to pick up new technology Passion for helping people find solutions Excellent communication skills and ability to convey information effectively Demonstrated ability to work independently Ability to quickly understand new information and situations and develop solution Profile – Preferred Skills and Qualifications:  Proven ability to provide excellent customer service with a diverse user base Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to communicate clearly, patiently and diplomatically over the phone Demonstrated positive, friendly and professional demeanor with ability to engage with all levels of users Strong knowledge of smart phones, i.e., Android & iPhone. Use of at least one is required, knowledge of both is a plus Experience providing tech support for people with limited computer/smart phone skills Strong written communication skills with the ability to communicate in a pleasant, professional and helpful tone Strong team player willing to help others as needed Strong organizational skills and ability to focus on details Ability to learn quickly Strong work ethic, high integrity, & dependable Self-motivated, demonstrates initiative, takes ownership of tasks & has good follow-through Outstanding troubleshooting skills Ability to stay focused in an interrupt-driven environment Reliable and punctual Payrate:  $13.00 per hour + incentives Job Type: Full-time Salary: $13.00 per hour Experience: Technical Support ( Android / iOS Troubleshooting): 1 year (Required) Customer Service / Retail / Sales: 1 year (Preferred) Education: High school or equivalent (Required) Location: Henderson, NV (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required)
Title: Technical Support Specialist

Text: THE THIRD FLOOR is the world’s leading visualization company with offices in Los Angeles and London as well as on location with productions around the world. Since 2004, the studio has helped clients visualize and maximize content by producing computer-animated blueprints, known as “previsualizations”. The Third Floor is a fun, creative company founded by artists, for artists. We work on extremely high-profile projects, while maintaining a small studio culture. The company has won multiple Emmy and VES awards for its work. Recent films projects Marvel’s Avengers Endgame, The Star Wars Franchise & Game of Thrones. The Third Floor is looking for an Unreal Engine Developer for an immersive experience project using the Unreal Game Engine. The ideal candidate will come with extensive Unreal experience. They will work within our Immersive team to support development utilizing game engine technology within the Film, Gaming, Theme-Park and VR industries. Responsibilities: Setting up the project source control (Perforce experience absolutely necessary) Working with the technical artist to define the project organization Work with the supervisor to identify need for custom, show-specific tools, for example review tools like laser pointer, measure, scrub playback etc. Responsible for writing and distributing any tool plugins - must be an efficient developer able to rapidly prototype Lead optimization efforts to maintain the show framerate at VR spec Responsible for making builds and ensuring there is always a backup of working builds UI Programming Essential Skills: C++ & blueprints. Know how to write plugins for Unreal and be comfortable with the Unreal build system Source control Slate/UMG (Unreal UI systems) 3D Math (linear algebra) Shading Languages a plus (HLSL etc) Understanding of the entire 3D rendering pipeline Have shipped a VR project Personal attributes: Able to think creatively and resolve technical challenges and limitations. Excellent communication skills at all levels, both on a technical and creative basis. Artistically as well as technically inclined. Strong time management & organisation skills. Strong teamwork ethic  U.S. Applicants only: TTF participates in E-Verify and we will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. All documents provided for proof of work authorization must be current and unexpired. We cannot accept expired proof of identity.IMPORTANT: If the Government cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, TTF is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact DHS and/or the SSA before taking adverse action against you, including terminating your employment.
Title: Unreal Engine Developer

Text: We are looking for Call Center Managers from any industry to join our growing team. Super Car Guys iso one of the fastest growing car dealerships in Kansas. We are moving into the Kansas City market and offer unmatched opportunity for advancement and a Fast and Fun work environment. This is a career opportunity for the right individual. Please read this entire advertisement before applying – this is NOT an entry level position. We are growing, promoting people, and having LOT’S of fun. SUMMARY As a Call Center Manager in our Business Development Center, you will be responsible for managing a team of phone ninja's setting appointments for all of the car dealerships in our group. Previous automotive experience is NOT required bur is a bonus - we will train the right individual. We work warm to hot leads (NO COLD CALLING), answer questions from prospects, and SELL the appointment. This is very much a SALES POSITION - you are not responsible for selling a car - our team of sales professionals does this, but you ARE responsible for selling the appointment. WHAT WE OFFER Duh, we have a KILLER benefit package including Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, 401K, Paid Vacation, and Paid Personal Time Off. We also have Paid Training, Paid Recognition Programs, and GOBS of Opportunities to Advance. Champions in our organization rise quickly to the top and are promoted to leadership positions where there is virtually no income ceiling. We run a VERY FAST PACED, HIGH ENERGY, and FUN ENVIRONMENT. 50 Hour Work Week working 5 Days a Week. COMPENSATION AND EARNING POTENTIAL Base Salary depending on experience plus an aggressive bonus structure. Under Achievers earn approximately $42,000 annually Average Performers earn approximately $58,000 annually Over Achievers earn up to $90,000 annually WHO AND WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR Call Center Managers with NO experience in the Automotive Industry. We will train you to sell appointments “Our Way.” Call Center Professionals with previous Automotive Experience but always thought to themselves, there has to be a better way to do this. People with a BURNING DESIRE TO WIN AND ACHIEVE. QUALIFICATIONS We can teach skills and knowledge. We cannot teach talent, energy, positive attitude, character, and drive. We can help bring this out of you if you have it inside. We will provide you with 100% of the tools, support, and training it takes to be successful. You will need to provide the positive attitude, drive, and work ethic it takes to be successful. You must be willing to work 5 days a week including Saturdays and NO MORE than 50 hours a week. You must be HIGHLY organized with advanced technology skills (MS Excel, Slack, Zoom, etc.). You must be HIGHLY energetic with advanced management skills. You must be a HIGHLY effective communicator with advanced written and verbal communication skills. You must be coachable and willing to learn new things. ADVANCEMENT Champions in our organization rise to the top and are promoted into leadership positions within our company. We are Movers and Shakers in the Automotive Industry and are adding stores to our empire regularly. We rarely hire from outside of our company for Leadership positions and over 85% of our current Management Team was promoted from within – we put our money where our mouth is when it comes to growth opportunities within our organization. FIVE BIGGEST HURDLES WE STRUGGLE TO OVERCOME IN OUR DEALERSHIPS Laziness Addictions (Drugs, Alcohol, Facebook, YouTube, SnapChat) Lack of Support at Home People with “Victim Mentalities” who blame everyone else for their problems (we can help with this but you need to be willing to participate). “I / ME” people who think the world revolves around them. We hire “WE / US” type people who like being part of something bigger than themselves. Sometimes if you are helping a prospect or customer, you make it home late for dinner. THIS SUCKS, but is a part of our business – we are RETAIL – thus we work some nights and weekends. We work 5 days a week and right around 50 hours a week. Saturday is GAME DAY and is required. We are closed EVERY SINGLE SUNDAY without exception for Family and Worship. We also have either a Tuesday or Wednesday off during the week. Our work schedule allows you plenty of time for kids of all ages, golf, exercise, yard work, errands, volunteer work, etc. IF YOU FIT OUR CRITERIA – WE AREN’T KIDDING, THIS IS A CAREER AND NOT A JOB. CARRY ON AND CAREFULLY FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW: TO APPLY PLEASE SUBMIT THE FOLLOWING:  Cover Letter with information that includes:Why you are interested in the position A little bit about yourself and what makes you a fit for our organization Any additional information, skills, and/or motivation you have that will make a positive impact on our organization Current Accurate Resume EXTRA CREDIT – Send a link to a video of you explaining why you should work for us. We get tons of applications and resumes without cover letters. If you don’t have the time to tell us why you should work with us, we don’t have the time to review your information – no hard feelings, we just wanna be honest. Please send your information via email to: twhite@ridehomehappy.com or submit your information below.
Title: Call Center Manager and Phone Ninja

Title: Business Intern

Text: At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It is a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world. We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they did not even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience. Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented individuals driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists, engineers, clinicians, computational biologists, and more to make new strides. We are dedicated to finding the best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference. About the Role: Customer Service Specialists interfaces with and supports internal and external customers and distributors managing order entry and fulfillment. Builds strong relationships with customers and serves as a liaison between customers and cross-functional groups across the company. Contributes to the company's ability to meet sales goals and revenue targets. What you will be doing: Standard sales order creation and maintenance - Interprets requirements of purchase order details, quotes, and sales or customer inputs to create and maintain stock sales orders in ERP system in accordance with contract guidelines and 10X policies and procedures. Content expert on ERP and CRM teams to enable quote to invoice, opportunity management, and complaint management. Creates and manages products returns, credit and debit memos in ERP system and updates CRM. Coordinates with logistics and field team for pickup or RMA of instruments and provides information/updates to customers and internal teams as needed. Create and manage service requests to field teams in CRM and service contracts in ERP system pursuant to purchase order details, quote and sales or service management input. Handles product and order inquiries via phone and email with internal and external customers to provide direction or solution. Monitors Back Orders and manages updates in system and communication updates to customers and internal staff on a regular basis. Validate accuracy of sales orders. Provide guidance to resolve errors or escalate to Senior Staff or Manager for resolution of errors. Collaborates with internal and regional teams drive on time fulfillment of orders and resolutions of issues to meet or exceed customer expectations. Reads/Analyze Reports in support of order fulfillment. Performs other duties as assigned. To be successful in this role, you must have: 5+ years of customer support experience. Knowledge of ERP and SFDC business systems. Strong written and verbal communication skills, very detail oriented. Strong interpersonal skills. Demonstrated ability to solve problems and work effectively in a team environment. Knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook. Nice to have skills & background: B.S. in life science, chemistry or business preferred. About 10x Genomics 10x Genomics (NASDAQ: TXG) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry, and bioinformatics, our technology is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the mechanisms behind cancer, the immune system, and the fundamentals of biology at the single-cell level. 10x is one of the fastest-growing biotech companies of the decade, growing from $3M in revenue in 2015 to over $200M in 2019, and has backed over 1000 scientific publications in the past four years. For more information, visit www.10xgenomics.com. 10x Genomics is headquartered in Pleasanton, with an office by Embarcadero BART in San Francisco.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.  #LI-KO1

Text: Description  Leidos is seeking an Associate Buyer (Buyer II) located in our Oak Ridge, Tennessee facility. The Associate Buyer is responsible for the procurement of software, software maintenance, data, goods and services, company-wide.  Primary Responsibilities The development and negotiation of favorable prices, terms, schedules and other provisions of purchase orders and acquisition contracts, ensuring consistency with client requirements and procurement policies/procedures under supervisor guidance. Purchase order administration/file maintenance, closeout for all procurement related activities and supplier customer management. Creating solicitations, supporting proposals, conducting price and cost analysis, negotiating price/cost and price/cost-related terms and other subcontract provisions. Procurement of moderate complexity and risk, with some work being more complex and/or riskier with supervisor assistance. Confers with suppliers and analyzes suppliers' operations to determine factors that affect prices and determines lowest cost consistent with quality, reliability, and ability to meet required schedules. Reviews proposals, and selects or recommends suppliers based on gathered information. May also recommend improvements to procurement processes and procedures. Completes larger procurements with moderate manager oversight.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree coupled with less than 2 year’s business experience. Prior experience buying tangible goods is required. Experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel. Good oral and written communication skills. Strong Customer Service mentality.  Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulation desired. CostPoint experience preferred.         Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.
Title: Associate Buyer/Buyer II

Text: Weee!, headquartered in Fremont, California, is the largest and fastest-growing(700% YoY growth) Asian e-grocer providing affordable access to hard-to-find and fresh Asian ingredients directly from the source. By partnering with local suppliers and leveraging proprietary demand forecasting technology, Weee! is reshaping the grocery supply chain entirely. Weee! has received $50M+ in funding to date from Goodwater Capital, iFly.vc, XVC, VMG, Lightspeed Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank., Amino Capital, VMG, XVE and Welight Capital. Weee! is currently available in the San Francisco Bay Area, Sacramento, Seattle, and Los Angeles and is gearing up for significant service expansion nationwide slated for the next 12 months.   We're looking for a data analyst to help support various operation initiatives by transforming operation data into valuable business insights and help shape our projects to deliver maximum impact. Work closely with our operation team to create and track key metrics for our operations, and share informative actionable insights Improve existing process for warehouse operations Ensure accurate inventory reporting Optimize capacity of warehouse Build dashboards, self-service tools, and ad hoc reports to analyze and present data associated with business operations, and strategic decision making Identify actionable insights, suggest recommendations, and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating metrics and results to stakeholders. Partner with Data Engineering to craft our data infrastructure investments in support of BI needs and insure the proper tracking and quality of the data  MS in Math, Statistics, or other closely-related quantitative field Expert in data analysis, visualization, and communication, with prior full-time work experience strongly preferred (knowledge of ecommerce operations and experience in inventory management and forecasting) Experience creating dashboards/visualizations using, e.g., Tableau (or similar) Proficiency with SQL, and comfort with Python or any other scripting language Ability to work in a fast-paced start-up environment and deliver excellent results Strong communication skills, and ability to work with multiple stakeholders.  Comprehensive health insurance package, including medical, dental, and vision Free lunch daily, catered by local restaurants Annual bonus opportunities Vacation and holiday time off Monthly Weee! Points credit

Text: Ca’ Momi is the love child of three passionate Italian business partners & co-owners. Their mission is to share their Italian heritage & bring community, friends & family together around the table. Ca’ Momi calls what they do “heartcrafted”, because that’s how they work: with passion, integrity, & authenticity. They honor the values of an earlier time, from local & organic ingredient sourcing, VPN/APN-certified Neapolitan pizzas, house-made traditional foods, to zero-pretension wines & all-natural craft spirits. They dream big & are working to build a heart-centered community where everyone has a sense of purpose, belonging, & possibility. Eat. Drink. Be. Authentic. Position Summary: This technical position will be primarily responsible for managing the corporate systems infrastructure. You will be part of a small IT team performing system and client maintenance and administration on a day to day basis. Competence in the following areas: servers, infrastructure, data storage, cloud and network technologies; with a heavy emphasis on virtualization, Microsoft Windows Server and back-office services. Most of the infrastructure work will be sites located in the Napa. Reports to: IT/Business Operations Director Classification: F/T, Exempt Compensation: Salary DOE The role will be responsible for the following (but not limited to): Develops, manages and maintains data center, business systems and corporate architecture. Design and implement new O365 and MS Azure systems, while implementing best practices. Develop plan and implement migration of on-premises infrastructure to MS Azure cloud. Responsible for managing and maintaining system and database backups. Respond to escalated user issues and requests, support calls and production issues. Provide database system administration for SQL databases and services. Responsible for developing server and client systems management tool. Developing and ensuring consistent technical documentation deliverables (diagrams, SOPs, KB’s, Policies etc.). Independently manage small/medium sized technology related IT projects and business relationships. All other duties as assigned. Knowledge, skills and abilities Strong analytical, problem-solving and conceptual skills. Strong customer focus and team orientation disposition. Motivated self-starter, with a high capacity for rapid learning and attention to detail. Able to effectively communicate with business and technical users in verbal and written form. A multitasker, with strong project management skills allowing you to oversee multiple projects at once. Ability to manage 3rd party vendors and contractors on required projects. Knowledge of and familiarity with manufacturing business or food & beverage industry is preferred. Education and experience Minimum of 10 years IT experience and 5 years of related role experience. Bachelor's degree in IT, Computer Science or related area or 6 years of equivalent work experience. Prior experience with architecting system/data center infrastructure design for medium sized business. 4+ of virtualization experience, including Hyper-V and VMware. 6+ years Active Directory management and troubleshooting experience. 6+ years in Microsoft Windows Server Operating Systems 2012 through 2019. 2+ years with databases technologies and SQL databases is preferred. Demonstrated experience using PowerShell Scripting and other scripting and automation tools. Experience with DR, backup (Veeam), and cloud storage technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.) Strong experience supporting Microsoft Server and O365 applications and administration. Experience with network, security and VoIP system administration a plus. Experience as a Network Engineer and Administration of Azure technologies a plus. Microsoft Azure and ITIL certifications are a plus
Title: Systems Engineer

Text: Financial Analyst – Healthcare Revenue Cycle Management About Centauri Health Solutions:  Centauri Health Solutions is a healthcare technology and services company powered by analytics. Our tailored solutions enable health plans and hospitals to manage variable revenue, through a custom-built workflow platform, which seamlessly integrates cross-functional service and support. We offer Risk Adjustment, a variety of Eligibility and Enrollment Services to meet the needs of specialized populations, Out-of-State Billing and Quality program efforts. Role Overview:  Support Centauri’s healthcare business intelligence service lines which provides services and technology that allow providers to improve revenue cycle performance. The Financial Analyst will join the Pricing Analytics team, reporting to the Director of Financial Analytics, and will employ statistical techniques to interpret data and analyze results that will be the foundation of our proposed pricing strategies for our clients. The Financial Analyst should be, proactive, committed, and passionate about being a part of a high-growth team. Role Responsibilities:  Support product solutions by requesting, processing, and preparing monthly data sets for modeling tools. Review and prepare client monthly data files for modeling and quarterly monitoring reports. Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques. Build and execute strategic pricing models. Conduct web-based presentations to senior hospital leadership. Understand and agree to role-specific information security access and responsibilities Ensure safety and confidentiality of data and systems by adhering to the organizations information security policies Read, understand and agree to security policies and complete all annual security and compliance training Role Requirements:  Bachelor’s degree Demonstrated analytical skills and ability to work with large data sets. Hospital finance/revenue cycle experience and familiarity with managed care contract language Advanced Excel skills Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, including strong presentation skills Sharp analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills Possess an independent, thoughtful, and disciplined mindset Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized Thrive in a "time sensitive" environment and adaptable to change without compromising quality of work Self-motivated and driven to succeed with strong experience in financial planning and analysis Familiarity with the Windows’ command prompt execution and editing of text- based configuration files is a strong plus Exposure to Epic, Soarian, MS4, or Meditech systems is a strong plus Proficiency with SQL queries, script programming to perform data manipulation highly desired We believe strongly in providing employees a rewarding work environment in which to grow, excel and achieve personal as well as professional goals. We offer our employees competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous paid time off, a matching 401(k) program, tuition reimbursement, annual salary reviews, a comprehensive health plan, the opportunity to participate in volunteer activities on company time, and development opportunities. Centauri Health Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. Text: Works within a Business Rule Management environment to support creation, testing, optimization, and maintenance of business rules that monitor and control money laundering and fraud risks. Focus on critical analytics and data mining skills to help drive efficiencies and transparency of the rules platform. Identifies key risks and mitigating factors of AML/CTF, fraud and other risks factors such as: product/services, geographic, customer or operational. Conducts statistical analyses to quantify risk, business impacts, and develop parameters. Performs a method for ongoing assessment of the effectiveness and sufficiency of current rules and develops associated reporting and reporting of money laundering and fraud rules. Conducts research and analysis of source data in connection with creating and maintaining all compliance rules. Improves decision making and analytics needed to set parameters and thresholds for business rules. Continually evaluates new variables to consider when writing new rules to respond to business needs, translating those needs into sets of configurable rules and considering potential impacts to the system. Assists with maintaining rules platform, deploying rule sets, and triaging and tracking quality assurance and system issues. Performs other duties as assigned. BA /BS degree in a quantitative field such as mathematics, statistics, quantitative finance, econometrics, engineering, computer science, or actuarial sciences. CAMS of CFE certification within 12 months of hire. Masters or PhD, preferred. 7+ years of experience in the analytics or quantitative research team at a leading financial services organization, consulting firm, or a leading analytic solutions provider. Thorough understanding and experience working with mass analytic/big data technologies. Money laundering/anti-fraud compliance or risk management experience. Experience in any of the following areas: AML Compliance Technology, fraud detection/prevention technology, Bank Secrecy Act or anti-money laundering compliance, FATF guidance, preferred. Experience working with “Business Rules Engines” tools and methodology. Demonstrated analytical skills – ability to find and evaluate information from internal and external sources and make sound decisions about compliance. Experience harvesting rules from functional and technical business requirements, documenting business rules vs writing a use case. Strong technical skills to include SQL Server, Advanced SQL, Transact SQL or PL\SQL skills used in a data analytics capacity. Strong PC skills to include MS Excel pivot tables & V-Lookups, Word, report writers and database applications. Interest and ability in working both independently and highly collaboratively. Demonstrated professional oral and written communication skills. Excellent demonstrated organizational skills, including time management, record keeping, self-scheduling, and follow-up. Quantitative risk modeling experience, strongly preferred.

Text: Conversion Labs, a rapidly growing national telemedicine company, is seeking an experienced digital health compliance professional to fill a Chief Compliance Officer (CCO) position. The CCO will develop and run the Compliance program supporting the Company’s expanding portfolio of direct-to-consumer telemedicine and over the counter healthcare products. The CCO will be responsible for overseeing the advertising compliance program and all internal and third-party virtual providers and will leverage and collaborate with Conversion Lab’s Executive Team, outside advertising and FDA counsel, and key business stakeholders. The CCO will act as the key executive responsible for all compliance activities and issues, communicating and collaboration with appropriate parties across the Company. This role requires a cross-business customer centric view into Conversion Labs’ business units and digital and other marketing initiatives. The right person will have broad knowledge in FDA regulations and digital marketing regulatory frameworks, technology and business operations. The CCO should have a fundamental understanding of ways to leverage technology to optimize compliance related marketing controls and activities. The CCO should also have experience with implementing and managing cyber-security controls that ensure Conversion Labs’ digital offerings are compliant with relevant data privacy laws such as HIPAA and GDPR. You will get to work in an exciting, engaging and agile startup environment where you will be encouraged to expand your skills, test your creative boundaries and share new ideas. Key Responsibilities: The CCO will effectively implement and run a compliance program for the Company’s marketing initiatives that is effective in monitoring and approving marketing and advertising in compliance with the various state and federal laws and regulations impacting this activity. Responsible for implementing and maintaining compliance monitoring, updating policies and procedures, reporting, testing, and applying regulatory guidance as well as industry best practices. Monitor the effectiveness of established compliance processes and controls; recommend and implement enhancements Promote, protect and set the tone to reflect the Company’s reputation for ethics, integrity and honesty in all dealings Communicate regulatory requirements and assist business units in maintaining a control environment that mitigates compliance risk Escalate compliance concerns timely and effectively to business line management and to the Executive Team. Provide compliance support for new product initiatives. Integrate benchmarking and best practices through ongoing research, education and industry analysis Qualifications Five plus years of DIGITAL marketing or other related experience. Thorough and current regulatory knowledge and understanding of FDA regulations and FTC regulations, including digital marketing compliance issues and consumer compliance regulations. Expertise and extensive knowledge of digital health platforms, including corresponding regulations and operations with the ability to oversee and advise on the development and maintenance of strong advice targeted at mitigating compliance risk associated with digital health and other marketing activities Strong understanding or ability to quickly acquire a strong understanding of digital health platforms, including the various state regulations that apply to them. The ability to break down complex regulatory requirements into easily understood concepts and succinctly communicate this to various business partners. Knowledge of regulatory requirements related to HIPAA and the ability to oversee and put in place a compliance program to ensure ongoing compliance across different offices, and business associates of Conversion Labs. Familiarity with concepts, tools and advertising techniques used by digital marketing teams. Experience with developing, implementing Compliance programs, including policies and procedures, controls, monitoring and testing. Understanding of customer transactions and communication, operational work flows, internet technologies, as well as development methodology for a complex multi-business environment Ability to work and react quickly in a fast-paced, agile environment Proven communication skills (verbal, written, interpersonal) to interact with all levels of management Relationship management and experience with direct leadership of teams Strong research skills. Ability to interpret rules and analyze complex issues Ability to reach sound judgments and act quickly under tight deadlines while balancing competing priorities Creative and strategic approach to problem solving and change management Proven analytical and project management skills Bachelor's degree required. Advanced degree is a plus Powered by JazzHR xRc1ZVhEmQ

Text: We are a licensed cultivation facility that focuses in cannabis, located in the Pacoima, Los Angeles Area. Our cultivation is currently operating and in the process of expanding. We are looking for an experienced Cultivation Manager who is interested in growing with our company and managing a small cultivation team which will increase as construction progresses. Applicant must have experience in the legal and regulated market.  Summary/Objective  The Cultivation Manager is responsible for the daily operation of the cultivation and management of all plants including, but not limited to, mothers, clones, vegetative stage plants, flowering plants, and drying plants. The Cultivation Manager oversees and participates in activities related to the care and maintenance of the cultivation by allocating tasks, directly supervising employees, job scheduling, and quality control. Additionally, the Cultivation Manager is responsible for hiring, training, scheduling, and reviewing employees.  Essential Functions  Provides daily direction and communication to grow technicians to complete daily tasks. Provides continual evaluation of processes and procedures. Responsible for improving efficiency and operations. Controls cultivation environments in several rooms to maintain optimal conditions for plant growth. Counsels, coaches, and resolves conflicts with employees experiencing personal and/or professional difficulties. Ensures employees have appropriate training and resources to complete tasks. Inspects plants for quality control. Identifies tasks that need to be completed, growth irregularities, and potential crop threats. Follows fertilizer mixing procedures and mixes fertilizer according to maturity of plants and ensures all plants are watered adequately based on the dosage set by the Head Grower. Inspects and maintains functional irrigation and adjusts feeding according to plant needs. Maintains a high-quality work environment that motivates and fosters teamwork and positivity. Takes appropriate disciplinary action as needed involving employee conduct and performance according to company policy. Maintains performance expectations set forth by company policy and reports employee performance to Head Grower. Assists Head Grower with development, analysis, and implementation of staffing, training, scheduling, and operations. Acts as a leader/member on special or ongoing projects that are important to operational success. Establishes processes and procedures in support of company and departmental standards and strategic directives. Manages and accurately inputs Metrc data to assure compliance.  Core Competencies  Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills to interact with team members and senior support personnel. Ability to lead team members efficiently and effectively to complete daily tasks. Ability to organize tasks, team members, and supplies/inventory. Management and analysis of employee performance to track tasks and improve processes. Ability to identify, define, and solve problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw conclusions necessary to provide solutions to a wide variety of conditions. Technical literacy and ability to calculate figures, proportions, ratios, volumes, and percentages in relation to the application of fertilizers, water, and chemicals. Adaptability and multitasking in a fast paced, stressful environment. Familiarity with Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Outlook, and Excel. Other core competencies as defined by the company.  Work Environment  The Cultivation Manager operates in an environment of living organisms. Successful operation involves maintaining a clean and sanitary workplace. The Cultivation Manager will routinely use growing equipment such as water pumps, reservoirs, hoses, propagation equipment (trays, inserts, and domes), pitchers, scales, nutrients, general office supplies, gloves, and technology necessary to job function. The cultivation operates on a five-day rotating schedule.  Schedule  The nature and scope of the Cultivation Manager requires open availability. This is a full-time position with days and hours varying according to operational needs.  Physical Demands  The Cultivation Manager must be deemed physically fit to successfully perform necessary functions of the position. This includes standing for up to 8 hours, walking, squatting, climbing, crawling, reaching, and lifting up to 60 lbs.  Experience/Education  Experience in a management position is required, including direct supervision of 5 or more employees. 3+ years of experience growing cannabis in a large production environment. Experience in Metrc preferred. Bachelor degree preferred.  Other Duties  Often the Cultivation Manager performs functions outside of this job description, and this description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of duties. This can include preventative and scheduled maintenance on equipment, and a wide variety of equipment repairs including fixing pumps, trays, racks, reservoirs, and lights. Powered by JazzHR PDhz4XZCrJ
Title: Cultivation Manager- Cannabis

Text: Job #747: Cyber Security Controls Assessor - Senior Location: San Francisco, CA Qualifications: Bachelors in Computer Science, or related discipline, or equivalent experience Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC) certification Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) certification Experience in Information Technology (IT) risk management, or related, 5yrs Experience in Information Technology (IT), 5yrs Utility industry experience Responsibilities: Cyber Security Controls Assessor - Senior - NERC CIP Position Summary The Cyber Security Controls Assessment family is responsible for the assessment, verification, review, and audit of General Computer Controls across the enterprise. The Cyber Security Controls Assessor, Senior (“Assessor”) – NERC CIP, will be responsible for assessments which will require review and evaluation of network, computing assets and platforms for compliance with defined NERC standards, internal processes, and procedures. Additionally, the Assessor will be responsible for the identification of risks, evaluation of control deficiencies, and recommendation on remediation efforts consistent with IT organizational policies, standards, procedures, and regulatory requirements. Duties and Responsibilities  * Develop test procedures and/or document recommendations for test plan modifications that improve validation of control objectives. Test procedure development may cover a wide range of technically diverse topics ranging from IP Network Discovery, password length and complexity requirements, vulnerability management, and many others.  * Perform multi-platform (application, database, operating system, middleware, monitoring tools, and business processes) level audits based on predefined test objectives and test plans. Perform retest of controls that have been remediated or updated as a result of previously identified deficiencies. Obtain, review, and interpret evidence provided to validate controls are performed effectively.  * Prepare, plan, conduct, and report on results of IT Compliance assessments in accordance with industry best practices and established regulatory standards (NIST SP800-53, SP800-115, SOX, NERC CIP v5).  * Obtain, review, and interpret organizational IT policies, standards and procedures to identify control points that would assist in mitigating risk to the business.  * Review test results or interpret evidence to address vulnerabilities, gaps, or control deficiencies; work with stakeholders to establish plans for sustainable resolution.  * Identify risks associated with control failures and supports the identification of mitigating controls  * Engage management in discussion about creative, efficient, and effective was to improve internal control environment  * Partner with control owners to ensure control documentation is updated periodically to reflect current control environment  * Capture and report metrics for services and activities delivered to customers and/or as part of internal initiatives  * Perform other tasks as necessary to ensure that the Compliance meets its commitments to customers  * May provide consultative direction to less experienced team members  * Support the Compliance Sr. Manager/Manager as needed. Comments/Special InstructionsThis is a requisition for the Cyber Security Controls Assessor - Senior - NERC CIP position. Local only: Top 3: IT Audit/Controls testing experience, Technical security assessments (network/infrastructure layer), NERC CIP assessment experience Contract length: 6 months Job Types: Full-time, Contract Experience: Cyber Security: 6 years (Preferred) Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
Title: Cyber Security Analyst

Text: At Capital One, we’re building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.  Cloud Security Engineer  Do you want to work for a tech company that writes its own code, develops its own software, and builds its own products? We experiment and innovate leveraging the latest technologies, engineer breakthrough customer experiences, and bring simplicity and humanity to banking. We make a difference for 65 million customers. At Capital One, you'll be part of a group of makers, breakers, doers, and disruptors, who love to solve real problems and meet real customer needs. We want you to be curious and ask “what if”?  We are seeking a highly creative and intellectually curious (CASB) Security Engineer to be instrumental in accelerating Capital One’s transformation to DevOps and the public cloud as well as adoption of security automation. As part of an internal engineering security team, you will specialize in helping the CASB Application team to drive efficiency, security, and reliability into their entire development to operations lifecycle. You will strategize, consult, and prototype alongside other engineers to implement best practices and solutions for applications utilizing CI/CD and the Cloud. You will drive CASB functionality to emerging SaaS platforms.  Responsibilities: Track Network flow and obtain packet captures to solve network routing issues Ensure operational uptime and resiliency of the CASB platform Ability to plan and lead an engagement with an application team to adopt our CASB platform for Risk Controls Engineer, consult and upskill other engineers on DevOps and CASB solutions Generating innovative ideas, developing proof-of-concepts and rapid prototypes alongside other engineers Ability to clearly articulate and explain complex concepts and technologies to a non-technical audience Ability to function in a rapidly evolving environment and adapt to frequent transitions in technologies and teams Possess strong analytical, interpersonal and verbal communication skills due to the dynamic nature of collaborations with customers, vendors, and other engineering teams, as well as solving complex system problems together  Basic Qualifications: High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification At least 2 years of experience in Enterprise Application Support At least 2 years of experience in network setup and troubleshooting At least 1 year of experience working with enterprise proxy solutions At least 1 year of experience reading packet captures from the network  Preferred Qualifications: 3+ years of Cyber Security experience 2+ years of experience as a lead on IT Projects 1+ year of experience with Amazon Web Services CCNA certification CISSP certification  At this time, Capital One will not sponsor a new applicant for employment authorization for this position.
Title: Cloud Security Engineer

Text: IT Systems & Network Administrator – Full-Time Our Client, Federal Hearings & Appeals Services Inc. (FHAS), located in Plymouth PA, is hiring an IT Systems & Network Administrator to join their team. This position will have a clear understanding of the company’s mission, vision and goals, along with the creative skills to ensure that our technological infrastructure runs smoothly and efficiently. He/She must demonstrate a passion for technology and learning by actively seeking to broaden knowledge on emerging system and network tools, techniques and technologies. This position manages servers and technology tools, monitors performance and maintains systems according to requirements, troubleshoot issues and outages. Ensures issues related to service disruptions for business critical IT services are identified and resolved in a timely manner for local and remote users. Identifies the source and nature of complex IT problems (network outages, hardware and software malfunctions, and support calls reported by internal and external customers; and determines solutions to resolve them. Researches issues and responds with the appropriate remedial actions. Identifies and recommends possible opportunities and improvements regarding procedures, systems and/or remedial techniques. Manages security monitoring tools to ensure the detection of security events such as attacks and data loss. Identifies opportunities where emerging technologies could have a positive impact on processes. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, capable of learning quickly and independently with minimal oversight and management. Other key competencies include: · Technical Ability: Strong grasp of high level concepts regarding network and systems. Java/J2EE Linux/Unix Presentation tier: HTML/HTML 5, CSS 3, AJAX, JavaScript, JSP, JSF, jQuery, Node.js, SPAs (AngularJS, Bootstrap, React, Backbone, etc.) etc. Middle/business logic tier: Spring MVC, JEE 6+, etc. Data access tier: Hibernate, JDBC, MyBatis, jOOQ, SQL, etc. Application servers: JBoss, WebLogic, WebSphere, etc. RDBMS databases: MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, etc. Software development tools (Eclipse) Build tools: Maven, Gradle, Ant, etc. Unit testing: JUnit or other unit test technologies Scrum tools: JIRA, SpiraTeam, Pivotal Tracker, Trello, Basecamp, Rally, Version One, etc. Streaming Data and Big Data experience: Spark, Flink, Beam, Heron, Storm, Kafka, ZooKeeper, HBase, Couchbase, MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Neo4J, InfiniteGraph, AWS, etc. IoT devices integration experience is a big plus Work for an industry leader and innovative company Work for a profitable and well-funded late stage startup with a great upside potential Work with multiple leading edge technologies including IoT, Streaming Data, Big Data and SaaS Job satisfaction you will be an important part of the company, and your contributions will have visibility all the way to the top and your contributions will have direct impact on the companys future 401K with employer match Pre-IPO stock options  Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Text: Job Description The Technology Engineer I is an entry level engineering position with primary duties of monitoring, reviewing, and analyzing the digital data (CORE) collected by our completion rigs and support equipment. This position may be responsible for the preparation of Key Performance Indicator (KPI) reports and customer specific “score cards” including summary observations of job issues. Additionally, this role may be involved in developing the data findings into reportable presentations to Axis management and customers. These objectives will be achieved by having strong computer and data analytical skills along with a mechanical aptitude leading to developing on-the-job experience identifying systems components, issues, and ability to troubleshoot with a solutions mindset. Job Functions/Duties:  Work with CORE system sensors and specialized system tools. Identifies instrumentation of key parts of the well service rigs to analyze drill out data. Monitors data recording processes to capture data real time. Prepare modeling of drill outs and exceptions to the drill out. Works with operations in data review to identify exceptions. Identifies important KPI data to review with operations management and customers (if applicable). Develops continuous improvement culture so that drill out cycle times continue to be reduced. Qualifications and Education Requirements:  Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering preferred– Mechanical or Petroleum. Two (2) years in product design and oil and gas equipment data analysis; relevant industry education in industrial, engineering or related experience. Computer proficiency and technical aptitude in Microsoft products (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Microsoft BI and CAD experience is a plus. Previous electronics and data field technician experience in an oil field service company such as coil tubing, wireline or drilling is a plus. Mobility and ability to use ladders or other access devices up to 15 ft.; ability to bend, stoop, twist, stand, squat, crawl and walk. Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and written; English preferred. Ability to interact with others in a team and fast-paced environment Solid math skills and problem solving and organizational skills. Must be able to work a varied schedule and travel as job requires. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: instrumentation : 2 years (Required) Microsoft BI: 1 year (Required) oil & gas equipment data analysis: 2 years (Required) CAD: 1 year (Required) mechanical engineering: 2 years (Required) Microsoft Suite: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Longview, TX 75603 (Required) Language: English (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Required travel: 25% (Preferred) Company's website: www.axisofs.com Work Remotely: No
Title: Technology Engineer I
