Text: Description  Leidos is seeking an Associate Buyer (Buyer II) located in our Oak Ridge, Tennessee facility. The Associate Buyer is responsible for the procurement of software, software maintenance, data, goods and services, company-wide.  Primary Responsibilities The development and negotiation of favorable prices, terms, schedules and other provisions of purchase orders and acquisition contracts, ensuring consistency with client requirements and procurement policies/procedures under supervisor guidance. Purchase order administration/file maintenance, closeout for all procurement related activities and supplier customer management. Creating solicitations, supporting proposals, conducting price and cost analysis, negotiating price/cost and price/cost-related terms and other subcontract provisions. Procurement of moderate complexity and risk, with some work being more complex and/or riskier with supervisor assistance. Confers with suppliers and analyzes suppliers' operations to determine factors that affect prices and determines lowest cost consistent with quality, reliability, and ability to meet required schedules. Reviews proposals, and selects or recommends suppliers based on gathered information. May also recommend improvements to procurement processes and procedures. Completes larger procurements with moderate manager oversight.  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree coupled with less than 2 year’s business experience. Prior experience buying tangible goods is required. Experience with Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel. Good oral and written communication skills. Strong Customer Service mentality.  Preferred Qualifications Knowledge of the Federal Acquisition Regulation desired. CostPoint experience preferred.         Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.
Title: Associate Buyer/Buyer II

Text: Role: A great recruiter stands apart by excelling at talent identification, attraction and assessment, and by developing deep partnerships with the business and within HR. An extraordinary recruiter stands out by doing all of the above combined with strong business savvy, a passion for their craft, and a genuine commitment for providing an unforgettable candidate experience. Tesla is looking for a Technical Recruiter at the Fremont Factory supporting technical manufacturing recruitment. You will thrive at Tesla by striking the right balance between flexibility and efficiency, project management and influencing. One hire at a time, we are finding the talent responsible for changing the world of energy and transportation and moving us forward to a more sustainable future. When you’re doing something nobody has ever done before, the old ways can frequently come up short. At Tesla, you’ll get the opportunity to be creative, to try, to fail, to learn and to succeed. You will have an appetite for risk, for taking that big bet, because that’s how we leap ahead together. Responsibilities Partnering with business leaders and hiring managers to assess their talent requirements and advising on the best hiring strategy Shepherding the time and resources at your disposal effectively and keeping your business partners up to speed on a regular basis Using a variety of techniques and creativity to discover and attract the best passive talent Conducting thorough behavioral based interviews and phone screens to assess both technical baseline as well as skills be successful in the Tesla environment Focusing on providing a great candidate experience at every opportunity Requirements BS/BA or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability High volume recruiting experience with the ability to efficiently manage an average of 50+ requisitions Minimum of 1-2 years recruiting experience, preferably from both a corporate and/or agency environment Experience in engineering and manufacturing recruitment. Demonstrated track record of excellence in sourcing and assessing technical talent Proven relationship management experience with hiring teams and business partners, helping them navigate the sources of talent and assisting them with assessment A genuine interest in technology as shown by continuous learning throughout your career Skilled in offer negotiation, awareness of pertinent employment legislation and employment market trends The ability to lead projects to successful conclusion – balancing efficiency with quality Computer savvy – ATS experience and Microsoft Office Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
Title: Technical Recruiter

Text: Delek US Holdings, Inc. is a diversified downstream energy company with assets in petroleum refining, logistics, renewable fuels and convenience store retailing. The refining assets consist of refineries operated in Tyler and Big Spring, Texas, El Dorado, Arkansas and Krotz Springs, Louisiana with a combined nameplate crude throughput capacity of 302,000 barrels per day.  The logistics operations primarily consist of Delek Logistics Partners, LP. Delek US Holdings, Inc.and its affiliates own approximately 63% (including the 2 percent general partner interest) of Delek Logistics Partners, LP. Delek Logistics Partners, LP (NYSE:DKL) is a growth-oriented master limited partnership focused on owning and operating midstream energy infrastructure assets.  The convenience store retail business is the largest 7-Eleven licensee in the United States and operates approximately 300 convenience stores in central and west Texas and New Mexico. Position Summary: Responsible for the maintenance, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems, network servers, and virtualization. Install and upgrade computer components and software, maintain virtual servers, troubleshoot hardware and software errors, document problems and resolutions. Monitor regular backup operations and implement appropriate processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures. Assist with desktop support efforts to ensure all desktop applications, workstations, and related equipment problems are resolved in a timely manner with limited disruption to end users.  Education Requirement: Associate or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field, or equivalent experience required. System administration and IT certifications in Microsoft, or other network related fields are a plus.  Experience Requirement: Working knowledge of virtualization, VMWare, strong knowledge of systems and networking software, hardware, and networking protocols, 5+ years of database, network administration, or system administration experience, Microsoft Office products, relational databases, Windows Operating Systems, and/or direct computing support activities including knowledge of equipment, application software, and operating system software required.  Excellent communication skills required to interact with internal and external contacts as well as all levels of management.  Demonstrate thorough understanding of primary function/system for an area, understanding both functional and technical knowledge, ability to diagnose complex problems and handle multiple problems simultaneously that may cross multiple departments/systems and impact numerous end users or areas of the business, ability to prioritize and work autonomously, ability to formulate new or better process or ideas, establish effective working relationships and communicate appropriately according to level of understanding, and ability to lead and/or attend meetings to represent area.  Ability to identify an issue, analyze, and research the problem, and begin to formulate a solution and/or recommendation.  Refinery business and operations knowledge preferred.  Major Accountabilities: Functional Support: Work on complex applications systems analysis and software systems programming applications or configuration. Conduct research to learn current trends in technology, generate improvement suggestions, and present findings to supervisors. Develop training material/documentation. Train others in the work group as required.I/S Support: Provide on-site support of computing hardware and software, to include the most complex needs analysis, configuration, installation, moves, and changes for location. Perform research and repair activity, including vendor coordination, necessary to ensure computer service for all supported locations. Identify, isolate, and repair of equipment and software effecting computer network service to all supported locations. Test applications and equipment. Evaluate new and existing software products. Some travel may be required. Other duties as required may be assigned.  Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to walk, sit, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; use hands to handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and may occasionally be required to climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.  Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The individual must be able to take 24-hour call including weekdays, nights, weekends and holidays and may be required to work extended hours as required. Must be able to wear fire retardant clothing, and other related PPE when addressing issues in the refinery. Must be able to travel by common carrier as required. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Equal Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veterans.

Text: Job Code: 21132 Pay Status/FLSA Code: Exempt Position Title: Quality Improvement Specialist Reports To: Division Chief of Support Services Job Family: QI/IT Reviewed & Updated: May 2020  About Us: Falck USA is a global emergency medical services provider originating from Denmark that services 9 states in the US including: Alabama, California, Washington, Oregon, Florida, Maryland, Colorado, and Georgia. Falck has been operating in the US since 2010 and is the second largest private provider of emergency medical services in the country today. Our BLS and ALS services impact not only the lives of our patients, but their families and communities. Why work for Falck USA: If you are looking for an opportunity to develop your skills, grow and develop your career, and make an impact within your community, we are the right fit for you! Submit your application today using the link below for further consideration. Position Summary: The Quality Improvement Specialist is responsible for all QI tracking, ESO updating and training, CAD reconciliation, and user and systems level support of critical business processes, including ePCR hardware and software support. Essential Functions: The Quality Assurance Representative may be assigned one or more duties. These duties may include, but are not limited to, the following: Collaborate with Medical Director, Administrative Staff, and Local/Regional Organizations to develop and implement quality metrics and performance measures (Outcome, Process, Structural, Balancing) while utilizing benchmarks for performance improvement. Develop and maintain data workflow within the organization for evaluation, analysis, and implementation of structured improvement processes to facilitate performance enhancements. Provides training on ePCR hardware and software to EMTs, Paramedics, Managers, and other key staff members as part of orientation and on an ongoing basis. Coordinate continuous quality improvement program to include internal and external customer feedback loop and closure. CQI tracking and CAD reconciliation. Accept feedback from managers, users, and affiliated personnel for improvement of existing or proposed designs. Provide technical guidance to vendors, managers, and co-workers. Work closely with outside agencies on troubleshooting and project implementation. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Knowledge of ambulance, dispatch, and billing operations. Excellent analytical skills and quality orientation-strives for continuous improvement in all activities to consistently achieve excellent results and meet or exceed department expectations. Ability to deliver training programs to assist with implementation and ongoing training on ePCR and other technology used at Falck. Ability to self-start without specific direction and work with little immediate supervision. Understanding of ESO ePCR Administration and the interfaces used to integrate the product with Dispatch, Field Operations, and Billing. Understanding of QI Programs including FirstWatch/FirstPass, QI Macros, and IHI improvement science concepts. Use of industry best-practices and implementation standards in deploying and support of software applications or hardware. Computer competency including proficiency with Microsoft Suite, and understanding of database programs. Highly dependable and ability to meet internal deadlines consistently. Strong organizational skills and attentiveness to detail. Flexible and adaptive, willing and able to adjust to rapidly changing priorities.  Falck is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer / An Equal Opportunity Employer. Our employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, gender identity, gender expression, citizenship, ancestry, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, military status, marital status, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Text: EB&L Marketing is seeking a driven, detail-oriented Front-End Web Developer with a desire to be part of an agency environment. The ideal candidate has a high level of competence with mobile-first web development best practices, understands the basics of SEO, is continually learning about new technologies and loves the challenge of building custom websites. This role is responsible for implementing custom website designs in content management systems such as WordPress, Drupal, and HubSpot. Working knowledge of PHP is a huge plus. Responsibilities Participates in the design review process, asking necessary questions to determine functional requirements and troubleshoots failed designs and systems independently. Writes, tests, and maintains front-end code using WordPress or Drupal content management systems, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript. Repairs and makes changes to existing site builds. Creates prototypes and staging sites for review and feedback using our hosting server. Assists with the maintenance and improvement of client websites using a data-driven approach. Collaborates cross-departmentally to develop and consistently improve a highly integrated online experience. Learns, grows, and innovates. Requirements Proficiency in WordPress Proficiency in HTML5, JQuery, CSS3 and JavaScript Builds with a “mobile-first” mentality Working understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS Awareness of the latest and legacy browser capabilities, including mobile Ability to understand and implement web designs with a high level of quality and function Willingness to troubleshoot, solve complex problems and implement user-friendly solutions for our team and clients Ability to manage multiple projects and adapt to changing requirements and instructions Excellent communication skills Willingness to broaden skills and resolve helpdesk tasks as part of a team Extras Knowledge of Drupal 7, Drupal 8, HubSpot CMS, Magento, Shopify, PHP Experience with JavaScript frameworks like Ember, AngularJS, React, etc., or JS-based build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and Bower Have a zest for emerging trends and technologies with a willingness to share knowledge and teach others Salary Please forward resume and salary requirements. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Flexible Schedule Health Insurance Paid Time Off Schedule: 8 Hour Shift Day shift Monday to Friday Work Location: Fully Remote This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative This Job Is: A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to apply A job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to apply Company's website: ebandlmarketing.com Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/eblmarketing Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible

Text: Create Strategies, Lead Clients, Manage Talent, Drive Profitability Join Our CompanyThrive Internet Marketing Agency (https://thriveagency.com) is one of the fastest-growing and top digital marketing agencies in the world. We are a full-service agency that handles everything in-house and delivers massive and sustainable growth to our business partners and clients. We think about our work in two words: Relationships and Results. President Matt Bowman founded Thrive in 2005 and has grown the company to more than 140 employees in 35 states and eight different countries. We have a deeply-rooted, talented team (respectfully referred to as Thrivers) of project managers, web designers, content writers, social media specialists and search engine optimization specialists. We are a close-knit team that is motivated, smart, disciplined and committed to turning ideas into actions. We now have new headquarters located in Arlington, Texas, and have an exciting opportunity for a Director of Operations to join our Leadership Team (and you can live anywhere in the country!). What is it like working at Thrive? Watch our videos to learn more. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5-0RgETB0l8 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L6SmpElBl_k https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pmt7OaqS7Rg&t=4s Qualifications:  10 years of experience (preferably with a digital marketing agency). Can easily demonstrate a strong depth of knowledge in digital marketing, media and technology. Gets excited about process improvement and managing large teams. Passionate about delivering value to our clients. Lives and breathes process improvement to improve our solution offerings. Ensures quality of everything we do. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience working in and managing a remote workforce. Deep technical knowledge is a plus. Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Marketing, Digital Technologies or similar, relevant field Responsibilities:  Operations Assist the President in formulating effective growth strategies, plans and procedures. Possess P&L responsibilities to ensure financial growth and profitability. Plan, coordinate and execute the annual budget process. Regularly evaluate the efficiency of the company’s business procedures according to the planned objectives and make appropriate improvements in deliverability. Provide leadership to department managers, and communicate team goals, set expectations and manage accountability. Identify and evaluate tool sets for internal processes and efficiencies. Manage procurement process and coordinate internal resource allocation. Establish and maintain quality controls across teams. Manage employee capacity across the delivery team and support hiring recommendations to meet capacity requirements. Share responsibility as a “Client-Care Officer” through direct contact with clients. Team Development/Leadership Promote a culture of high performance that emphasizes learning, team relationships and a commitment to quality. Plan, organize and lead teams for internal initiatives and ensure accountability. Be involved in the hiring and onboarding processes for new team members. Conduct quarterly and yearly reviews. Desired Skills:  We are looking for an experienced and results-driven Director of Operations who will execute our company’s strategy across multiple teams. This leader will incorporate the company’s business principles and culture throughout the organization and our customer base. The Director of Operations will have a proven track record of driving projects from inception to execution and be a natural problem-solver and big-picture thinker Benefits:  Thrive recognizes employees in many ways for their contributions and their commitment to the organization. At Thrive, we want to ensure all of our employees stay healthy, feel secure and maintain a strong work/life balance. Remote work Health and dental 90% paid by company Vision insurance LTD 100% paid by company 401k with up to 2% company match Company paid holidays Unlimited PTO Debt Free Grants Company funded Health Savings Account (HRA) Bonuses Charity Matching Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $80,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Flexible Schedule Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay Signing Bonus Experience: Operations Management: 10 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Company's website: https://thriveagency.com Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/thriveagency Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Yes

Text: Description  he QRC AISR Group currently has an opening for an Assistant Site Manager/King Air PIC supporting an OCONUS-based manned ISR program. Leidos is the Lead Systems Integrator for manned aircraft providing imagery and multi-source data for both real-time and post mission analysis. The Assistant Site Manager/King Air PIC is responsible for leading SOF ISR flight and ground operations OCONUS to maximize mission results, ensure safety of personnel and equipment, and maintain accountability to U.S. government personnel. The Assistant Site Manager/King Air PIC reports directly to the Program Manager, Site Lead and maintains direct liaison with Government, Military, and other Contractor representatives.  ***This position contingent upon contract award, expected in July 2020. This is a deployed management position and pay is commensurate. Flight hours are authorized to maintain credibility and expertise within the program. Hours may be increased or decreased as needed - while flying is NOT the primary duty, it is required. This position is ideal for a leader who desires extended time off (when not deployed) who is willing to deploy for up to 90 days.  Responsibilities: Specific responsibilities include but are not limited to: Managing all aspects of a deployed airborne surveillance operations site, including administration, aircraft maintenance/employment, logistics, personnel welfare, facilities, communications, operational systems and enforcing flight standards and regulatory compliance Ensuring safety of flight. Providing reports and updates to CONUS staff Maintaining operational oversight of staff and equipment Monitoring and tracking flight status Assessing risk and obtaining flight authorization Developing and editing procedures; auditing site for compliance with Government metrics And all other duties as required to ensure responsiveness of the program.  Basic Qualifications To be considered for this position candidates must have: Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline with a minimum of eight (8) years of relevant experience; additional experience may be considered in lieu of a degree. King Air BE300/350 type rating Experience as a rated military pilot (or contractor equivalent) with relevant flight operations experience within the last five years; Minimum of 1000 hours experience as PIC in any aircraft, of which 300 hours will be in a multi-engine turboprop aircraft (must possess Commercial or Air Transport Pilot Certificate). Possess an active DoD Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility and ability to maintain Experience leading deployed or OCONUS teams. Will require the ability to deploy for rotations of at least 90 days with 90 days off during non-rotation periods. Be willing to travel for long periods of time, work long hours and/or non-regular hours with minimal notice and flying the aircraft in Hardship and Hazardous locations. Be able to obtain a passport to travel internationally. Have or be able to obtain a FAA Class II medical certificate or military equivalent. Be able to successfully accomplish the CONUS Replacement Center course which requires a deployment physical, immunizations and training.  Preferred Qualifications: Former Military Instructor Pilot and/or Civilian Certified Flight Instructor (CFI). Special Operations Aviation experience Prior OCONUS rotation experience, particularly in CENTCOM or AFRICOM area of operations Proline 21 and UNS-1 experience. 1,500 hours of PIC time 300 hours in a KingAir 200/300 series aircraft. 200 hours of Instrument (actual) time 500 hours Turbine time – PC12 or Carvan for example Consideration will be given to returning seasoned military/contractor pilots to flight status who have not flown recently  AirborneISR         Leidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 33,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com. Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here. Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.
Title: Assistant Site Manager / King Air PIC

Text: Rich’s, also known as Rich Products Corporation, is a family-owned food company dedicated to inspiring possibilities. From cakes and icings to pizza, appetizers and specialty toppings, our products are used in homes, restaurants and bakeries around the world. Beyond great food, our customers also gain insights to help them stay competitive, no matter their size. Our portfolio includes creative solutions geared at helping food industry professionals compete in foodservice, retail, in-store bakery, deli, and prepared foods, among others. Working in 100 locations globally, with annual sales exceeding $3.8 billion, Rich’s is a global leader with a focus on everything that family makes possible. Rich’s®—Infinite Possibilities. One Family. Manages assigned key business categories to ensure that Rich’s requirements for delivery, quality, cost and safety are met and that Rich’s Values are maintained throughout the supply base Owns the relationship with assigned Global and /or Regional suppliers Drive suppliers to continuously improve the value they deliver to Rich Products Corporation. Assess, manage, mitigate and avoid risk throughout the supply chain for assigned categories. Strategic Sourcing & Savings Under the guidance and approval of direct manager, develop and maintain a long-term sourcing roadmap that identifies key sourcing opportunities. Execute sourcing events by developing and launching RFI/RFPs, developing a negotiation strategy, negotiating with potential suppliers and executing contracts. Optimize total cost of ownership by identifying cost savings and joint process improvements that help drive efficiencies throughout the entire supply chain. Support the identification and implementation of cost savings initiatives by working with internal business partners to understand the key business requirements, identifying capital requirements, developing business cases and being the Procurement lead for the implementation of the project. For larger sourcing initiatives, utilize the 7-step sourcing process to with the support of their direct manager or experience sourcing lead participate in a cross functional team to identify service and quality requirements, identify prospective vendors through the RFI process and develop business recommendations to optimize supply network and drive savings. Supplier Relationship Management Using inputs and coaching from direct manager or experienced sourcing lead, negotiates and maintains supplier agreements Employ key supplier metrics that help drive consistent service levels from suppliers as well as timely action plans to address and resolve supply issues. Provide daily management of suppliers including Supply Chain support for: forecasting, pricing, invoicing and inventory levels. Execute a strategy for assigned categories that aligns with short and long-term business goals and leverages Supplier Relationship Management best practices. Financial Risk Management Responsible for key financial analysis that supports the completion of critical reports including the monthly financial projection. Provide key inputs for market reports to key stakeholders including executive leaders, business leads and customers. Leverage financial risk management tools to execute a short and long-term risk management strategy for key commodities that drive category prices. Demonstrate a strong intellectual curiosity towards new financial risk management tools that provide predictable pricing and maintain strong correlations to underlying markets. Analyze complex financial problems to evaluate supplier proposals, present findings to manager to interpret market conditions and drive efficiency and productivity within the department. Provide key inputs and insight to assist manager to solve complex financial problem and utilize existing technology to develop a viable business solution. Business Support Support global partners by providing market insight for shared markets, leveraging global suppliers to drive efficiencies and innovation, and collaborating on best practices. Collaborate with and influence marketing and R&D to help drive innovation and commercialize new products Review and interpret key supplier metrics to assist Quality Team in maintaining consistent material quality from supplier in assigned category. Leverage supplier relationships to help address and resolve quality issues. Support and provide leadership for the resolution of quality, service and financial issues for assigned categories. Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or related field and minimum 1 year job related experience Experience with data modeling and complex data management PC skills (Excel, Word, database, statistical software) and the ability to create spreadsheets, computer analysis, report writing Travels regularly (up to 15% of time) Uses English as the business language within Rich’s  Rich Products Corporation, its subsidiaries and affiliates (“Rich’s”), are committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law. The information collected by this application is solely to determine suitability for employment, verify identity, and maintain employment statistics on applicants.  Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Rich’s. Please contact Rich’s Human Resources department at asc@rich.com if you need assistance completing this application or to otherwise participate in the application process.
Title: Associate Procurement Category Buyer

Text: The ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate a high energy level to tackle a large role, with a can-do attitude to pro-actively learn new skills. They will need to be able to handle many simultaneous projects with multiple customers that have active projects, a long list of new customer projects while at the same time leading various internal capital and process initiatives. Additional qualities of a perfect candidate is someone who can talk in some detail about chemistry,process design and metallurgy and when confronted with engineering issues can problem solve based on experience. Text: The Agent Services Coordinator must be able to handle a wide range of responsibilities. The right person for this position will be friendly and outgoing with a strong desire to help and serve others. The Agent Services Coordinator will assist the Managing Broker and Team Leader with agent intake, set-up, and exit processes and be seen as the go-to person for all the agents within the Market Center. This person should be a self-starter that is comfortable taking charge with little to no supervision. The Agent Services Coordinator must be able move with a sense of urgency to ensure they take care of their agent’s needs in a timely manner. What will you do? These are the standards a well-above-average performer will maintain or exceed: Love on our agents! Our agents are your #1 priority, both experienced and new. Handle the on-boarding process, hold weekly agent orientations, and schedule one-on-one appointments to engage and support our agents. Essential duties and responsibilities Organization. It is imperative to follow our system to stay ahead and on top of agent count and their personal information at all times. Learn and effectively communicate the tools, systems, and conversations of the Growth Initiative and Career Growth Initiative. This includes the Wall of Value and Training Tracker Work closely with Managing Broker on licensing. Send weekly email to staff and ALC announcing all new agents, including who hired them, their bio, and their contact info for team to reach out and welcome. Follow intake process and checklist for all incoming and exiting agents. Organize and publish social media posts related to new agents, announcements, training, etc. Create and run a Market Center orientation program for all new associates that join us. Own the Market Center training calendar. In charge of scheduling and coordinating all training, organizing instructors for each course, and communicating/promoting training on a daily basis. Act as a liaison for our agents regarding office matters, tech questions, and policies/procedures. Serve as a member of the Education Committee Assist with all Market Center training and events, including but not limited to RED Day, training events, food drives, BOLD coordination, weekly setup when in Market Center, and many other activities throughout the year. Communications/Interactions  Managing Broker – To be responsible for correct intake/exit paperwork for all associates, and daily activities of the Market Center Staff – Communicate agent updates and need-to-know information - daily Agents – Assist in connecting them to our resources. Provide value through engagement and training – daily CEO/Team Leader – Morning huddle and Agent Pipeline – daily Prospective Agents – Nurture relationships to help with the intake/ transition process, transferring license, etc. – weekly Knowledge/Skills  Extraordinary people skills Leadership, management, team-building skills Goal setting, planning, accountability skills Problem-solving skills Proactive, positive attitude Career development and training skills Knowledge and comfort with Social Media Knowledge of MS Word and Excel Willing and able to embrace new technology, master it, and teach it to others Computer and MLS experience Track record of success in past jobs/tasks Job Type: Full-time Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year Benefits: Health Insurance Referral Program Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay COVID-19 considerations:We are taking all appropriate covid 19 precautions to keep staff and associates safe Typical start time: 8AM Typical end time: 5PM Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100010122887362 Work Remotely: No

Text: About Us MBE CPAs is a Wisconsin-based tax, audit and business consulting firm working toward a common goal of creating a better life for our clients, colleagues and our community. We strive to foster a positive environment of opportunity, growth and personal enrichment. Our team is passionate about helping people succeed and we are determined to reach our goals and unlock the best versions of ourselves. We value creativity, we encourage individuality and we always support each other’s unique contributions and passions. We believe that a healthy business begins and ends with its employees. If you’re looking for a career that redefines the status quo and values your unique contributions, both inside and outside the office, then you’re in the right place. Position Overview Assist with client attest engagements, which include planning, executing, directing, and completing Financial Audits, Reviews, Full Disclosure Compilations, Agreed-Upon Procedures Engagements, Forecasts/Projections, and Internal Controls consulting. Research and analyze financial statement and audit related issues. Prepare report drafts and assist in issuance of the report. Proactively interact with client’s key management to gather information, resolve problems, and make recommendations for business and process improvements. Primary Duties and Responsibilities Maintain quality of work through self-review, prepare neat and organized workpapers. Maintains accountability for the assigned work and ensures assigned tasks and responsibilities are achieved including deadlines met. Advises, coaches, and supports team members including providing consistent recognition and encouragement to team members to increase retention and utilization. Leverage commercial and market knowledge to identify client needs/opportunities to sell additional value added services. Refers cross selling opportunities to appropriate team member. Develops and strengthens long-term relationships with client management and peer client levels. Supports partners in the implementation of practice objectives and budgets. Communicates progress of engagements with the Office Manager or Partner, including time estimates, scheduling considerations, etc. Communicates expectations and details about the engagement to clients; updates client on progress of the engagement including time estimates, scheduling considerations, findings, etc. Identifies potential accounting and auditing issues and performs research to present proposed solutions to the Office Manager or Partner. Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. Additional Duties and Responsibilities · Attend client meetings as requested. · Mentor staff. · Give back to the community. · Makes presentations, writes articles and represents the firm in assigned professional and civic functions. · Actively pursues self-development opportunities in line with company goals. · Responsible for meeting required continued professional education hours and improving technical skills. · Meet total budgeted hours and billable budgeted hours. Core Values · Client-Centric · Proactive · Accountability · Innovate · Educate · Trust · Challenge The Status Quo Performance Competencies · Integrity – Does not cut corners. Puts the interests of the business above self. Earns trust of employees and executives. · Team Building - Achieves cohesion and effective team spirit with subordinates. Sustains an environment characterized by open, honest working relations where differences are constructively addressed rather than ignored, suppressed, or denied. Can delegate and empower those that show the ability to take on more responsibility. · Adaptability – Adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and can deal with frequent changes, delays or unexpected events. · Dependability – Consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance. · Safety and Security –Observes safety and instills a safety culture in their area of responsibility. Follows security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly. · Work Ethic – Encourages and displays a good work ethic and positive attitude among team members. · Independence – Able to work effectively with minimal ongoing management and direction. Asks questions when necessary to maintain effectiveness. Qualifications - Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Education and Experience – Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance or business administration or equivalent business experience. Certificates, Licenses and Registrations – CPA or working towards designation · Team player – Able to work well as a member of a team or group. Willing to participate in team projects. · Communication – Has strong interpersonal skills and is skilled in communicating complex technical information so that it is understood by clients · Industry Knowledge – General knowledge of market trends including opportunities and local business initiatives · Relationship Development – Able to establish and maintain strong working relationships with clients and staff · Planning & Organizing – Able to assist in monitoring ongoing company operations and anticipating concerns. Can create contingency plans to ensure ongoing company success. · Financial Reporting and Documentation – Understands content of financial reports: Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flows. Able to interpret results and translate into focused actions and performance tracking through Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) in appropriate areas. · Mathematical – Has the ability to compute rates, ratios, and percentages and to interpret financial reports. Can analyze performance against business plans and industry benchmarks. · Technology – Proficient in the use of computers and computer software. · Delegation – Understands the value of his/her time and acknowledges the importance of being able to assign lower priority tasks to others. Training · GAAP, GAAS, and YB · MBE Products and Services. Development Opportunities TBD Job Type: Full-time Pay: $0.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental Insurance Health Insurance Paid Time Off Schedule: Monday to Friday
Title: Staff Accountant - Assurance Services

Text: Opportunity for an innovative and experienced Change Management Lead Technologist to join an IT Operations Project for a federal government system. The candidate will lead and provide expertise for a large enterprise Infrastructure environment.  Roles and Responsibilities  Provide and support to change management activities including the process for System Change Requests (submitting, approving, developing, testing and migrating to production). Facilitation of CM Change Control Boards, including developing agendas, and following up on action items and coordinating testing and implementation of system changes. Hands on experience and knowledge of working with AWS and other cloud environments along deploying solutions supporting the enterprise focusing on datacenter operations is key.  Required Education, Experience, and Skills Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, related field or the equivalent and 10 years related experience or a MS and 8 years of experience or the equivalent  4 years’ team lead or equivalent experience in IT Configuration Management, metrics and reporting, ITSM process management, or other relevant experience required Experience maintaining baseline and Change Management Database (CMDB) using platforms such as ServiceNow or Remedy required Experience on maintaining the baseline for efforts using Agile and DevOps methodologies Experience maintaining the baseline for cloud-based systems preferred Amazon Web Services (AWS) Certifications preferred Advanced experience using change management database (CMDB) to onboard new hardware/software technologies accurately and confirm that items are correctly documented 5+ years of IT requirements managements, change management, change management or Systems Engineering experience Mid-level experience in change and change management principles Working knowledge of Jenkins, change management database (CMDB), code packaging, Jira, Salesforce, ELK, Git Hub, AWS and basic Unix commands  Desired Education, Experience, and Skills US Citizen with DHS Public Trust suitability clearance/EOD Experience with any DHS agencies or entities Experience using ServiceNow, Agile Life Cycle Management tools knowledge and experience Experience with DevSecOps  #GDITpriority GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.
Title: Change Management Lead

Text: Windows Systems Admin Location: Sterling, VA or Memphis, TN Clearance: Public Trust Windows Systems Administrator to work with a small team responsible for building, deploying and supporting a large big data environment that will enable operations for a large enterprise environment. Evaluates products and upgrades for appropriateness. Executes tasks defined in the project plans & schedules using best practices in secure networking models and standards Assist in the discovery process by capturing legacy requirements that must be transitioned to the new environments. Develop and implements functionality based on provided guidance and requirements for on-premise and public cloud services. Collect and provide data/metrics that support any required SLA, MOU and MOAs Assesses the alignment of network engineering design principles/trends with desired mission strategies and objectives, concept of operations, business processes, and technology standards. Coordinates with change management in collaboration with organizational governance Serves as network administrator and manages all network services with commitment to implementing best practices in security, optimization, quality assurance cloud architecture, design, engineering, testing and implementation Monitors and manages network operations and infrastructure services according to requirements specified in agreements with customer and stakeholders Desired Skills Five (5) years or more years supporting IT/Network experience Experience working with virtualize platforms and networks a plus Windows 10 administration skills Windows Server Versions 2008, 2012 & 2016 (Standard & Datacenter) experience Microsoft Hyper-V Virtualization Experience Windows Active Directory and Group Policy and enterprise management experience Experience using distributed file systems Qualifications  Standard O&M practices supporting Layer 2 and 3 switches Citrix experience is a plus Microsoft Hyper-V Virtualization Experience - design, implement, and manage networks Experience generating metric reports in support of outages and usage Demonstrated networking skills with various operating systems Ability to work flexible hours and be on-call Ability to do limited travel Education: A degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or Mathematics preferred Ability to obtain a public trust ABBTECH is an EOE/Minorities/Women/Disabled Individuals/Veterans Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $0.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Hyper-V Virtualization: 5 years (Required) Windows Server Versions 2008, 2012 & 2016: 5 years (Required) Citrix experience: 5 years (Required) IT/Network experience: 5 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work Location: One location Work Remotely: No

Text: The Law Firm of Ayo and Iken is looking for a higher-end family law attorney and we fully expect to pay for that increased experience. We are taking applications for both New Port Richey, Florida, and other office locations in Florida, including Orlando, and Fort Lauderdale. We are looking for a "winner" We are looking for someone that wants to join a team of winners You must be excellent at taking in new cases You must be capable of generating significant billing Guaranteed base in the range of $60K to $90K - depending on knowledge and experience. Incentives (paid monthly) can range up to an additional $100K per year or more for highly motivated team members. You must have sufficient current experience to take family law cases to trial. We expect to pay a significant guaranteed minimum salary along with generous incentives. This would be an ideal position for the attorney that is thinking of discontinuing their solo practice. Benefits: Very liberal vacation policy, 401K with generous employer matching (after 6 months), subsidized health insurance (after 60 days). Flexible time off. Other varied benefits. Ayo and Iken is a large, progressive family law firm that has experienced great success in the rapidly changing, hyper-competitive market. The ideal candidate will be experienced, likes to be their own person, but also enjoys being part of a large, experienced team. We have an excellent staff You will have top-notch, experienced paralegal support We have a dedicated intake, collections, and accounting team Our technology is leading edge and top-notch Our marketing is powerful and creates lucrative opportunities You must be money-oriented and are looking for a firm where you can realize your potential. We need someone who wants to work hard, earn a significant income, and participate in building the finest family law team in Florida. Our firm offers in-depth backing that only established players can offer. You will enjoy the support and camaraderie of a team with in-depth knowledge of family law. You must be excellent at meeting and retaining clients. This requires the ability to instill trust in potential clients and the ability to request substantial retainers. Finally, you must have the ability to back up your assertions to potential clients. This requires confidence in your ability to practice family law, and the skills to take cases to trial when necessary. We will not consider a training situation. Please do not apply if the above details do not describe you. You must have a complete set of skills in family law litigation to be considered for this position. Additional practice area experience is desirable but not required. We are especially interested in diversity and would like to hear from all attorneys with varied cultural backgrounds, including LGBT. A diverse firm is not only a healthy organization but has appeal to clients from varying situations. Send your resume and statement of interest to Howard Iken, Esq. through the provided link. All inquiries will be kept strictly confidential. Your application, name, and any submitted info will be kept secure by a firm partner and not shared with staff or current attorneys. We take significant precautions to protect potential applicants. All discussions will be conducted in a strictly confidential manner. Do not send your email or resume through our general website form. Doing so will distribute your information to a large number of Ayo and Iken team members and we will immediately consider you disqualified for the position. You can also view our firm at http://www.myfloridalaw.com Requirements Current member of The Florida Bar. A significant number of years primarily practicing family law for a private firm. Experience in Florida procedure. A track record of conducting family law trials. No material Bar discipline on record. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Health Insurance Paid Time Off Schedule: Monday to Friday Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay Experience: Family Law Litigation: 3 years (Preferred) License: Member Florida Bar (Preferred) Work Location: One location Company's website: www.myfloridalaw.com Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: No
Title: Family Law Attorney - Experienced - Ayo & Iken - Tampa Bay Area

Text: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience in project and process management. Ability to work non-standard work hours as needed. Preferred qualifications: Experience in content policy, anti-abuse or customer support operations. Experience reviewing content and/or answering user questions. Ability to build relationships with cross-functional partners across geographies. Ability to work through ambiguity and thrive in a rapidly changing environment. Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to use data to drive strategy and business action. Excellent communication skills and business judgment. Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. As a Policy Escalation Specialist, you'll ensure that we deliver performance goals for necessary escalations. You will manage the response to these escalations globally, and use a variety of tools, communications, and facilitation methods to ensure that issues are triaged and the right stakeholders are involved in resolution. You will also help test new processes, systems and infrastructure to manage escalations, while also contributing input into where we put our efforts next. In addition, you will dig into the data around incidents and search for trends, impact, and possible improvements. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Manage policy escalations from start to finish, driving consensus across all stakeholders. Evaluate cross-product escalations to determine severity, risk, and required action. Analyze, identify, prioritize, and deliver operational improvement opportunities. Identify, articulate, and quantify impact of required tools changes to deliver on these opportunities. Develop analyses and implementations of preventative solutions, including working with Engineering on tools. Review controversial and offensive video content in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines.
Title: Policy Escalation Specialist, YouTube Trust and Safety

Text: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience in policy interpretation, anti-abuse operations, reviewing content and/or answering user questions, and working with vendors. Preferred qualifications: Strong analytical skills with solid knowledge of SQL and ability to understand detection and tooling systems. Solid program management expertise and organizational skills. Strong written and spoken skills to drive consensus across stakeholders, record decisions, and share outcomes. Strong technical and analytical skills to frame solutions using data Ability to write after-incident docs to improve existing process or create new processes Ability to handle multiple incidents simultaneously, keep stakeholders informed, while driving towards resolution. Fast-paced, dynamic, and proactive, YouTube’s Trust & Safety team is dedicated to making YouTube a safe place for users, viewers, and content creators around the world to belong, create, and express themselves. Whether understanding and solving their online content concerns, navigating within global legal frameworks, or writing and enforcing worldwide policy, the Trust & Safety team is on the frontlines of enhancing the YouTube experience, building internet safety, and protecting free speech in our ever-evolving digital world. As the Escalation Program Manager for Scaled Abuse and Analytics on YouTube's Trust and Safety team, you will be responsible for improving policies and processes across the Scaled Abuse organization. You'll be involved in escalation management and will work closely with senior stakeholders across the business to ensure alignment in applying policy principles and addressing brand risk. You will be required to work cross-functionally across Policy Development, Policy Verticals,, Product, and Operations to operationalize, enforce, and communicate policies that keep users safe and minimize brand risk to the platform. The role requires thinking through the unique challenges of a broad array of policy areas while developing workflows that are consistent and resilient. This role could review graphic, controversial, and sometimes offensive video content in line with YouTube’s Community Guidelines. The role will also require on-call weekend work. At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together. Exercise strategic judgment in developing operational excellence, business judgment handling escalations, and exceptional communication with senior leadership. Serve as Incident Response Manager for escalations, managing escalations from intake to execution. Partner with the Trust and Safety Rapid Response team to scale YouTube Partner Program Sensitive policies globally. Engage with Scaled Abuse and Analytics teams and cross-functional stakeholders and drive large-scale strategic and tactical initiatives. Be a subject matter expert on Scaled Abuse and YouTube Partner Program policies, manage related escalations, and drive policy and process improvements across a number of areas.
Title: Escalations Program Manager, YouTube Trust and Safety

Text: Become a product expert and develop a deep understanding of how pieces of our software are connected. Execute test plans for every release cycle and for particular features. Manage the ecosystem of tests while identifying upstream and downstream dependencies within our platform. Master our internal tools and third party tools that are necessary for our testing and tracking of issues. Feel like part of the team! Our onboarding process will integrate you into the company with informative sessions on our policies, processes, and team structure and goals. Learn, grow, and contribute right away. We trust that you’ll bring experience and knowledge that will uplift the team, but we don’t expect you to know everything on Day 1. You’ll have time to develop your product knowledge and get up to speed on all aspects of Everlaw. Collaborate closely with the Product and Engineering teams to guide the definition, planning, and execution of testing for their features. Drive process improvement and scaling by designing and implementing additions to our overall test suite. Communicate quantitative and qualitative findings from test results to our team. Further push our team into automation of our test suite. You are an effective communicator both written and verbal. You have proficiency and experience in analyzing data. You are a natural problem solver. You have an exceptional attention to detail. You are authorized to work in the United States; please note that at this time, Everlaw is not sponsoring visas for any positions. You are comfortable using Google Applications, such as GMail, Google Calendar and Google Docs. You have experience in software development testing. Competitive salary Substantial equity 401k with company matching Health, dental, and vision insurance Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care expenses Fully paid pregnancy and bonding leaves for new parents (including adoptive and foster) Seventeen paid vacation days plus ten bankable federal holidays Annual allocation for Learning & Development opportunities and applicable professional membership dues Company-sponsored life and disability insurance Work in Downtown Oakland, just steps from the BART line and dozens of restaurants Select your preference of hardware (Mac or PC) and customize your desk setup Bond over team lunches and out-of-the-box events “Ranked #1 on G2 for Ediscovery Software and Momentum” and proud contributor of free ediscovery resources to benefit the greater good through “Everlaw for Good”  #LI-RV1
Title: QA Analyst

Text: Requisition ID # 54842  Job Category : Information Technology Job Level : Individual Contributor Business Unit: Gas Operations Job Location : Walnut Creek Department Overview Gas Operations is focused on ensuring the safe, reliable and affordable flow of natural gas to our customers. Gas Operations is responsible for all aspects of PG&E's gas distribution and transmission operations including planning, engineering, maintenance and construction, restoration, maintenance, and emergency response.  Position Summary The Senior Business System Specialist of Work Management Solutions works within the Resource Management and Technology organization in Gas Operations. The incumbent works with a cross functional group of stakeholders within Gas Operations and IT to deploy improvements to the technology in use by the Gas Operations team. The incumbent will report directly to the Manager of the Work Management Solutions team. Each team member ensures that systems, especially SAP continue to be in alignment with existing business processes by working closely with the Information Technology Department and the enterprise. The team provides responsive service to Gas Operations by ensuring that the technology in use supports effective and efficient processes for the field employees and business users across Gas Ops. The incumbent will have a solid understanding of Gas Operations core work processes and needs to have extensive SAP Work Management experience. Provides business and system-wide expertise on SAP processes for PG&E's gas transmission and distribution system.  Job Responsibilities Handle moderate to complex user issues that arise with supported systems and tools, escalating the more complex problems to Team Leads Analyze and document low complexity business processes and information needs. Discuss requirements and deliverables with Manager and peer team members. Provide timely and professional responses to IT or user inquiries. Escalate as appropriate. Lead and engage teams that develop requirements for business needs solutions. Lead and participate in User Acceptance Tests (UAT) perform quality reviews of test results May perform various additional activities, such as supporting project team in, scope presentations, business requirements change requests sessions, etc. Mentored and guided by more experienced Business System Specialists, Analysts and/or Manager Mentors junior business system specialists Provide consulting in business and user needs on SAP Work Management processes and supported applications Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team Provide timely and professional communications Lead and engage in discussions using a collaborative, focused approach that builds trust and consensus across the team Support leadership and team to be successful with technology implementation of enhancements or resolutions to Gas Operations Sustain and maintain existing work management systems and supported applications Bestow a genuine interest in teamwork and growth Take initiative to collaborate with user groups in Gas Operations with technology adoption and continuous improvement of SAP Work Management processes and supported applications Provide analytical and data request support as needed Support and analyze end-to-end, moderate to high complexity business processes in one or more business functional area in Gas Operations Identify, propose and influence solutions to moderate-to-complex business problems Actively contribute to teams that define, review and approve requirements for the business needs solution Contribute to overall Gas Operations performance by driving efficiencies through technology and any supported applications Travel required 10-20% of the time, to Gas Operations Walnut Creek Headquarters, Bishop Ranch, Rocklin, and other offices throughout the PG&E territory  Qualifications Minimum: BA/BS in Business, Engineering, Computer Science/Information Systems, etc. or equivalent work experience. 4 years of job-related experience in Business, IT or Engineering fields. Participation in projects of medium to high complexity. Continuous education in IT and business specific areas. Travel Availability  Desired: SAP Work Management system and/or Mobile applications experience (i.e. SAP ECC, Ventyx/FAS, Digital Catalyst mobile applications, Pronto Forms mobile application) Knowledge of business processes within Gas Operations organizations (i.e. Maintenance & Construction, Corrosion, Leak Survey/Repair) Experience in change management project management and process analysis Experience in data analysis including identifying and tracking metrics for leadership Experience in technology or system deployments for utility operations Proficient PC skills including a proficiency in various software (i.e. SAP, Click Schedule, BI Tools – AO, BOBJ, BW) 2+ years related business experience including at least 1 years of utility/pipeline experience Detail oriented, analytical, good oral and written communication skills Ability to work with different teams across disciplines and levels Understands general business processes of department(s) supported
Title: Business System Specialist, Senior

Text: FLVS is more than just a school. We are a diverse team comprised of thousands of individuals, all working together toward a common goal, and as a team, we value the talents and contributions that each member has to offer. With this mindset always at the forefront, we keep the student at the center of every decision we make and continue to lead the online teaching revolution every day.  At FLVS, we do more than just talk about our values; we proudly live them and rely on them to be the foundation of everything we do: Put people first, Take the lead, Blaze the trail, Love what you do. We put these Core Values into action every day in order to deliver a high quality, technology-based education that provides the skills and knowledge Kindergarten-12 students need for success.  With competitive compensation and benefits packages, a superb work-life balance for all employees, countless professional development opportunities, a supportive management team, a collaborative work environment, and a “people first” culture, the FLVS team is transforming education worldwide and changing lives – one student at a time. Encourages collaboration; Is candid with peers  CREATIVITY Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; Easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; Tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming sessions; Takes calculated risks; Is not afraid to try new things and potentially “fail fast”  SELF KNOWLEDGE Seeks feedback; Gains insight from mistakes; Is open to constructive criticism; isn’t defensive; Proactively seeks to understand his/her strengths and areas for growth; applies information to best serve organization; Recognizes how his/her behavior impacts others and incorporates insight into future interactions  PLANNING Accurately scopes out length and difficulty of tasks and projects; Sets objectives and goals; Breaks down work into the process steps; Develops schedules and task/people assignments; Anticipates and adjusts for problems and roadblocks; Measures performance against goals; Evaluates results  ORGANIZING Uses his/her time effectively and efficiently; Concentrates his/her efforts on the more important priorities; Can attend to a broader range of activities as a result of organizing time efficiently; Can marshal resources (people, funding, material, support) to get things done; Can orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish a goal; Arranges information and files in a useful manner  PROBLEM SOLVING Uses rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions; Probes all fruitful sources for answers; Can see hidden problems; Is excellent at honest analysis; Looks beyond the obvious and doesn’t stop at the first answers  DRIVE FOR RESULTS Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; Very bottom- line oriented; Steadfastly pushes self and others for results; Is full of energy for the things he/she sees as challenging; Not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning; Consistently seizes opportunities; Consistently exceeds goals  P HYSICAL R EQUIREMENTS AND E NVIRONMENTAL C ONDITIONS: Frequency of travel: Occasional travel is required for meetings, trainings and conferences; location may vary and may require overnight stays Efforts required working in an office environment, able to lift boxes from floor level to carts on occasion weighting up to 25 lbs.  (Reasonable accommodations will be made in accordance with existing ADA requirements for otherwise qualified individuals with a disability.)
