Text: Compensation Manager, Emerging Technology and Incentive Programs Lead Deloitte is aggressively acquiring, developing and scaling alternative business models such as Intellectual Property-based (“IP-Based") businesses to complement the traditional services offerings across the core functions of consulting, advisory, tax and audit. IP-based businesses offer client’s technology, content, data or analytic solutions with recurring subscription revenue business models. The combination of IP-based businesses with Deloitte’s traditional service offerings are referred to as “Hybrids”. The Hybrid Talent Team is a relatively new team with a primary focus to support Hybrid Businesses in implementing priority talent solutions, promote cross-business collaboration, and meet the differentiated talent needs of the Hybrid Businesses. The Emerging Technology and Incentive Programs Lead is responsible for working with Hybrid Talent Business Advisors and Hybrid Business Leaders and in coordination with the overall business on compensation consultation, design, implementation, and administration across Deloitte’s Hybrid portfolio. The Emerging Technology and Incentive Programs Lead will actively look for ways to address the unique needs of each Hybrid business, making recommendations, interpreting policies and procedures, assessing market competitiveness and developing, socializing and implementing strategic, competitive solutions. They will play a critical firmwide role and serve as subject matter expert for incentive compensation programs including those for sales and relationship professionals and executives and will need to be closely connected to the Compensation Managers for the respective businesses as well as with the Total Rewards – Compensation Leader, to whom the position will report. They will also lead projects in areas such as job assessment and benchmarking, salary range development and other forms of compensation/incentive program design and take on other projects as needed by the Hybrid Business, Hybrid Talent Team and Total Rewards. Work you’ll do Partner with the Total Rewards – Compensation team members to develop Hybrid-based solutions that reflect their compensation strategy and business objectives Design, develop, test, socialize and implement incentive and other variable pay programs aligned to the competitive market, and assist in the development of performance-based KPIs that link to incentive programs Lead job benchmarking, compensation survey assessment and analysis, and competitive market intelligence and drive insights to help inform strategic positioning of Hybrid compensation in the market Partner with Hybrid Talent and Hybrid Business Leaders to support the development and management of overall annual compensation budgets as well as specific allocations working closely with Hybrid Team Talent and Business Leaders and Total Rewards. to facilitate the annual compensation process Develop and facilitate compensation communication and education for the Business Leaders and professionals in conjunction with their overall Business and in cooperation with Total Rewards – Analyze and report outcomes, comparisons to market trends, and future recommendations both formally and informally to Hybrid Talent and Hybrid Business Leaders Qualifications 8-10 years of broad-based compensation, administration and design experience with 5+ years of managerial experience Experience in a technology business required; start-up and global compensation experience highly desirable Experience leading the design, development and implementation of variable compensation plans and developing KPIs is required, sales incentive program experience highly desirable Ability to build and maintain strong client relationships Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects Experience working in a dynamic, rapidly evolving and matrixed organization with matrixed reporting relationships Self-confident, self-motivated and highly organized with a strong sense of personal accountability Strong communication and presentation skills, including excellent written and verbal capabilities. Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze, synthesize and draw conclusions from data is key Bachelor’s Degree required; advanced business degree preferred Expert level Microsoft Excel skills required, experience using SAP HRIS, ADP Compensation Planning Tool and Comp Analyst highly desirable How you’ll grow At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.  Benefits At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits. Learn more about what working at Deloitte can mean for you.  Deloitte’s culture Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives. Learn more about Life at Deloitte.  Corporate citizenship Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. We believe that business has the power to inspire and transform. We focus on education, giving, skill-based volunteerism, and leadership to help drive positive social impact in our communities. Learn more about Deloitte’s impact on the world.  Recruiter tips We want job seekers exploring opportunities at Deloitte to feel prepared and confident. To help you with your interview, we suggest that you do your research: know some background about the organization and the business area you’re applying to. Check out recruiting tips from Deloitte professionals.
Title: Compensation Manager, Emerging Technology and Incentive Programs Lead

Text: Job Description: Constellation West is currently seeking a Junior IT Specialist for the following: The Junior IT Specialist is a mid-level position that provides functional and IT analysis, design, development, integration, documentation, and implementation assistance on problems which require a thorough knowledge of the related technical subject matter for effective system deployment. Participates in all phases of systems development. Applies principals and methods of the functional area to difficult problems in technical areas to arrive at automated solutions. Designs and prepares technical reports and related documentation, and makes charts and graphs to record results.  Prepares and delivers presentations and briefings as required by the task order. Performs as a member of a team or as a Team Lead as required. Demonstrates good oral and written communication skills.  Essential Business Experience and Technical Skills: Understanding of IT business and systems supporting U.S. Treasury systems.  Duties to include but not limited to the following Support the IRS in maintaining existing solutions, designing and tailoring new and existing Archer components/solutions, supporting and standing up Archer instances, cleaning data and loading it into Archer and preparing documentation to support all efforts of Archer. The IRS currently maintains and operates one Information Technology Security Compliance Monitoring (IT SCM) Archer instance. This new work will utilize the existing solutions and data available and expand the IRS capabilities to meet other key requirements. One effort is to be able to monitor FISMA reportable systems with the intent to link system data to Plan of Action and Milestone (POAM) data to Risk Based Decisions to enhance the Cybersecurity Dashboard. Another effort is to transition some existing Archer solutions to SPLUNK for data dashboarding. expand existing services and support other IRS requirements and dashboard integration and workflow needs. In addition, the contractor should support any Archer upgrades, and perform the installation and integration work corresponding with continuous monitoring, reporting and mitigation efforts as implemented by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) Continuous Diagnostics and Monitoring (CDM) effort mentioned above. CDM complements the overall IRS security tool strategy, and provides continuous monitoring, diagnosis, and mitigation capabilities designed to strengthen the security posture of the federal government networks and systems. A view of the IRS assets from the perspective of the tools needs to be depicted via Archer for CDM. Job Requirements: Functional Responsibilities  Support data architecture, data management and risk dashboard; Operations & Maintenance support of the ARCHER infrastructure and related work; Testing & integration support for future CDM requirements and related work; provide Technical subject matter expertise as needed to support the IRS mission and related work in regard to emerging dash-boarding technology.  Required Skills: 3 years’ IT systems services experience  Desired Skills: Current or previous experience at IRS providing high level and functional IT analysis, design, development, integration, documentation, and implementation assistance to Government, stakeholders, and integrated process team.
Title: Junior Information Technology Specialist

Text: Manages and maintains the technical operations of clinical skills labs, simulation facilities, and classrooms, providing systems administration and maintenance of IT infrastructure (hardware, software, networks) and systems supporting instructional technologies. Coordinates with college’s IT staff, vendors, and lab managers/coordinators to troubleshoot and resolve problems with network connectivity and systems supporting simulation operations, A/V systems, video-conferencing, database systems, and other specialized components. Ensures that patient simulators and instructional media equipment such as video cameras, multimedia computer systems, and A/V recording/distribution systems used in clinical skills and simulation labs are maintained and fully operational. Works collaboratively with the Manager, Simulation Education to integrate simulation technology into clinical teaching scenarios and to adapt emerging technologies to classrooms and clinical skills labs to meet the educational needs of students. Communicates and interfaces with vendors and equipment manufacturers to coordinate technical support, maintenance, warranty issues, and service contracts. Operate and maintain simulation equipment, task trainers, computerized simulators, and virtual reality procedural trainers with the ability to follow scenarios, and make appropriate adjustments to technology systems. Makes recommendations for the purchase of equipment, supplies, and materials required for simulation-based sessions. Create troubleshooting documents, simulator checklists, and preventative maintenance plans for simulation equipment. Set up and operate equipment/AV system in rooms including equipment, supplies, etc. for simulation activities. Supports learners to maintain a safe learning environment. Performs other duties as assigned.  Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline. Three years of work experience as an IT professional in learning based healthcare technology, OR desktop and network support in a multi-operating systems environment. Demonstrated knowledge of IT infrastructure supporting simulation equipment and software, and digital media hardware and software. Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of simulation technologies, including related computer hardware, software, audio and video recording systems. Demonstrated customer support skills and professionalism. Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office. Excellent verbal and interpersonal communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including in relation to equipment failures. Ability to teach technical processes to non-technical staff.Ability to work effectively within a culturally diverse environment.
Title: Simulation Technology Specialist - Part Time

Text: Regional Information Technology Director A-Gas is the global expert in the supply and full life-cycle management of specialty chemicals and gases, providing refrigerants, blowing agents, fire protection agents, and carbon credit offsets to our customers around the world. With industry-leading recovery, reclamation, and gas processing technologies, A-Gas continues to lead the industry in developing cutting-edge solutions designed to protect the environment. Job Purpose The Regional IT Director reports to the President of the Americas region, and the Corporate Chief Technology Officer (located in the UK), and is responsible for the leadership and overall operational, strategic and technical direction of the Business Systems function in the Americas region. This role is accountable for digital and technological change within the region to enable the build and contribution of the company-wide digital strategy delivery, as well as to ensure the consistent delivery and update of technical portfolio roadmaps aligned to the core organizational goals, priorities and direction. Key Responsibilities: Provide day-to-day administrative direction and oversight of key technology/information systems and general support activities to meet the IT needs across all sites in the region. Leads a team of remote software developers and manage the outsource IT business partner. Work strategically at a leadership level within the defined business areas to promote digital engagement to ensure that the business areas technology and digital needs are both realized, futureproofed, and linked in with the overarching Company Digital Strategy. Communicate strategy at both technical and non-technical audiences. Accountable for stimulating, surfacing, and shaping demand for capabilities and assets, in addition to ensuring that the potential business value from those capabilities and assets are captured, optimized, and recognized by means of analysis, prioritization and proactive demand triage management across all new services or modifications to existing service features or volumes within their territory. Accountable for incident management, escalation and reporting arising from cyber-attacks and vulnerabilities, technical failures, and data breaches. Create new and improved and potentially disruptive approaches to performing business activities in order to create business opportunities; deliver new or improved products/services, or improve supply chains. Defines requirements standards and quality targets for digital platforms and products in agreement with key stakeholders. Organizes scoping and business priority setting for tactical and strategic business changes involving key stakeholders within the Business Systems function, Region, and Group. Develops and communicates the business case for funding the digital change and confirms continuing business viability and value add of the change at regular intervals. Negotiates at senior level on technical and business issues. Influences the development and enhancement of services, products, and systems, and oversees the management and planning of business opportunities. Leads the continuous evaluation of the user experience of products and services and ensure that improvements are addressed in the future product and roadmap design. Executes and manages the implementation of IT and Digital organization-wide projects, processes and procedures, tools and techniques for the identification, assessment, and management of risk inherent in the operation of business processes and of potential risks arising from planned change. Researches suppliers and markets and maintains a broad understanding of the sector and wider IT and digital developments. Leads on the business case for alternative sourcing models, and on policy and procedures covering the selection of suppliers, tendering, and procurement. Identifies new and emerging hardware and software technologies and products, assesses their relevance and potential value to the organization, contributes to briefings and education of staff and management. Analyzes, Technology and Digital related business processes; identifies alternative solutions, assesses feasibility, and recommends new approaches, typically seeking to exploit technology components. Develops, Technology and Digital enterprise-wide architecture and processes that ensure that the strategic application of change is embedded in the management of the organization, ensuring the buy-in of all stakeholders Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required: Bachelor's Degree required, Master's Degree Preferred. Equivalent industry experience may be considered in lieu of degree. Proven Leader and ability to manage a virtual team Project Management training PRINCE2 / PMP / Agile practitioner Strategic planner business & technical Technical and business product roadmaps development Demonstrable competence in a product-based environment Fostering strategic relations both internal and external Management of multi-phase implementations, e.g. either systems projects or international development projects or business development or business transformation projects Analysis of qualitative and quantitative data Extensive IT skills with advanced level experience of using project applications Track record of inspirational, motivation leadership to maximize individual and team performance Extensive IT skills with advanced level experience of using project applications Track record of inspirational, motivation leadership to maximize individual and team performance Day to day management of staff and supervision of workstreams Ability to identify, manage and deliver against stakeholder requirements Demonstrable skill in communication at all levels Highly organized Works well under pressure Willingness to take direction Report writing and presentation skills Operate with a high degree of discretion and observe confidentiality A flexible approach to work and location including the ability to travel both within the territory and internationally as required. Travel 25% to 30% of the time may be required.  Preferred Qualifications Six Sigma green belt qualification Lean processing qualification ITIL practitioner Digital technology knowledge and its use to benefit business users Digital strategy development Digital transformation leadership International experience Product owner experience
Title: Regional Information Technology Director

Text: This position is part of the Defense Security Cooperation Agency. DSCA's mission is to advance U.S. national security and foreign policy interests by building the capacity of foreign security forces to respond to shared challenges. DSCA leads the broader U.S. security cooperation enterprise in its efforts to train, educate, advise, and equip foreign partners. DSCA administers security cooperation programs that support U.S. policy interests and objectives. This position is being filled using Direct Hire Authority for cyber positions(Cyber code: 511).As a Information Technology Specialist (INFOSEC) at the GS-2210-14 some of your typical work assignments may include: Accomplish difficult and complex projects and/or individual problems. Provides technical advice, guidance, and assistance to key stakeholders both internal and external to the agency, and military departments on matters pertaining to computer and network security. Develop methods to monitor and measure risk, compliance and assurance efforts. Perform validation steps, comparing actual results with expected results and identify impact and risk. Participate in intra/inter-agency working groups and other federal policy making forums. Identify the protection needs for the information system(s) and network(s) and document appropriately. Performs studies of complex problems or researches technical issues. Performs analysis of retrieved data, and the preparation of detailed reports of INFOSEC security incidents. Provides technical assistance in the assessment of INFOSEC incidents and key vulnerabilities affecting the agency.  Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position. No 14 Job family (Series)2210 Information Technology ManagementSimilar jobsComputer Security Specialists Specialists, Computer Security RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentMust be a U.S. Citizen Occasional Travel Work Schedule: Full-time Males born after 12-31-59 must be registered for Selective Service Suitable for Federal employment, determined by a background investigation May be required to successfully complete a probationary period Overtime: Occasionally Tour of Duty: Flexible Recruitment Incentives: May be Authorized Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA): Exempt Financial Disclosure: Not Required Telework Eligibility: This position is telework eligible Plans, develops, and coordinates agency-level cybersecurity operations and strategies; security access management, cloud computing security architecture, continuous monitoring, incident response, incident reporting, coordinates system consolidation, security virtualization, security situational awareness, vulnerability management, enterprise security risk management, and other emerging innovative security technologies. Develops, coordinates, and implements cybersecurity operational tactics, techniques, procedures, and tools across the enterprise architecture. Reviews proposed new systems, networks, and software designs considering the vulnerabilities and threats to assess security risks. Resolves integration issues related to the implementation of new systems within the existing and new infrastructures. Develops innovative approaches to monitor the threats and vulnerabilities and assess the risk posture. Attention to Detail - Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail. Customer Service - Works with clients and customers (that is, any individuals who use or receive the services or products that your work unit produces, including the general public, individuals who work in the agency, other agencies, or organizations outside the Government) to assess their needs, provide information or assistance, resolve their problems, or satisfy their expectations; knows about available products and services; is committed to providing quality products and services. Oral Communication - Expresses information (for example, ideas or facts) to individuals or groups effectively, taking into account the audience and nature of the information (for example, technical, sensitive, controversial); makes clear and convincing oral presentations; listens to others, attends to nonverbal cues, and responds appropriately. Problem Solving - Identifies problems; determines accuracy and relevance of information; uses sound judgment to generate and evaluate alternatives, and to make recommendations. Substitution of education may not be used in lieu of specialized experience for this grade level. Interagency Career Transition Assistance Programs: This program applies to employees who have been involuntarily separated from a Federal service position within the competitive service or Federal service employees whose positions have been deemed surplus or no longer needed. To receive selection priority for this position, you must: 1) meet ICTAP eligibility criteria; 2) be rated well-qualified for the position; Well qualified is defined as possessing the type and quality of experience that exceeds the positions minimum qualifications. and 3) submit the appropriate documentation to support your ICTAP eligibility. For more information:https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/ You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above. REVIEW OF APPLICATION DOCUMENTS (FOR ALL APPLICANTS):To determine if you meet the qualifications, requirements and quality of experience required for this position, we review your resume, supporting documents and responses to the questionnaire. The score you receive is a measure of the degree to which your background matches the competencies required. If, after this review, we determine that you inflated your qualifications and/or experience we can and will adjust your score to more accurately reflect your qualifications for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully as errors or omissions may affect your rating.  Secret Yes Noncritical-Sensitive (NCS)/Moderate Risk  Required DocumentsRequired DocumentsThe documents you are required to submit vary based on the authority you are using to apply (i.e., applying as a veteran, applying as a current permanent Federal employee, applying as a reinstatement, etc).Your complete application includes your COMPLETE resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and documents which prove your eligibility to apply. If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further.The following documents are REQUIRED1. Title: Information Technology Specialist (INFOSEC)

Company: US Department of Health And Human Services
Text: This position is located in the Food and Drug Administration (FDA), Office of Regulatory Affairs (ORA), Office of Information Systems Management (OISM). OISM manages operational Information Technology (IT) systems supporting ORA Programs such as Imports, Enforcement, Compliance, & Laboratory Systems operational activities. The IT Specialist will be responsible for the creation, maintenance, & management of IT technical & data architecture models & their lower level components. Identifies and assesses emerging, standing, complex, or precedent-setting issues and areas of improvement impacting Center operational procedures, policies, activities, and resources. Co-leads IT modernization and future technical and data architecture visions and technical initiatives Interprets, uses and applies information contained within the IT technical and data architectures to inform a range of business improvement activities, particularly those involved in the design, development, enhancement, and maintenance. Oversees the technical and/or data architecture and usability of all Center IT systems, monitors emerging enterprise architecture and data architecture trends and directions and makes recommendations accordingly. Serves as the liaison for industry, the Agency, the Department, and other Agencies on data architecture coordination. Provides policy and procedural consultation, advice, and guidance in areas of expertise on complex enterprise technical and data architecture design and implementation strategies. Leads working groups or technical steering groups to manage activities. 25% or less - You may be expected to travel for this position. No None Job family (Series)2210 Information Technology ManagementSimilar jobsInformation Technology Specialist (It Specialist) RequirementsRequirementsConditions of EmploymentCitizenship Requirement: You must be a U.S. Citizen to be considered for this advertisement unless explicitly stated otherwise. Selective Service Registration: All applicants born male, on (or after) 12/31/1959, must be registered with the Selective Service System OR have an approved exemption. Visit www.SSS.gov for more info. FDA participates in e-Verify: All new hires must complete the I-9 form; this information will be processed through e-Verify to determine your employment eligibility. You must meet ALL requirements by the closing date of this announcement to be considered. Only education, experience, and qualifications attained by this date will be considered. You must continue to meet all requirements through the hiring process. Certification of Accuracy: All information concerning eligibility and qualification is subject to investigation and verification. False representation may be grounds for non-consideration, non-selection, or appropriate legal action. Direct Deposit: You will be required to have all federal salary payments electronically deposited into a bank account with a financial institution of your choice. Additional selections may be made from this vacancy, within the same geographical area, by other organizational elements from within FDA, through shared corporate recruiting activities. One year probationary/ trial period may be required. NOTE: There is no education substitution for experience at the GS-14 grade level. We may make additional selections for similar positions across the entire Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) within the local commuting area(s) identified in this vacancy announcement. By applying, you agree to have your application shared with any interested selecting official(s) at HHS. There is no option to opt-out as your information will not be shared with other hiring agencies outside of HHS.For some advertisements, the Food & Drug Administration receives hundreds, even thousands, of applications from job-seekers. Title: Information Technology Specialist

Text: The DVSport team is looking for a passionate Senior Developer focused on mobile applications to join our team to build high-end Xamarin solutions in an Agile environment. The ideal person will have working experience across the entire development process (design, development, and deployment). You should be driven to provide quality solutions to challenging problems. You will work closely with stakeholders and engineers, architects, and thought leaders to design, build, and implement next-generation solutions. DVSport develops solutions for the sports industry including coaches, players, officials, scouts, and broadcasters, by leveraging video and analytics to assess and improve performance. Come join DVSport, Inc. and help build the next generation of cutting edge solutions for the sports industry. About Us:DVSport, Inc. is a software company based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania specializing in digital video acquisition, analysis, and play-back software designed specifically for the sports market. With over 2,350 systems deployed, DVSport has a strong customer base that spans the professional, intercollegiate, and high school sports market. Additionally, DVSport is the industry leader in HD Instant Replay solutions for professional and collegiate sports. DVSport is leading the way in developing innovative digital video solutions at all levels of competition for all sports and delivers proven solutions that have become the standard by which sports-related digital video analysis systems are measured. DVSport customers use their custom-designed software products on a daily basis to scout, analyze, review, and teach.What will you do: Stay ahead of the curve on emerging technologies and software products Optimize applications for maximum speed Design mobile-based features Provide technical leadership to ensure the implementation of architecture standards Design, develop, document, test, and debug new and existing applications for market sale Participate in a full development life cycle including requirements analysis and design Familiarity with Agile (e.g., Scrum Process) Consult with the stakeholders to prototype, refine, test, and debug programs to meet needs Establish and maintain good design practices and benchmarks and mentor others to hit those benchmarks. What We Look For: Ability to work with a team and independently Strong communication skills Experience leading small teams and projects Hunger to learn and creatively apply new technologies Comfortable working in an open, dynamic, rapidly changing environment where collaboration is crucial 4+ Years of hands-on experience in design, architect, developing and delivering mobile applications Cross platform Xamarin.Android, Xamarin.iOS and Xamarin.Forms applications development experience is a plus Xcode/Objective-C experience is a plus. Hands-on experience in design and architect mobile back-end services. Strong knowledge in C#.net Experience in designing and developing custom controls for Android, Windows, and iOS Solid foundation in data structures, algorithms, and object-oriented design Capabilities to write and execute unit test cases Agile/Scrum experience is desired Job Type: Full-time Pay: $100,000.00 - $120,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental Insurance Flexible Schedule Health Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location Fully Remote Company's website: www.dvsport.com Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Yes
Title: Senior Developer-Mobile Applications

Text: JOB REQUISITION  LOCATION  JOB DESCRIPTION Robert Half is seeking a Sr. Director, Information Security who will report to the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO). The role of the Sr. Director, Information Security is critical to the success of Robert Half and the Enterprise Information Security department in realizing its goals and objectives. This individual plays a key role as part of the Enterprise Information Security team in delivering and collaborating on all aspects of the information security program. The Sr. Director also represents the CISO and works closely with the executive leadership team of Robert Half’s business units as partner to ingrain security standards and best practices into their strategic planning and product development efforts.Specific responsibilities include: Security Operations Team Management Manage the Security Operations team by providing guidance/mentoring to achieve goals in accordance with established or emerging policies. Foster skill development, overall growth, efficiency, and effectiveness. This includes building a Security Operations Center with the capability to identify, analyze and react to cybersecurity threats using a reliable set of processes and technology solutions. These technology solutions are to include a next generation Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solution that aggregates security events and generate alerts for analysts to investigate. This next-generation SIEM tool should include User Entity Behavior Analytics (UEBA) and Security Orchestration and Automation (SOAR) capabilities Security Engineering Team Management Manage the Security Engineering team by providing guidance/mentoring to achieve goals in accordance with established or emerging policies. Foster skill development, overall growth, efficiency, and effectiveness. This team should be focused on the following:Build safe-by-default guardrails for engineers to use. Build and maintain product security strategy, roadmap, and metrics. Build and maintain product security strategy, roadmap, and metrics. Security governance with software security metrics, security OKRs for engineering teams and quarterly security service delivery reviews. Information Security Services Strategy Assist the CISO in their efforts to partner with corporate executives, business managers, audit, and/or legal counsel to understand corporate or project requirements in order to provide strategic direction in the formulation of requirements related to security and regulatory compliance. Assess the level of new/existing applications and/or technology infrastructure elements for compliance with enterprise security standards. Work with users, technical groups, internal & external auditors, and external contractors in order to develop, implement, and manage the overall enterprise corporate security process and policies for security strategy, privacy strategy, guidance and associated architecture and engineering standards. The security solutions must be flexible enough to sustain in a rapidly evolving decentralized business environment, while still preserving and enhancing system usability. Security Program Implementation Drives the implementation of the comprehensive information security program to ensure the integrity, confidentiality and availability of information owned, controlled, or processed by the organization. New Security application/technology acquisition Establish and monitor formal certification programs regarding enterprise security standards relating to the planned acquisition and/or procurement of new applications or technologies. Provide strategic direction for applications and/or technology environments review during the development or acquisitions process to assure compliance with corporate security policies/directions and the overall integration process. Security Breach/Incident Response Strategy Oversee the continuous monitoring and protection of RHI's existing information systems. Evaluate suspected security breaches and recommend corrective actions (including incidents involving outside vendors). Serve as the enterprise focal point for security incident response planning and execution. Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree 12+ Years Professional Work Experience in Information Security which includes 8+ Years Management Experience. Strong knowledge of IT management concepts and application of those in multiple IT environments. Excellent knowledge of Windows, Linux, SQL, Networking, Shell Scripting, PERL, PHP, TCP/IP, IDS, Firewall, eDiscovery, Cryptography, and Application Security CISSP and/or CISA, CISM, CIPP Special Training in SANS, ISC2 Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent presentation and team collaboration skills. Project management skills. Ability to collaborate and influence both technical and non-technical teams. At Robert Half, there’s more to us than what we do. Learn about our values and what it’s like to work for the largest specialized staffing firm in the world at our San Ramon, California, Corporate Services office. Take a look!  Follow us on Twitter @RH_Corp_Jobs for Robert Half Corporate Services job openings and career and workplace news!  Robert Half International Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veteran  As part of Robert Half’s Corporate Services facility employment process, any offer of employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background check.  Robert Half is committed to being an equal employment employer offering opportunities to all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to corporaterecruiting@roberthalf.com for assistance.  In your email please include the following: The specific accommodation requested to complete the employment application. The location(s) (city, state) to which you would like to apply.  To apply: You may apply for this position by email or regular mail. Please send your cover letter and resume to:  By email: corporaterecruiting@roberthalf.com  By mail: Corporate Staffing Robert Half 2613 Camino Ramon San Ramon, CA 94583-9128 JOB LOCATION ADDITIONAL LOCATION
Title: Sr. Director Security Engineering

Text: Job Description – System AdministratorReporting to Director of ITWe are currently seeking an analytical and detailed-oriented System Administrator to join our dynamic team to support store retail and enterprise systems.Position Overview Department: IT Job Classification: Exempt Reports To: Director of IT Operations Position Summary – The System administrator will be responsible for supporting the store and enterprise technology systems.Store Retail System Management Support store Point of Sale system operation. Ensure the proper function of payment processing, online order integration, data consolidation/transport and failover. Work closely with vendors to solve day-to-day issues while ensuring high system availability. Maintain POS system environments, manage system patching/update, monitor system health, and create/respond to alerts. Manage and support integration systems through automated scripts. Implement store networks including POS, payment, and guest-facing systems. Work with network vendors to build network segmentation, enforce PCI standards, deploy a backup failover connection, and maintain firewall policy. Enterprise System Management Support eCommerce and peripheral partner ecosystems. Proactively monitor system health, respond to system alerts, and support mission-critical core infrastructures such as networking, DNS, firewall, and VOIP. Support end-users. Administer email, Office 365, SharePoint, and other enterprise collaboration platforms. Deploy IT system and security standards. Perform routine maintenance, bug fix, QA, and deployment lifecycle. Technical Qualifications Experience using Point-of-Sale systems, either in a support or end-user capacity 2+ years of system administration experience. TCP/IP Networking, DNS, DHCP, Firewall, WAN, Wi-Fi. Log management systems, web application monitoring system, task automation system, endpoint management experience is a plus. MS SQL is a plus Scripting: Windows batch script or PowerShell is a plus. Enterprise System: Office 365, SharePoint, OneDrive is a plus. Physical Demands and Work Environment While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, talk and hear. Will occasionally have to stoop, kneel and crouch; and lift and/or move up to 45 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision and ability to adjust focus. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Flexible Spending Account Paid Time Off Schedule: Monday to Friday On Call Experience: system administration: 2 years (Required) Education: Associate (Preferred) Location: San Jose, CA 95110 (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Work Location: One location This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture This Company Describes Its Culture as: Aggressive -- competitive and growth-oriented Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Company's website: togos.com Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/togossandwiches Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19
Title: System Administrator

Text: Position Title:  Information Technology (IT) Department Assistant Department:  Information Technology Level:  Non-supervisory Reports To:  Chief Information Officer Job Classification:  Non-Exempt Job Type:  Full time Pay Rate:  Salary is based on qualifications and experience Position Summary: Under the supervision Chief Information Officer, the IT Department Assistant will be responsible for assisting our Data management specialist with inbound and outbound (EDI) electronic data exchange. Also, this role will provide telephone training, registration and support for Web site users. Additionally, this role will perform administrative and clerical duties for the IT department and provide entry level hardware/software troubleshooting along with on-boarding and off-boarding of employees. Essential Job Functions Retrieve and distributes EDI data files from health plan websites and FTP Submit outbound electronic medical claims to health plans and clearinghouses Create user accounts for new SCPMCS employees on requested health plan web sites. Accurately update spreadsheet for Data management specialist who creates the Secure login function and trains the users Provide Web site user support including password reset, new user profile setup, and new user telephone-based training Perform administrative and clerical duties for the IT department Manage printer supplies and repair requests Participates in regular and temporary teams as assigned by the Director of Information Technology Basic PC hardware / software troubleshooting Assist with on-boarding/ off-boarding of new employees Perform other duties as assigned, including cross training and coverage of the IT Department Position Qualifications and Requirements:  Proven ability to work with multiple projects with internal personnel and trading partners in a professional manner Excellent interpersonal skills are essential Proven organizational skills with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize work Strong written and verbal communication skills Must have an excellent disposition/attitude and ability to multi-task Must be authorized to work in the USA Must be able to speak/read/write English Ability to compose letters with emphasis on correct grammar, punctuation, etc Working knowledge of MS Office, Excel and Word, Access a plus Experience in supporting IT is a plus Benefits:  Medical, Dental and Vision insurance Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Life Insurance Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance 401k Retirement Plan Paid Time Off Program Four Day Work Week Job Type: Full-time Job Type: Full-time Pay: $15.50 - $18.99 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Dental Insurance Flexible Spending Account Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: 10 Hour Shift Experience: IT: 2 years (Preferred) Education: Associate (Required) Location: San Diego, CA 92121 (Required) Application Question: What are your salary expectations? Text: Contribute to the creation and execution of the Field IT budget pertaining to equipment, staffing, projects and support Establish and maintain business relationships with local management at field locations to understand and address their needs Escalation point for resolution of support and managerial incidents, demonstrate consistent ability to own issue resolution from start to finish; escalating where appropriate Assist internal customers with questions regarding the IT Organization Develop and maintain a relationship with Senior IT and business leadership Assist in solving issues with business applications through personal knowledge and by working with other team leaders Develop and manage vendor relationships according to contracts and service level agreements. Log and maintain support incidents in help desk software Document resolutions and repeatable fixes for frequent issues Assist in training end-users and fellow analysts using pre-defined processes Plan and manage support and deployment projects under direction of Field IT Manager Coordinate within Field IT team to ensure projects are successful and within budget Assign project tasks and responsibilities within the team environment where applicable Responsible for asset management, to include maintaining current inventory of devices, tracking devices, reclaiming devices no longer in use, etc. Establish performance and development objectives for IT Support Specialist staff members and perform regular reviews of those objectives Mentor and coach Field IT analysts to develop skills and competencies of Field IT team Follow existing development and change control standards; bridge the gap between business requirements and technical solutions to achieve optimal results Assist end-users in finding IT solutions for normal business activities; share ‘Best Practices’ in technology across the group Visit field locations as required to maintain FIT standard as the ‘Face of IT’ and action or escalate any key learnings Maintain 100% conformance to organizational hardware and software standards and 100% compliance with all corporate standard operating procedures Respond to network infrastructure and server failures as required to maintain the maximum system uptime of production systems and applications Participate in continuous improvement practices to ensure the delivery of effective, timely, and professional Technical and Customer Service. Support the planning and execution of IT hardware lifecycle management and ensure adherence to IT Capital asset standards and policies. Keep abreast of new technologies and act as a consultant to the rest of IT and the business on new trends and opportunities 24/7 support for business impacting P1 and P2 Incidents Other projects or duties as assigned Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Management Information System, Computer Science or related field 5 plus years of previous work-related experience working in a technical support environment. Proven ability to give direction, run a technical team, and work well under pressure Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the demonstrated ability to listen and to communicate effectively and persuasively with individuals, and in presentations to groups Must be analytical and detail-oriented with excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities Must have strong organization and interpersonal skills, in addition to excellent customer service skills and the ability to assist and train end-users Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions in a group setting Ability to provide remote support to end users over telephone or screen sharing Self-motivated with the ability to meet deadlines on multiple tasks Proficient in Microsoft Office Proficient with End User Devices – PC, Laptop, Tablets, Windows, Android, IOS Project Management experience Travel up to 40% This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test LAN/WAN Cisco experience Service Now, Service Desk Plus or other ITIL system knowledge Experience in distribution or manufacturing
Title: Field IT Supervisor - RCCB

Text: Administers and maintains production Support Services systems including print servers, desktop operating system images, device drivers, business applications, antivirus definitions, patch management, and configuration management Develops and implements plans, custom scripts, changes and testing procedures to ensure operational reliability with a structured approach Designs and implements systems that provide highly reliable user computing services in support of corporate business systems, acting both individually and as a part of a team Identifies opportunities and leads efforts to enhance service request and incident workflows to drive support efficiencies Performs research and provides recommendations for business technology related trends and advancements to IS Leadership Provides expert level technical support service, both remote and onsite, during the normal and extended working hours while adhering to SLA guidelines; Managing and documenting work in the IS Support Request system Actively participates in the selection and management of third-party vendors, proactively making recommendations where appropriate Develops, writes, and publishes processes and procedures in their assigned area to ensure consistent practices relevant to today’s business throughout the department and organization; ensures materials and documents are up-to-date, easy to access Trains employees in the use of new software and hardware developed and/or acquired Conducts research and attends webinars, seminars, and courses in their area of expertise and uses gained knowledge to continually improve their knowledge, skills, and abilities Assists with management of the enterprise hardware computing assets and software licensing Stays current with technological developments in systems administration; recommends system controls and best-practice protocols Conducts periodic audits on an aspect of the Support services area of concentration and is responsible for holding themselves and peers accountable for compliance to established standards and timelines Other duties may be assigned High school diploma required Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, OR a degree in a STEM discipline (science, technology, engineering, and mathematics) or equivalent training/experience Minimum 8 years’ related experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience with Intel-based client systems (Windows PCs and Windows OS) and network peripherals Strong customer service orientation Ability to prioritize and quickly resolve issues Excellent written and verbal communication skills; communicate technical/complex information Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to adapt quickly to new technologies, changing business requirements Intellectual curiosity with clear and logical way of approaching tasks Ability to multitask and synthesize information from multiple sources Able and willing to collaborate in a cross-functional team Respond to emergency situations effectively and exhibits poise and focus Organize and document complex system design activities and configure systems to be consistent with institutional policies/procedures Ability to quickly troubleshoot problems that may arise in technical tools and applications Experience using help desk ticketing software, incident troubleshooting and escalation processes Understand emerging technology and end-user needs Working knowledge of Active Directory and Group Policy Strong knowledge of the Microsoft Office / Office Working knowledge of Network Infrastructure including IPV4, IPV6, DHCP, DNS and VLANs Experience with System Center Config Manager and scripting skills (Powershell, VBScript, .Net) preferred Acts in a manner reflective of the Company culture of High Moral Standards, Innovation and Continuous Evolution, Trust in Team, Continuous Improvement, and Sustainable Relationships Communicates, interacts, and works effectively with others; receptive to feedback and coaching; voices concerns in a constructive manner Demonstrates commitment to safety first; communicates safety concerns; promotes a safe work environment based on established safety standards and training Follows all Company policies and procedures Nearest Major Market: Stockton
Title: Support Services Engineer

Text: Guild Mortgage Company, closing loans and opening doors since 1960. As a mortgage banking firm we are dedicated to serving the home owner/buyer. Our goal is to provide affordable home financing for our customers, utilizing the best terms available while providing a level of professionalism and service unsurpassed in the lending industry.  Position Summary  The Branch Administrative Assistant I plays an important role in the organization by performing a number of tasks related to the branch’s administrative functions. The role is primarily responsible, under general supervision, for performing full administrative and reception duties in support of the branch office by providing customer service, answering calls, handling information requests, ordering supplies and performing clerical functions such as preparing correspondence, copying, filing, faxing, mailing and scheduling meetings. Essential Functions  Welcome visitors by greeting them, making sure they are comfortable, and directing them to the appropriate party. Answer incoming calls, provide responsive and courteous service to callers by providing information or routing them to the appropriate party as needed. Maintain up-to-date employee directory. Provide assistance to Branch Manager and Branch Operations Manager as needed. Collect, sort, and correctly distribute incoming mail and packages; log all packages per branch procedure. Assist in the preparation and delivery of mailings as needed. Maintain office supplies inventory by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed supplies; placing and expediting orders for supplies; verifying receipt of supplies. Partner with IT helpdesk and assist in the troubleshooting of basic office technology issues. Assist walk-in applicants by handing out employment applications and directing them to Guild’s employment website. Perform general clerical duties and office support, to include, but not limited to: photocopying, faxing, mail distribution and filing. Make copies and prepare other deliverables for meetings and marketing campaigns. Maintain a tidy and comfortable office space by picking up waste, watering plants, tidying kitchen area, refreshing magazines, etc. Monitor, reconcile, and respond to appraisal and credit report invoice discrepancies. Coordinate events, meetings, and conferences with cross-functional departments; prepare agendas and set-up meeting facilities as needed. Perform other duties as assigned. Qualifications  High school diploma or equivalent preferred, along with a minimum of one year experience in an administrative assistant related role(s). Prior experience in Mortgage lending, Finance, or similar field preferred. Ability to type 60-70 wpm. Passionate about delivering excellence in customer service. High levels of diplomacy, tact, and confidentiality a must. Demonstrated patience and professionalism when interacting with both internal and external customers. Proficiency with data entry, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required. Ability to organize and manage multiple priorities simultaneously. Excellent verbal and written communication required; excellent spelling, grammar, and punctuation skills. Self motivated with a strong attention to detail. Ethical, with a commitment to company values. Supervision  General supervision required, depending on experience Apply sound judgment in execution of core job responsibilities Travel: 0% Requirements Physical: Work is primarily sedentary; general office mobility. The position requires the ability to occasionally lift office equipment and supplies weighing up to 20 pounds. Manual Dexterity: Frequent use of computer keyboard and mouse. Audio/Visual: Ability to accurately interpret sounds and associated meanings at a volume consistent with interpersonal conversation. Regularly required to accurately perceive, distinguish and interpret information received visually and through audio; e.g., words, numbers and other data broadcasted aloud/viewed on a screen, as well as print and other media. Environmental: Office environment – no substantial exposure to adverse environmental conditions. Guild offers a pleasant work environment, competitive compensation and excellent benefits package; including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, AD&D, LTD and 401(k) with employer match.Guild Mortgage Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Title: Branch Administrative Assistant I

Text: Requirements Associate's degree in computer science or applicable field (i.e. Nursing, Health Care Administration, Business, Medicine, or affiliated health profession) and one year work related experience in the information technology field or applicable field (i.e. Nursing, Health Care Administration, Business, Medicine, or affiliated health profession); OR Two years work related experience in the information technology field or applicable field (i.e. Nursing, Health Care Administration, Business, Medicine, or affiliated health profession) Preferred: Experience supporting an Electronic Health Record in a clinical setting, preferably EpicCare. Title: Support Analyst, EHR

Text: Our Motel 6 in Walnut Creek, CA is now Hiring for the Manager on Duty (MOD) position! This position works alongside the General Manager to provide a clean and comfortable room for our guests with great customer service. Apply today, all qualified applicants will be interviewed! About the role: Come join a company that has been growing rapidly and outperforming the market segment over the last 5 years. G6 Hospitality, which represents the Motel 6 and Studio 6 brand has initiated a system-wide renovation effort, invested in technology and has expanded globally. Specifically, within the Human Resources team we have recently made new investments in technology to better support our team members and put a greater focus on talent management, career pathing and development. What you will be doing... The Manager on Duty or MOD role serves as an apprentice to the General Manager, and operates as a second in command. The MOD supervises the property when the GM is not present, ensuring the work environment remains positive and productive. We are dedicated to providing you a safe environment and giving you the training to help you excel in your role. Lastly, it is difficult to find any environment that offers the room for growth, defined career paths and stability that we offer our Team Members. The “top six @6” People excellence – exhibits a heart for service with dedication to customer service and teamwork. Product excellence – Assist the GM in managing the standards and procedures of the company through effective planning and organizing. Guest excellence – lead by example by providing great guest experience while ensuring all Team Members do the same. Leadership excellence – Supervision of the staff in the absence of the GM, which could include recruiting, training and scheduling Team Members. Team Member relations – Assist the GM in maintaining positive Team Member relations at the property, responding to concerns and taking action. Financial Accountability – Assist the GM in achieving targeted financial objectives. What we are searching for... The MOD role offers an opportunity to refine your leadership and business skills while taking on management responsibilities. To do so requires: Holds a deep heart for service. Independent discretion and judgment. Ability to supervise, train and motivate team members. Jack of all trades. Resourceful. Ongoing communication with the General Manager to address any opportunities. We feel the successful candidate has these qualifications and experience: High school diploma or equivalent is required with an Associates or Bachelor’s degree preferred. Computer efficiency with Windows, Outlook and MS Word and Excel. Ability to work nights, weekends, and holidays. Valid driver’s license. Ability to complete the MOD training and certification process. Ability to work safely. Ability to meet all employment qualifications at the time of hire. What it’s like at G6:At G6 Hospitality our Team Members...… Explore a fulfilling career path full of possibilities. Learn from the best and brightest people in the hospitality industry. Connect with the community, employees and leadership. Are authentic and are appreciated for who they are. Smile and have someone smile back at them. What will you have room to do?? Job Type: Full-time Pay: $15.50 - $16.75 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Dental Insurance Employee Assistance Program Employee Discount Health Insurance Paid Time Off Vision Insurance Schedule: Day shift Holidays Monday to Friday Night Shift Weekends Supplemental Pay: Bonus Pay Experience: Management: 2 years (Required) License: Driver's License (Required) Language: Spanish (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Required) Company's website: 6jobs.com Work Remotely: No
Title: Motel 6 Manager on Duty

Text: JOB SUMMARY The Academic Affairs Coordinator directly supports the Dean of Instruction and Dean of Career Technical Education through coordination with other offices and outside partners, project management, research and reports, clerical support, and other departmental and college needs as assigned. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to satisfactorily perform each essential duty. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform the position description satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. · Track and coordinate faculty deliverables. · Perform project management related to program deliverables. · Proactively deliver innovative solutions to achieve superior customer service. · Develop and maintain an in-depth understanding of the functionality of the Jenzabar student system. · Respond to urgent requests with flexibility and cooperation. · Proactively deliver innovative solutions to achieve superior customer service. · Handle confidential and time-sensitive material appropriately. · Provide technology support for the daily activities for the Office of the Deans. · Serve as liaison between Deans, department leads, and other departments to gather information to respond appropriately to program requirements and student issues/concerns. · Assist with composing and editing correspondence for the Deans. · Answer telephone calls, screens or forwards calls, providing information as needed, taking messages, and scheduling appointments as appropriate. · Manage Deans’ schedules including planning meetings, appointments, travel, and calendar. * NON-ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES · Contributes to various special assignments as needed by department and/or institution. · Serves on College committees, as assigned. · Other duties as assigned. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES NEEDED TO PERFORM THIS ROLE · Flexibility as a self-starter who takes initiative and accountability for projects: sound judgement, and the ability to make independent decisions with minimal supervision. · Proficient and accurate typing skills with the ability to use Microsoft Office Suite including strong Excel skills. · Strong organizational skills that reflect ability to perform and prioritize multiple tasks seamlessly with excellent attention to detail. · Ability to work with others in a group or team and remain flexible despite interruptions and/or changes to priorities and/or job duties. · Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships with all employees, executives, and external partners, and the ability to maintain composure under pressure while interacting with others. · Excellent written and verbal business communication skills. · Openness and interest in engaging with new technologies. · Ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment and respond with precision and accuracy. · Ability to interact effectively with diverse members of the institutional community and outside constituencies including the Board and community partners. · Fluency in Spanish preferred. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE · Completion of bachelor’s degree or other relevant college-level course work is preferred. · Prior experience working in an academic setting that included conducting research, managing projects, and preparing written reports and/or correspondence. PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS · May occasionally lift, carry, stoop, and bend (up to 20 lbs.). · Frequently moving from stationary sitting positions to standing and walking. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $36,480.00 - $54,720.00 per year Benefits: Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Employee Assistance Program Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Retirement Plan Tuition Reimbursement Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: One location Typical start time: 8PM Typical end time: 5PM Company's website: https://www.klamathcc.edu/en-US/Home Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/klamathcc/ Work Remotely: No
Title: Academic Affairs Coordinator

Text: We are LAUSD. We are at the forefront of innovation in public schools, with the serious work of tailoring the learning environment to better serve our community. Here, you will have the opportunity to exercise your potential in the business of education. We are technical professionals, skilled workers, support staff, executives, and community champions. We do our jobs with a sense of integrity, accountability, and pride in shaping the future. Our contributions here impact our number one customers - the 600,000 plus K-12 students of LAUSD. With over 1,000 job titles to choose from, build your rewarding career here by joining nearly 30,000 employees, and achieve new levels of success in your career! Department or School Site There are currently three vacancies in the IT Customer Support Branch. Project The IT Customer Service Support Representative receives telephone calls, faxes, electronic mail, and chat requests from school and office personnel requesting technical support regarding computer software and hardware problems and electronic/computer equipment repair, replacement and maintenance. Benefits Insurance: Paid premiums for your choice of several medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans. Retirement: Membership in the California  Public Employee Retirement System (CalPERS). Vacation: Two weeks of paid vacation to start. Three weeks after five years of year-round paid service. Paid Holidays: 12 days. Positions in this class are offered on a B (10/year) basis. Job Duties/Responsibilities An It Customer Support Representative provides first-level technical support to school and office personnel regarding software and hardware problems or Information Technology Division supported applications; coordinates the repair, replacement and maintenance of electronic/computer equipment, networked devices and related information technologies; diagnoses problems and researches solutions; and uses diplomacy and interpersonal skills to extract pertinent information and assist callers. The typical duties of an IT Customer Support Representative are as follows: - Provides first-level Helpdesk services for client problems and support. - Provides technical support and records incident details (such as customer contact, incident specifications, resolution or referral information) into the District’s IT Service Management system.- Provides first-call problem resolution when appropriate. - Works with other team members to resolve problem tickets. - Communicates trouble call status to customer. - Provides status to call center management on mission critical application outages. - Provides Helpdesk support for new systems and special projects. - Uses Knowledge Base component of help desk system to diagnose system malfunctions or application issues. - Enters problem resolution information into Helpdesk system, closes the problem, and informs the customer when the problem is resolved. - May dispatch District field support personnel to customer site. This class description is not a complete statement of essential functions, responsibilities, or requirements. Entrance requirements are representative of the minimum level of knowledge, skill, and/or abilities. To the extent permitted by law, management retains the discretion to add or change typical duties of a position at any time, as long as such addition or change is reasonably related to existing duties. Minimum Requirements PROMOTIONAL STATUS IS REQUIRED. You must be a current or retired employee of LAUSD with 130 paid days in regular status in the Classified Service or permanent status in the Certificated Service or have been laid-off within the past 39 months from a regular, permanent  LAUSD position in which you passed probation. Laid-off employees' eligibility as a promotional candidate expires at the end of their 39 month period; as such, laid-off employees applying for promotional career opportunities may not be eligible to complete the assessment process or may be removed from the employment eligibility list once their eligibility as a promotional candidate expires. ENTRANCE QUALIFICATIONS EDUCATION: Graduation from high school or evidence of equivalent educational proficiency, preferably supplemented by courses in computer science. EXPERIIENCE: One year of experience within the past five years in the operation of a computer hotline or help desk system, utilizing a multi-processing operating system receiving calls per day regarding computer and communications infrastructure (mainframes, client-server, LAN and WAN, Microsoft Windows or Apple OS, office productivity tools, telecommunications network, and mobile computing devices) or Information Technology Division supported software applications. A Microsoft Certified Professional Certificate (MCP) and/or experience working with PC hardware and software problem diagnosis and repair is preferable. Desirable Qualifications The ideal candidate for this position will have knowledge of: - Best Customer Service practices and the measurement (metrics) of those practices - Various office software applications, including Word, Excel, Access, and PowerPoint Information Technology services and how they are provided - Concepts and uses of personal computer, mainframe computer, and tablet operating systems - General office practices and procedures A IT Customer Support Representative must have the ability to perform the following:: - Work independently, exercise initiative and good judgment - Analyze data and draw logical conclusions - Plan, organize, track and coordinate work to meet deadlines - Multi-task, function in a fast-paced unstructured environment with frequent changes - Remain calm and pleasant under stressful situations - Enter relevant data into a computer while conversing on the telephone Organize files and maintain accurate records Work effectively with other District employees, students, and the public  - Communicate effectively orally and in writing - Listen and communicate effectively with customers Employment Selection Process The selection process may consist of one or more the following: a written test tentatively schedule for the first or second week of September, and a technical interview which is tentatively scheduled for the 3rd or 4th week in September. Please be sure to include correspondence from @lausd.net as an approved sender so that messages aren't accidentally placed into your spam/junk e-mail folder. We anticipate receiving a number of well qualified applicants for this position; therefore, there will be a competitive process. The hiring departments have requested that we proceed with the selection process in an expeditious and timely manner. To honor this request we will be adhering to a pre-planned employment assessment schedule. For up-to-date information about test dates, check your email regularly for updates testing dates may change. If you are unable to attend the scheduled dates, there is no guarantee that we will be able to approve requests to reschedule. For more information about the LAUSD employment assessment process, visit the 'My LAUSD Career' section of our website at http://www.lausdjobs.org . Application Process DO YOU NEED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH THE ON-LINE APPLICATION? Please visit www.lausdjobs.org and click on "help desk service request form" located to the left of the Quick Links. To find out whether the application deadline has been extended, visit the website at: http://www.lausdjobs.org . The Los Angeles Unified School District intends that all qualified persons shall have equal opportunities for employment and promotion. Reasonable accommodations in completing an application and testing are available to individuals with disabilities. Please call (213) 241-3455 for more information. Additional Posting Information Selection and promotion are based on a competitive employment assessment process. Candidates who pass all parts of the assessment process are placed on a hiring (eligibility) list based on their assessment score. Hiring departments may make job offers to candidates on the top  three ranks of the hiring list. Eligibility typically lasts for 12 months. The hiring list resulting from this assessment process may be used to fill open positions in related job classifications.
Title: IT Customer Support Representative

Text: Our Expert Delivery team within Small Business Customer Success is focused on efficiently delivering awesome experiences that expand value for our customers. Leadership - you have inspired and led teams, with 10+ years leading organizations that support human-assisted operations at scale in domains such as sales, customer support or professional services. You are a coach that embraces empowerment, accountability and a high-performance culture. Business Acumen - You have had P&L accountability, with a clear understanding of business levers and implications. Experience Design & Continuous Improvement: You have envisioned, designed and deployed new products, processes, experiences or work strategies that significantly improved cost, quality, service or speed. You have leveraged product management, process excellence/BPR and technology to transform and optimize experiences. Data & Analysis: Strong analytical skills…ability to quickly assess performance, identify opportunities & patterns, and implement solutions. Strategist: Develop, implement and execute transformational plans and strategies over multiple horizons. You leverage industry learning, trends and best practices coupled with deep customer & expert insights within your strategies. Data-Driven: You’re a data-driven leader and supports the organization with actionable insights that help with ‘the penny drop’, ‘the light bulb switching on’, and other “a-ha!” moments. You connect dots and teach the organization how to leverage data in decision making. Champion: you are obsessed with our customer’s experience, and with the experience of the experts that serve them. You advocate for and champion their voice. Influencer: You engage and communicate to inspire action and alignment - with clarity, simplicity, and a passion for our customers’ success and expert’s experience. You drive and manage change within and beyond your organizational boundaries
Title: Director of Service Operations & Business Intelligence, SBSEG Customer Success
